RirLmgVxj3v1Nn1zGsGEcA.text: Ate here on my wedding weekend a few years back. Went with the family & it was SO good that the hubby & I went back the next night!  Yes, it's $ expensive but in general if your going to eat at a nice restaurant on the strip it's gonna cost a lot.

1zCA-LEU2gVhoILafNKLLw.text: Rao's has several dinning rooms in sort of a circular arrangement. Our dining experience was in the room adjacent to the Caesars Pool & Gardens. This room is bright as it has many windows . The other dining rooms are interior and do not have windows and a dark atmosphere. We arrived 10 minutes prior to our reservation time. The hostess checked us in, asked to be seated in the vestibule and stated that we would be seated at our reservation time. The dining room was not very busy and we were seated at a nice table adjacent to a window overlooking the pool and gardens.  Our server Matt was friendly and attentive. He was very familiar with the menu and provided  us with a description of the specials and some recommendations. Follow up though out was timely.  A starter was an order of baked  Little Neck Clams. Six clams topped with bread crumbs and oregano and served with a wedge of lemon. Overall they were very tasty but one was chewy.  The meatballs are listed as a side but the order of two is more than enough as an entree. The Meatballs are made with Ground Veal, Pork and Beef, Italian Breadcrumbs and Seasonings in a wonderful Marinara Sauce. The order of buttery mashed potatoes was also enough for two people. The OssoBuco, Braised Veal Shank  Veal Jus, Gremolatta, served over Saffron Risotto  is one of the best in town. The OssoBuco is a complete meal in itself, no other sides required.  Desert must wait for a return visit.

yDkC15f9yMDYwhYxHK2Cnw.text: Came here because this is one of the BF's favorite restaurants on the Strip. They were having a 50 year celebration at the time and had a special menu going with it. The BF ordered off the regular menu, had the pork chops and the famous meatballs. I ordered from the special menu, I had the caprese salad, salmon, and tiramisu. BF loved his pork chop, finished it right up and loved the meatballs. I tried both and they were excellent. The caprese salad was very good and the salmon was good. The tiramisu was really good as well. The service was excellent and we would definitely return again when visiting Vegas again.

Jh1EQYdqVi2FQlZUMYIgNg.text: My friend had to go due to all the hype about the seafood salad so we dropped a wad for mediocre food.  Salad was good but nothing to write home about.  My husband had the linguine and clams which was tasteless. I had the lemon chicken which was tasty.  Tart with a great amount of char.  White meat was dry for me.  We had an $18 order of meatballs which were good.   I don't need to come here ever again.  Way over priced and not that good.  My Italian husband's cooking is far superior.

k6A2QvCacWCW_tB5TVZ5OQ.text: If I owned Rao's I would take a trip down to Vegas immediately for some quality control.  The good: the ambiance is fine. The "outdoor" seating was very pleasant. I ordered the shrimp fra diavolo and it was good. Just that. Good. The shrimp was cooked well the slices of garlic were a nice touch but the tomato sauce tasted like Supermarket brand.   The bad: my boyfriend ordered the lasagna. There was easily over a pound and a half of sloppy, falling-apart lasagna on a plate. It was a mush. No defined layers no distinct sauces or cheeses just a mix of ingredients that resembled a scramble. It was terrible. He sent it right back to the kitchen and didn't even ask for a second dish.   The ugly: the waitress took the dish and left. She didn't care to try to make it right or send a manager to talk to us or anything. She gave us an attitude throughout the night and I rushed to eat my shrimps while my boyfriend sat there.   A restaurant of this magnitude and importance should not settle for mediocre service. Avoid this place at all cost. It is NOT worth it!

0R1Xw5W2-OWBGx6C1b78pg.text: My boyfriend had been wanting to go here for years because he had heard about how amazing the one in NY is. In fact, I just told him that I'm writing this review and he said, "How many stars are you giving them? Good. It's a crap restaurant."  Service was okay.  Here's our feedback on what we ordered: Calamari: Could have been the calamari at a $ restaurant in my opinion and we have calamari just about everywhere we go. Paying $$$ for it was silly. Beet salad: Fine House salad: Fine Eggplant parm: Terrible. It came out with a small dollop of marinara on top of it and definitely needed a lot more. And getting my hands on some while it still mattered proved difficult. Lamb chops: According to the boyfriend, "Yeah, they were alright."  After building this place up in his mind and therefore vicariously in mine, we were very disappointed. No going back.

pGjx2JAmQMQydC9zJBN6bA.text: This was a disappointing experience.  This was our third time eating at Rao's.  Our waiter, Ricky,  was unattentive and rude.  We had a table of six and he only took drink orders from a few of us.  We waited too long after getting our menus to order.  We inquired about getting 3 separate checks and instead of explaining their policy of separating checks 4 equal ways, with a long face he complained about what a time consuming difficulty that would be for him.  Then asked if we still wanted separate checks.  I ordered filet mignon medium rare and fingerling potatoes.   My steak arrived well done and  I sent the steak back and the replacement came back rare, I didn't send it back again.  Also, it was not a filet mignon, it was tough and it was more likely a tenderloin.  The potatoes were very dry as though they were warmed leftovers, by then I was just done with the restaurant and the lack of attention from our waiter that I didn't bother sending those back.  The one bright spot was the meatball appetizer.  We won't be back after this experience.

reaJ4_tjzeGI6MrqO3UhBw.text: I ordered the lemon chicken is just perfect!! Tender, juicy and lemony. I also orders the broccoli rave yummy!! I just wish came de boned. My husband ordered the pork chop which was generous in size. Was cooked to perfection, tender and juicy in the middle. Service was excellent. We were with a large group and took good care of all of us. Will definitely comeback when visiting Vegas again!

SMaM66zbV5dHBnXOrcfrew.text: Wandered in after stroll around Caesars looking for food.  Sat at the bar and the bartender immediately greeted me and offered a menu. He said the meatballs were the signature dish so that was what i ordered. I give the meatballs a a 10 out of 10. Real authentic, Italian meatballs in incredible marinara sauce. I then ordered the Veal Piccata and give it a 8 out of 10. Great atmosphere, service and food!

X6e1ZUZf35wgJ7eL5AFE9A.text: Hands down- best food in Vegas. Our server was great, the food was spot on. Lasagna was amazing, and the shells and cheese

Y2YRXG76EMwPnSZC6U4L5w.text: I was a guest at Caesars palace and the restaurant Rao's is located inside the palace so I went to have dinner there with a friend we walk in and the host told us there's a 30min wait or we can seat a the bar and order food from there so I stated that's fine I will order dinner from the bar so the waiter came up to us and asked if we wanted some bread while we looked at the menu we said yes and he brought us the bread then like 20mins of us seating at the bar the bartender told me that I was not following the restaurant dress code because I was wearing a baseball cap of the San Antonio Spurs so I either take my cap off or leave the restaurant so I told her I am not taking the cap off for anyone this is America and I serviced 7 years in the MARINE CORPS and I will not take my cap off and I would just leave I feel that the cap wasn't the problem I believe that my race was the problem because I appear LATINO little do they know I am mix-race NATIVE AMERICAN- MEXICAN -FRENCH -AND -ITALIAN and I am PROUD of being who I am but I will never set foot or even take anyone to go eat there or any RAO's if you are military active or veteran please don't go and dine at this restaurant

T2sVjvMZ1iTNHftjyl9uGg.text: Such a great restaurant for so many reasons! Service was impeccable with great personalities. We loved the music playing in the background and the food, where to begin?! The veal parmesan was to die for as well as the tiramisu, bruschetta, and Italian wine! Best dinner we've had in years! Thank you Rao! (Rao Las Vegas)

BLvJFARvg_hMBNFmWincVw.text: My husband took me there for my birthday,  we had the best lasagna ever. My husband really enjoyed the clam pasta,  and we went back again for more a few days later, we had the lasagna again of course and the veal parmisan.

photos.caption: Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Clam pasta
Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried calamari
Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veal parmisan

-ojnKEce9gRfIcAm8bA3YQ.text: My husband and I were very disappointed. We ordered "best thing I ever ate" items, Lasagna and Lemon Chicken. Where was the pasta in the lasagna? It was just a blob of meat sauce and cheese. Why was the char-grilled chicken not charred, but burnt? And the wine list is so overpriced with very limited options under $200. Customer service was mediocre at best. We thought this was a slam dunk for food quality, but we were wrong. We will go back to Martaronos (Paris Hotel) next time. Martaronos was great in every way!

pjBTuWUTEzt4BwsqpWzZAQ.text: 5 stars to the best service we had in Vegas.  The food was good but the service is what made this a 5 star experience.  This was a special b-day dinner and everything was perfect.  We had some appetizers, a pasta and shared the main course.    The meatballs are a definite must have and the seafood salad was delicious. We had a little rigatoni afterwards and ate every single noodle!  Then came the Veal Milanese split in two without ever asking.  Then came the complimentary special cake...look at the pic...yes it was that amazing!!!  Our waiter was great with a sense of humor.  We couldn't have asked for a more special evening.

photos.caption: Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Special bday cake
Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veal Milanese
Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rigatoni

uvVbX1__sUliWQhlWrlYvQ.text: Way over priced average food. Good service. Think of Olive garden but triple the price. Las Vegas is forcing people to go off the strip to get good food at a decent price. Sad, it didn't use to be like this.

yzSUlzkR6Ji64aUGDG0VhQ.text: I am actually confused as to why Rao's doesn't have a higher overall rating on Yelp.  I have visited the Rao's in Las Vegas twice now.  Both times have been a True delight.  Reservations were a breeze to make and both times we were sat immediately.  The service is truly awesome.  Every person was attentive, friendly, and accommodating.  The menu is mostly traditional Italian with a few newer dishes added in for good measure.  The Caprese Salad is one of the freshest and tastiest I have ever eaten.  The eggplant parm was delicious.  However, the ravioli purses are definitely one of the most amazing entrees I have ever eaten.  The grilled veggies were a great accompaniment to the entrees.  The dessert menu (if you still have room for it!) is wonderful.  I highly suggest giving this restaurant a go.  You will not be disappointed.

a9CBrlRHM0X7nSJTLI1Dew.text: So since I will NEVER get into NYC Raos....really was excited to have opportunity to try Vegas version.....and yes, it was excellent....not life changing mind you...but really good.  Had the Osso Buco....which also had some really great and abundant marrow....over risotto....yummmm. Also had the meatballs, which were as good as meatballs get...and a side of pasta Bolognese....lovely....  Great atmosphere in most of restaurant....but we were seated in the kinda generic, too lit section...why not make it all dark and clubby? Service was top notch though.  Again, expectations were so very high given the hype this place garners....and it was very very good....but there are many places in Chicago, St. Louis and Brooklyn that are better....  Still though,,,,when in Vegas...go here.....very pleased.

WrzVFvDjfppa9Qvtqq5dSw.text: My family has eaten here twice now and both times have been wonderful experiences. The staff is one of the friendliest and most accommodating of any place I've been to in Vegas. My wife and I shared the lasagna and a side of mashed potatoes. Lasagna was perfectly seasoned and full of flavor. I feel like it came right out of a grandmother's kitchen. Mashed potatoes were smooth and buttery. Another at our table had he ravioli purses in brown butter. That was an incredible plate of food. Based on my sample, I'd order that next time. If you're looking for incredible Italian-American food, this is the spot for you.

LuMxuZdkPooQmudJVIb1xQ.text: Such simple dishes yet so magnificently done! Meatball and pasta! Fried cheese with toast, caprese salad, tiramisu. All good stuff! Highly recommend it as it was a comfort food experience done right!!!!!!

VVOiaXPmh40aXyc4MJgXww.text: Started off with a nice house salad which was fairly large.  I went with the taglioline pasta because the server mentioned that was the only pasta made in house.  I'm usually not a fan of non red sauce pastas but this was very good.

BEPKPV2Hd1siQ4vPT0EWhg.text: Meh...  After an hour an a half wait at the bar, (wondering why there was an empty table behind us the whole time), and looking through all the "awards" on the walls, the verdict:  Food was OK - nothing to write home about.    It's your average Italian joint, but with a long as* wait.  Not sure I'd go back, especially when there are plenty of great places to eat in Vegas...

5INvfxm3VvFY-SssEnI8zg.text: Inexpensive compared to the other restaurants in Caesar's, but still pricey for pasta. I came here for some comfort food and have given up on the NYC location, mere mortal that I am.  I had the Tagliolini with Peas & Ham - described as "Fresh-made tagliolini pasta, prosciutto cotto, sweet peas, diced shallots, light cream sauce." Was it ever. You can taste the fresh and the sauce was light and flavorful at the same time. My escort had the Shell Pasta with Ricotta Sauce - large shell pasta in red sauce with a gloop of ricotta to bring it all together. Delicious! We split the ground veal/pork/beef meatballs, which were very good. He would describe them as very *very* good.  Definetly full at the end of the meal. Of course I liked it, but it's pasta - what's not to like? Maybe how the NY scene raves about this place... maybe the Vegas real estate... conspired to affect my expectations. It was good, yes. It did not blow me away. I wouldn't recommend it .. but I wouldn't NOT recommend it either, make sense? Definetly not horrific but not superb, either. It's just sort of ... there.

7dKpnYY8rm_yCxiES-LPOg.text: The food was ok....although I was very disappointed in the clams oreganata appetizer (the clams were too rubbery). The prices are very high for Italian food, and there are many other Italian restaurants in Vegas where the food is better at almost half the price. But if your staying at Caesars, and don't feel like traveling, you should be able to get a decent meal at this place....as long as you don't mind paying premium prices

BjjSehWHYRRmTuXEy65vUg.text: Went to Rao's tonight, absolutely craving the mussels as I had already previewed the menu online before...only to find out that they were not serving mussels tonight because they were bad??!! So went for the bruschetta, which was very good! Then ordered main course of beef lasagna, excellent with one exception... It came to us luke warm! Expected it to be piping hot, as every lasagne I have ever ordered is. Probably will never go back as it is pricey and I expected more!

14JgNhoD7Uy1Afy2MPX0Yg.text: So over rated. Small portions of average, very expensive food. $48 for the Veal Milanese, which consisted of three tiny pieces of veal, covered in salad. Only go here if you absolutely, positively need to get ripped off. Much better places to eat nearby

biWUuhzEkJByvHvEptiDDw.text: We walked in without reservations so it was a 30 minute wait at 7PM on a Thursday before July 4th weekend. Sat in the bar and ordered a martini which was mixed very well.  After 20 minutes we were asked if we wanted to eat in the bar despite the fact that the dining rooms were not that filled.  No thank you miss hostess, please seat us in a dining room. We were seated in the dining room facing the garden, very light and nicely decorated in a NY/Las Vegas Italian style. Based on fellow yelpers we ordered the beet salad which was very fresh, meatballs that were light and not overly seasoned, lemon chicken that was succulent and with a hint of lemon and dessert with cake and berries. Served family style so basically you share.  All really a great meal, will probably go back to try the other dishes.

2xCk5yod0OPT7RiDY3dK7Q.text: First thing I noticed - it's October 1st and we're covered in Christmas decorations.. WTF.. just a little odd.   Odd decorations aside, the food was good. I was here for a business dinner and we got to try practically everything on the menu as part of this set menu, so please excuse the fact that I don't remember the names of everything I tried!  Course 1 : Salad - blah Calamari - perfect Caprese Salad - one of the best I've ever eaten. Their homemade mozzerella was to die for !   Course 2: Smoked salmon pasta: I'm a salmon person but this stuff reeked of salmon. Super fishy. Not very good.  Pasta with sausage: Sausage was very tasty. Pasta was undercooked. None of the pasta tasted homemade. Maybe it is but I'm a bad pasta taster.. but if it's homemade, they suck at making pasta.   Course 3:  Veal parmesan - My fiance's favorite dish of the evening. It was perfectly pounded, perfectly breaded and with just the right amount of cheese. Their red sauce is incredible.  Fresh fish of the day - seemed to be salmon again. This time it was well prepared and good. Nothing exciting here, just fish they didn't screw up.  Lemon chicken - Way too lemony for anyone at my table. This was served family style and 8 of us didn't even come close to finishing one order of it.   Course 4: Canoli - the nastiest canoli ever. Some of us were spitting them out (yes, at a business dinner - it was that gross). It tasted like medicine. NO idea WTF they put in this crap.  Fresh berries and cream - hard to screw that up.  Apple tart - DELISH. We were fighting over this.   The Rao's signature Cianti is also worth mentioning - quite good. We noticed meatballs weren't on the set menu and the server was kind enough to bring us some. These were the highlight of the evening! Best meatball I've ever eaten.. wow.   Overall it was good, but I don't get what the hype's about. The NY location must be much better to be as famous as this place is.

8ISHwPcPplrRE6fYQoqwMQ.text: My wife and I had an excellent dinner here.  We walked in at 6:30 on a friday without a reservation and were able to get a seat.  The baked clams were very good.  My wife ordered the Chicken Scarpariello.  We were pre-warned that the chicken came on the bone which meant we would have to "work for it", which is a very nice way of making sure the dish doesn't come back for not being a chicken breast.  The dish was huge, and looked great, but was overpowered by the taste taste of the hot peppers, like someone had dumped a bottle of Gardinar juice on top of the whole thing.  My Osso bucco was amazing however and more than made up for her dish.  It was one of those dishes that was so good you are almost hesitant to order it again for fear that it wouldn't live up to the first time you had it.  I took one star off for the chicken dish and because our table was seated right next to the bar.  We were so close that we kept getting bumped into.  The table was also so small we were obliged send our bread dish away to make room for the main course.    Price wise this was a pretty good, $150 for app, two dinners, a drink and a half a bottle of wine.    Our server was very cordial and pleasant.  I had not problems leaving a 20% tip on the bill.

SaPRGx8-Sqwwi0GJVDmO2Q.text: We went to Rao's for dinner based solely upon Bobby Flays rave about the lasagna.  We split a cesar salad and an order of lasagna. We werent starving and the portions are huge! We sat at the bar, bartenders were extremely friendly and gracious. The salad was really good, and the lasgna was everything we hoped it would be, and more! We would absolutely go again and recommend it to friends!

jz4bfEoWLTdmK1FWP2Qwfg.text: For months we had listened to people rave. This was the best, most exclusive restaurant in Ny and now it was coming to Vegas. Unfortunately, it didn't live up to expectations. We got the signature meatballs and lemon chicken. Both dishes were okay, but it wasn't exactly the mind-blowing experience that had been advertised. I would say the menu is also pretty pricey, but not outrageous for Vegas. It was just a so-so experience though.

5k65XxSbWb-yHAKQhEb9ag.text: Outstanding food and Service. Not overbearing, just right, we had a waiter and an assistant waiter. They are famous for their meatball which my sister thought were great but I found to be just ok. Lemon chicken was very tasty as well, and My sister thought her Veal chop was to die for. The Veal Parm  melted in my mouth,  Just a great time recommend highly.

9Smw2a7kUxIuBI-nS-Iv9w.text: Very flavorful Caesar Salad with anchovies and Penne Vodka. Excellent choice of Italian wines by the glass. I was dining alone and felt a bit rushed. Also overpriced for lettuce and pasta with no meat but that's Vegas.

w9bvtlmlZG1pW5huVITMHw.text: Ordered the famous lemon chicken dish which was really just half a chicken a la carte, which maybe I should have noticed when I ordered but oh well.  I tacked on a beet salad which was good.  My friend didn't particularly care for the veal that he got.  The one good thing is that they allow you to order salads and pastas as sides, upon request.  Not sure why this place is so popular in NY.

2Tp686irSOtBJ2VsuaZktg.text: The best italian place on the strip (imho)  Generous portions, very tasty, the veal specialty is worth trying - though it's a good idea to split the dish.

4rYKszF_2T3G5c75vuNerw.text: I find it very hard to believe that anyone gave this place less than 5 stars!  We went here for our anniversary dinner because my hubby read an article online about the original Rao's in New York City.  Apparently, at that location, reservations are nearly impossible to come by, it's constantly packed and they're doing so well they don't even bother to be open on the weekends . . . all this info I got second-hand from the hubs so if you find some of it a little exaggerated, my apologies! :)  About Rao's Las Vegas in Ceasar's Palace:  Service:  We had a reservation, arrived on time and they sat us right away.  Our waiter, Sean, showed up shortly after we were seated, was very friendly and explained the specials.  He was very honest about  what he liked and didn't care for as much on the menu and helped us make really good food choices. (which i will describe below!) When making the reservation, my husband had sent an email telling them it was our anniversary so everyone who came to our table wished us a happy anniversary and they even remembered the name of our daughter (who wasn't with us) which I guess the hubs had mentioned in his email! The waiter and other staff was very attentive to our needs  but there was really nothing extra that we needed b/c they took care of everything.   As a side note, the have a photographer there that goes around taking pics and tries to sell them to you after you're done eating.  We didn't buy them, but she did do a good job.   Oh, and I can't forget the owner, I guess his name is Rao and he is the son of the guy who originally started the restaurant.  He also knew it was our anniversary, and gave us two cookbooks that he had autographed for us.  He was a very sweet and humble guy ( unlike some chef/restaurant owners you meet).  Food:  OMG the food. It was ridiculous!  I am a huge italian food fan, particularly red sauces, and of course, the best I've ever had was in Florence, Italy. Since then, I have never been able to find a red sauce that good.  Rao's has it.   For an appetizer, we ordered the meatballs. You get two baseball-size meatballs, cooked to perfection and smothered in marinara sauce.  The meatballs were tender and flavorful all the way through and the sauce was smooth, silky, garlicky, basil-ly (which is not a word, but who cares). I'm  gonna dream about those meatballs. The recipe is in the cookbook we got so you better believe I'm gonna try my hand at making them at home . . . i think they use beef, italian sausage and veal. We also ordered the parmesan risotto balls, which were a special that night. They came with more marinara sauce, were nice and crispy on the outside, creamy in the middle and just yummy.  /but if you can only pick one appetizer, get the meatballs.  Wine: We ordered the chianti classico, which was delicious and went well with everything else we had.  Main courses: Like i said, i love red sauce so i was tempted to get the spaghetti bolognese. Our waiter, though, told us that although it was good, he recommended the spaghetti and meatballs more. Since id already had meatballs, i decided to go with the ravioli purses ....and I'm so glad i did. It was amazing. You get a plate of ravioli purses filled with ricotta cheese and barlett pears, topped with cranberries, sage leaves (which i think might have been seared in oil or something because they were crispy and delicious) and a brown butter sauce. Now, if you've ever had butter sauces, you know they can sometimes be overly greasy, this one was perfect. Not too oily and full of flavor. The hubs got the chicken scarpariello . . .for the life of me, I don't understand why anyone would go to an italian restaurant and not order pasta, but whatevs! LOL It was chicken, italian sausage and a variety of peppers in a white wine sauce. It was the mostly highly recommended (by our waiter) chicken dish on the menu. I didn't taste it myself but hubby said it was delicious but he admitted he liked my pasta better. ;)  Dessert: I was going to order the cannoli but the waiter said, "may I make a suggestion?" LOL yet again . . . so we ended up ordering the strawberry shortcake, which was my second choice anyway.  So glad we listened to our waiter again . . .the shortcake was actually an authentic style scone, slightly sweet, the strawberries were marinated, sweet, fresh and cold (but not frozen) the ice cream was perfect and it was topped with whipped cream.  So yummy! Oh, and they wrote Happy Anniversary around the rim of the bowl with chocolate sauce, which I thought was a nice touch.  I can't finish without mentioning the ambiance . . . It was so anti-Vegas and I loved it!! Old NYC style, pics of celebrities and random people on the walls, dark wood paneling and a cozy, comfortable yet upscale vibe. And even though its located inside Ceasar's Palace, the storefront and "outdoor" seating area look almost exactly like the original location in NYC. Very cool.  Overall, excellent experience and superb food!

06QjhMvgwBlUp0wh1mFPUA.text: Let me start by saying that the house red was $17 for a single glass. WOW!  My guest and I had salads and an appetizer that was only fair but still cost around $60 bucks. But, this is Las Vegas baby.  Service was marginal.

0TDIN6t5tf3wf4ddw7NCxg.text: Great service and amazing wine list .The food didn't impress me ,but it was good .I will try to go next time in Vegas .

s6FYUzHMLEphVFUN7xjHWA.text: Amazing food, best service I've had in Vegas. I had water spilled on accident by someone at my table and three waiters swooped over to help me and it was fixed in less than 2 minutes.   The food was pretty great as well. Meatball appetizer was moist and had great flavors (literally the size of a fist). I had the Penne Vodka and it was delicious. I sampled some of the meal that contained Sausage, Chicken and Onions and Peppers and it was extremely good as well. We went with the peanut butter tart dessert item and it was probably one of the best desserts I've ever had.

-AGiHDUS7-UL8U9SbE3A3w.text: Loved this place. Our first visit to vegas. Meatballs were to die for.  Great calamari. I got the clams and linguine.  Great meal. Beautiful bread basket. Refill of water without asking. About 30 per plate

IG0u2P2JlNcgT0LAz6LDUg.text: Awesome food. Simple yet complex flavors. I had the linguine marinara with 1 meatball and a cesar salad. I'm stuffed! So good! Bill was $57.

photos.caption: Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Linguine Marinara with a Meatball

KrYZ7mBO_eu6AhBM9ePd3A.text: What NY'er (or in my case ex-Ny'er) does not have Rao's on their bucket list?? I had fantasies of trying to figure out a way to get in when I lived there - but never had the balls to go there and be rejected.  Fear not my little kittie-cats, Rao's is now available to the general public via Las Vegas!!!!  It was the only reservation I made prior to my weekend in Vegas, I wasn't sure about whether it would be crowded or not - but I was taking NO chances.  This is OLD school Italian food. I swear when you live in a city like SF these kinds of joints are becoming more and more difficult to find. - Just classic red sauce-y meat-y cheesy Italian food.  I know that the chicken scarpiello is supposed to be great here - but unfortunately I had made that very dish for Easter the weekend before - and we had been eating leftovers all week, so I was not in the mood (sadly).  I went with two food-loving girlfriends and we went family-style.  Night one we ordered: -Mozzarella en carozza - this is rarely found on menus outside of NY, and even then it is rare -Meatballs - a must! -Chicken Milanese - oh the crust was divine! (we asked, they said semolina flour, hmmmm...) -Fettuccini w cream peas and prosciutto -Peanut butter cream cheese pie thing - freaking amazing - get it, even if you might not finish it, but you will find a way...  We found ourselves with no plans on our last night - so went there (again). - Sunday night 2 of us split - and ate at the bar - the service was not so great - we were guessing the guy was new- everytime someone ordered a bottle or a glass of wine around us - he asked them to tell him the vin number -Chicken parmesan - very good - but I preferred the Milanese -(pasta) Begger purses with fried sage and cranberries, really good!  It is pricy - but I think every nice meal in Vegas is pricy. I would definitely go back.

Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Splitting of the pasta
Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Break basket

RrQYHvZSbpTCKxwVqiIjZg.text: I've dined here a couple of times and had a lovely evening.  The decor is inviting and I particularly like the bar area. Their meatballs are very good, large, moist, and flavorful. The carbonara is very nice, although too salty for my taste (pancetta!). This time we were celebrating a birthday, and were presented with a lovely dessert for the birthday girl!

photos.caption: Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Ng2HEoH8hXzygkzpFdwhQg.text: The food was delectable, and the service was outstanding. My wife and I shared two entrees, Angel Hair with Marinara and Meatballs, and their famous Lemon Chicken. Jovanny, our server was knowledgeable, courteous and very attentive. We will definitely be back! 5 STARS!!!

_su0J9vTwsSCRFulPX-uTA.text: I had heard about Rao's in New York for many years, so I was excited at the fact that myself and two friends were going here for dinner. We arrived for our reservation at around 7 p.m. after donating a few bucks to the poker machines at the bar just outside of Rao's. Unfortunately, Lady Luck still eluded me.  When you arrive at Rao's, you will notice some tables outside. I guess these tables are for those who want to dine Al Fresco. Inside, there is a bar and 2 other rooms. There is a side room that is designated as the "traditional" Rao's and then there is a back room the looks out over the pool. Although, I am sure to have lunch here would be distracting with the pool. Just as a tip, I highly recommend that you ask to be sat in the back room.   The hostess seated us at a nice table in the back room. The room is large, but not overly noisy. For an appetizer, we ordered the Frito Misto. I have had Frito Misto at other places and it has been overly breaded. This was perfect! You are also served a basket of bread and a trio of butter. There is regular, pedestrian butter. Spicy red pepper butter. And the best of the best, the onion butter. Just a little piece of heaven for your bread. I could have licked the plate, but that wouldn't be classy.  For my main course, I had the pork chop. I nice portion of double cut goodness. It is served with sauteed with hot and sweet peppers that added a nice flavor to the pork chop. The other two people I was with had the linguine and clams. They both said it was really good. The wine list is pretty extensive. We had a white wine from Sardinia that was selected with the help of the Somelier, Rose. There is also a full bar for those of you who aren't wineos.  A few tips: Ask to be seated in the back room. Make a reservation. Valet parking at Cesars is $13.00.

qS54nDBk2548BZil4zeYxA.text: If you are looking for a great Italian style restaurant Rao's is the place to go. Located in Caesars Palace. Our waiter was awesome, his name was Giovanni, very entertaining. Ask for him if he is working. We started with 2 appetizers. The meatballs(2) and cheese wedge(2). It is not Italian style, so you need to order separate dishes. We ordered the Crab Carbonara, Lamb Chops, the chicken dish with sausage and Bell peppers. Another thing that was great! They kept you water glass filled.

photos.caption: Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MkeRzQVaN9R0cPUqnwgSsg.text: Had a great bday dinner here, quality place that serves great food, def get the meatballs, service and drinks all top notch

Pif21GqSiP8Q0wJEcDZhEw.text: Great cocktails..great food (pork chop and veal parm) were delicious!! And Matt was an awesome server. Will repeat here for sure. Solid restaurant!! Only reason I didn't give the 5th Star...is because there is nothing "unique" here but again excellent.

qTLRNkZiKmyf3z1QvP93Jw.text: You can take the boy out of NY, but you can't take the NY out of the boy....and it that happens- come to Rao's in Vegas!  The restaurant was very empty (being we were the first ones there), which is fine with me. I can enjoy the wall to wall saturation of Pictures ranging from Rao's history to celebrity autographs. But , to no ones surprise, as I was leaving the restaurant had a nice buzz from the crowd.    We were greeted by friendly hostess who sat us right away and even helped us in our seats (I feel a little out of place receiving such treatment , but hey- when in Rome...). The waiter Howie, a phenomenal guy, took care of our table & was more than pleasant to deal with , very professional & knowledgable of the menu and of the Rao's name. Howie's service to the table was second to none.   The food....oh boy the food. Heaven on a plate. The bread - fresh & delish. Gotta have some olive oil to dip of course. If not they serve a trio of butter. Roasted red pepper butter, unsalted & smoked onion butter. The seafood salad was done with such delicate care. Not overcooked at all. Tender !!!! The Caesar salad comes with huge shaved pecorino slices & the dressing- amazing. The meatballs you ask? Get them, try them, eat them and enjoy. No if, ands or buts about it. The Osso Buco w/ Saffron Risotto....one of the best I've had in a long time. The Spaghetti Bolognese was the traditional hearty meat sauce. Spaghetti was al dente, which is the way it's supposed to be. Unfortunately we didn't do dessert- I didn't wanna over do it. Besides we had to make a show.   I have been dying to get into the Rao's in Manhattan and can never get the opportunity but once I made plans to come to Vegas- the first thing I did was make reservations for Rao's - and boy was it worth it.   BUON APPETITE!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Osso Buco w/ Saffron Risotto
Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spaghetti Bolognese
Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood salad

GvHJA4RvbSMfgn9WGV1oDA.text: I was so surprised with the extremely fast service. The food came out in perfect order. Our waitress (forgot her name. But she had a blond bun) we went there last night around 6:30pm sitting by the area with pictures of the owner shaking hands with Bill Clinton. She was very friendly and our waters were always filled up. When it reached the half mark of the glass, water was filled up right away. In addition, the bread basket was constantly refilled. You can tell that the employees are all about great service and making sure people are more than satisfied. I recommend getting the linguine and clams (for the first course) and the pork chops and chicken scapriello for your entree! Great experience and hopefully I'll be able to get into the NYC location, which is very rare and extremely hard to get a table for.

photos.caption: Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WRYqVEPANnIW4n6uE_isvg.text: I love Italian food so my husband and I thought we would have a quick dinner here. The food itself was pretty good. I enjoyed the chicken piccata and my husband had steak. The ambiance would have been nicer if there wasn't so many loud obnoxious people surrounding us at other tables. We could hardly carry on a conversation because we couldn't hear each other. Our waiter disappeared for a short period of time and we had to ask twice for the check. Not sure if we would return due to so many other options in Vegas to eat at.

m9Qyqv954lG3srzPViY5Xg.text: It's been a while since my last visit to Las Vegas. The most memorable times is when my wife and I have dined at Rao's in Caesar's Palace. Being here two times before. We made it a point to dine here on our short visit in town. So I made reservations that morning for dinner in the evening on the phone with no problem. Once we arrived at Caesar's that night. We walked through the casino floor and past a few shops to get to the restaurant. Inside the hotel is a challenge to travel from here to there but the hotel staff are very helpful with directions if you get lost. The service at Rao's that night was exceptional. Our waitress Angela was amazing. Her wait staff were just as good. Never had a dirty plate, fork, etc. the whole dinner. Water glass always full. Asked Angela for some recommendations and she was spot on. She really knew her stuff and made us feel special. The food speaks for itself. Rao's have the best meatballs anywhere. No one does it better. There famous for it for good reason. If you come here. Start with that. You haven't lived until you have eaten the meatballs. I am serious. There isn't anything bad on the menu that I have tried. From the salads, to the pasta dishes, to the pork chops. Yum, yum and more yum. Dessert? I go with their classic cheese cake. Delicious. Rao's is my wife's and my favorite place to dine in Vegas. The service is top notch. The dining is classy, romantic, old school. The food is epically amazing. I wish I could give Rao's more stars. They deserve it. Bravo Rao's. My wife and I are your fans.

photos.caption: Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kl2JxzIzXT4Qx3VSyPfHgA.text: My bf has wanted to try Rao's for years, and we finally got the opportunity during his birthday trip to Vegas. It was well worth the wait! It started perfectly for me when I checked in on the Yelp app and received an offer for a free New Yorker cocktail while waited for the rest of our party at the bar. We ordered the meatball appetizer, and crab carbonara and lamb chops for entrees. We received a special birthday plate with shareable desserts since there were 2 birthdays in our party - nice! Everything was great, but our server kinda checked out on us. He didn't offer wines, didn't check on us, and took a while for our checks. He was nice, but lacked that extra above & beyond oomph that you'd expect from a place like this.

XqmcfPUsCKYw7w0ulIa8Jg.text: I have been dying to go to Raos in NYC but given my decidedly un-VIP status, I had to settle for the Vegas version. I'm sure the ambiance is completely different, but I'm told the food tastes pretty similar.  Speaking of the food- I theoretically don't like it when meat is super processed (I've never seen a meatball that cuts so cleanly) but those meatballs met their legendary deliciousness status.  And that lemon chicken was super tasty- it almost tasted like Brazilian grilled chicken but with a rich, Italian lemon wine sauce.   Going from a rich Italian meal to the clubs was a bit tough but totally worth it. I will be back, and until then, I'll think fondly of this experience as I eat my pasta with Raos marinara sauce from the comfort of my couch :)

D7hafsgICGfAiY9IyVpebA.text: I'd long wanted to try Rao's NY, but figured I'd try their Las Vegas outpost as scoring a reservation in NY is virtually impossible and I'd heard the food is the same at both locations.  While their meatballs lived up to their reputation, and their breads were good, everything else we had was okay at best. And "okay" is not good enough given the prices they charge.  While the interior decor was nice (don't sit on the patio or you'll miss half the allure of the place), the restaurant was very loud, and not in the fun way their NY outpost is supposed to be. It's just loud from other patrons and seems to lack sound-proofing.  If my visit to Rao's Las Vegas is any indication, their reputation is most likely based on the feel of their NY outpost, not on their food (other than their meatballs). If you go, consider going for appetizers only, getting their meatballs, breads, and wine (I didn't try their desserts so can't opine as to those).

QNQKv-tNXt1JNqACj-2mug.text: Amazing Italian dishes! My guy & I went here Memorial Day weekend on a Sunday and had a nice booth! Our server Angela was wonderful see recommended a fantastic dessert pastries filled with vanilla & chocolate gelato!!  P.S. The meatballs were to die for !

photos.caption: Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-rulqf6zntUFVJO9sQtnRQ.text: Meh. I'll try not to be too long winded. We made reservations for 6 to eat here on New Years Day at 9pm. I was really excited because of the great reviews and I've tried their jar sauce before (only one I'll use) and figured it must be better in person. We showed up 20/30 minutes early and we're seated pretty quickly so that was good (we would have made earlier reservations but that's all Open Table had available).   After being seated the restaurant was busy but quickly cleared out after that with just a few tables remaining. We waited a few minutes for the waiter which was fine and ordered a round of drinks.   We ordered a couple of appetizers - meatballs and bruschetta. Meatballs were ok (I was expecting better) and bruschetta was good. The waiter explained that the portions for dinner are "family style" and we should order as such.   For entrees, I figured I would stick to the standard chicken Parmesan, and others ordered lemon chicken, shrimp and lobster fra diavolo, shrimp scampi, penne vodka and chicken parm substituted with a different sauce (two people were planning to share the family style portion of the last dish).   For being described as "family style," the portions were very small. Chicken parm was just alright. The sauce in the jar tastes better than this sauce. Lobster and shrimp pasta was tasty, as well as, the shrimp scampi. The lemon chicken was tasty but our waiter didn't advise that it didn't come with any sides so that was pretty annoying. Oh, and the wine list is pretty nice and not that expensive.   The most annoying part is that before we even ordered our meal, we noticed a bunch of garbage all over the floor. We looked down and it looked like a ton of lentils? We told the waiter and he shrugged it off and said "oh yeah I noticed that too. I don't know what it is." Really? Our meal was over $450 and that's the response we get about a dirty floor?   Was it awful? No. Would I go back? No way.

photos.caption: Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

et5dD7TOyEtkShh38udo3g.text: We eat at Rao's often.  It's our go to place when we stay at the Flamingo during monthly stay-cations. Even buy their jarred sauce to use with pasta at home.  Took a friend and his wife there on Monday evening and was extremely disappointed.  The house salad was good as usual, but the Veal Parmigiana was completely unacceptable.  That nights serving was over cooked and dry, devoid of taste even with the sauce and cheese.  Asked for a diablo sauce on the pasta.  It was spicy as expected, but so loaded with garlic it overwhelmed the dish. My wife had the Clams Linguini with red sauce and requested it to be made with very light garlic.  Same problem, so much garlic it was overwhelming.  Spent the night eating antacids.   Really hope it was a one-time problem, but not sure I want to go back again to find out, given the other choices at the Harrah's properties.

J4twJz5s-F1oXdIDc6v6Kw.text: I really was hoping this was going to be amazing. Our expectations were extremely high. We went with a few friends and everyone ordered an appetizer and entree. First the appetizers, the baked clams were the smallest clams we ever saw. The Cesar salad was just ok. The calamari was decent. Entrees, pasta was very good as it should be in a historical Italian place. The linguini with clams smelled so awful no one could eat it. Most of the fish dishes were not great. My shrimp scampi was soaked in oil so did not taste very good. The waiters were lovely and accommodating so at the very least service was very good and attentive. Just upset wanted for this to be a great experience. Don't think I'd want to go back to try again. I'll stick to buying the sauce in the supermarket.

DLAU9sIG9ppiX0u4S_Gw3A.text: Raos is a landmark restaurant. Operationally they are able to consistently make multiple signature dishes which they publicly disclose the recipes yet nobody is able to duplicate.  Lemon chicken: this is my favorite and I think the best chicken i ever had in any restaurant regardless of price. You get the crunchy crispy outside contrasting with a tender juicy inside of both breast meat and thigh meat. Each order uses Half a chicken. Their chicken is bigger then a Cornish game hen but much smaller than a supermarket chicken. The small size allows for fast cooking to the inside to the bone without raw pink spots near the bone and still maintaining the crispy outside without burning. Almost impossible to replicate at home consistently. You have to control the grilling temperature with the size of the meat. The sauce is not sweet. Tangy. They don't use sugar as a short cut to carmelization. When served you can smell the vinegar evaporating. As the dish ages the tangy flavor changes to the subtle tartness of aging lemon. Very delicate. You have to experience this. The lemon chicken in the first minute is different than what it evolves to 10 minutes later. No fat. Not greasy. The big supermarket chickens are higher in cholesterol. Completely different texture and flavor

photos.caption: Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon chicken damn this is good

mOMbuUKlmJL0_FA3WP333A.text: Wow! What a great place. Service was excellent food was amazing. Robert our bartender was awesome. If you want to have a nice dinner out this is a can't miss.

sZ5qanQR6N3DVMjfL9AOdA.text: We were excited to come here because my bf's brother is a regular at the Rao's in NY & raves about their food made our reservations at their Las Vegas location.   The ambiance was a tad bit too dark, we enjoyed the pictures of famous people that have visited the restaurant over the years.   The food was overall terrible. We started with a Fritto Misto, which is a generous sized platter made up of fried calamari, shrimp, cod fish, and zucchini which was great until the middle & was extremely salty and had a fishy aftertaste; we returned it. The chef agreed that it was too salty and that they use rock salt. We then had a Cesar's Salad which was average. My boyfriend had the steak with a side if Pizzaiola that he was greatly disappointed with because it was mostly onion and is called Pizzaiola because it is supposed to more of a "Pizza sauce" with more tomato than anything and the steak also tasted too salty. I had the Penne Vodka which was actually the only dish I enjoyed. Unfortunately, my boyfriend was sick from all the salt we had from the Fritto Misto which we ate as an appetizer that he was not able to enjoy the rest of his food.   My bf was then was asked by a server if the he was enjoying his food and laughed at him after my bf said "No and that he was feeling sick." I felt a little sick as well because of the overdose of salt and fishy aftertaste from the appetizer. What began as an exciting date with my boyfriend turned to being stuck in the bathroom all night.   One thing you can count on here though is that our waiter Brian was very friendly and on que with our dishes, allowing us enough time to eat each dish without feeling rushed. Hosts were quick to make sure wine was refilled and were quick to accommodate any requests.

uo0BFjhwWyJjU18zqaFVww.text: Rao's service is impeccable! Great staff overall and very friendly:-) With that being said, the food really is average. It isn't horrible, but for the price you pay, you can get far better Italian food elsewhere. A lot of their pasta is tremendously overpriced so be aware..

NqvOduXO_JuCEicXPdA8Dw.text: Meh.  Old school, classic east coast menu. Lots of pastas with tomato sauces, and meats beaten until their thin.  To say that the menu is boring is... Well... That would be kind of insulting. The menu is what it's supposed to be - a representation of Italian food in America in the 30s or 40s... Or whatever...  The problem I had was... Nothing was very good... The pastas were over cooked. The seasonings were weak. The service was friendly and fine, but didn't really stand out  I've never been to the flagship in NYC, but, I don't need to, to say that I was quite disappointed in my experience here.

2XgV8BFengQm2E56YKXuzw.text: Hooray for Howie!! My Seven Star's sister invites me to Caesars several times a year and Rao's is a must, if possible twice in a short visit. The BEST seafood salad that was deleted from the menu unfortunately. However, thanks to a server who cares about his customers, Howie served me my favorite meal!!  So nice to be remembered by your server and eat the best seafood salad!

kB67FYpe52I1cUi_kBIqtw.text: Decent. But I don't think it was worth the price.  I ordered the Lemon Chicken. We put our order in at around 9:30, and the food came out only a few minutes after we had ordered.   I'm not sure how they cooked multiple different types of pasta, and chicken in under a few minutes so the food must be precooked and sitting under heat lamps.   The lemon chicken was pretty good. Lots of flavor and the chicken was cooked properly. Definitely recommend ordering a side with it. While the chicken is very filling a nice side will make it a complete meal. I really wish they put a small side of pasta included, it would have really made the meal much better especially for $30.   Overall, great service and pretty decent food.  If you're looking for a cheaper (but still really solid) option, there's a great Italian restaurant inside of the forum shops.

photos.caption: Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon Chicken

tPGyu5lFf8OGkCp6yf3XKA.text: Was here for a corporate event. Everything was family style and we pretty much had everything off the menu. Meatballs were a standout. Everything else was not as memorable. Good thing it was covered by the company!!

Z1jjpDjR9KOQm-tXT5qqDg.text: if i could give their bruschetta alone 5 stars i would. If i ever come back its for the bruschetta and bread basket. Came to rios on Thursday night 1/11/18. Ordered the chicken parm. Instead of spaghetti with marinara, i asked if i can have vodka sauce with my spaghetti. The waiter said yes but i will have to pay extra. OK no problem. I get my meal and i dig into the chicken first. I notice chunks of something in my spaghetti so i dont eat it and wait for the waiter to confirm theres no meat in the spaghetti. Once the waiter finally comes to the table to check on us (maybe 10-15 mins) after we got our plates, i asked him about the chunks. I thought it was probably onion. He tells me its meat. I spit out whatever is in my mouth and then he confirms its actually HAM!!! Ham in the vodka sauce. WTF??? I immediately lost my appetite. Eating pork is against my religion. And i do not eat any meat besides chicken. And i just ate my chicken that was touching it. He offered to get me another plate of pasta with no ham, i said no thank you, dinner was already over. He insisted on bringing a small bowl. I couldnt even eat it when he brought it though, completely lost my appetite. He then tells me next time to let them know of any dietary restrictions. Um ive never had to advise that i dont eat pork when i got out. Didnt think i needed to advise that when ordering spaghetti and chicken parm either. Only ate half of my piece of chicken and was still charged $48 for my meal and extra $$ for the sauce. Ridiculous. Not sure if ill even ever come back. The menu should say ham under the penne vodka dish. It did say Prosciutto Cotto, but how was i supposed to know thats ham??? thought it was a type of cheese. Cant believe they make vodka sauce with ham. So disappointed

QQD4a6w1cHNyOPiB_t92ng.text: If you know anything about Rao's then you know it's near impossible to get into the NY location.  I've tried!  I've go to Vegas often and have walked by this place a few times and just wasn't sure if it would be good.  I hear that places aren't as good in Vegas that have other locations.  So last year I decided to give it a shot and was I surprised.  They really decorated this place to look like the NY location.  It's pretty big inside but it still has a small feel, which is cool.    At every Italian joint I hit I always have to try the meatballs and lasagna.   The meatballs were absolutely amazing.  The best that I have ever had actually.  I really enjoyed the sauce as well.  I make it a point to taste the sauce by itself and it was fantastic.  In Jacksonville they sell the sauce at a local grocery store so I'm pretty familiar with it.  The meatballs were large and were cooked and seasoned perfectly.  You put some parm cheese on it and it just melts in your mouth.    The lasagna is fantastic as well.  Amazing flavors and meaty as well.  The sauce just makes these dishes pop!

QbaKAq_9zU4MA3KRIsjLRA.text: Good but pricey. Caprese salad was delicious. I had the veal piccata  but with pasta instead of potatoes. The veal was tender and the sauce was great with the pasta. Our friends had the signature chicken and the egg plant parmigiana.  The food was very good but I expected a little more for the prices.

a4sGAdJ8we2lEVsp7jzp0w.text: I went with a group of 6 and I think we were all unimpressed with our dinners. We had high expectations because of the name and reputation and it was disappointing to say the least. The food was just ok, not great, and the waiter was terrible, acted like he had somewhere else to be every time he came by but the other employees were good. Highlight of the meal was the Caesar salad and the red sauce, the lasagna was good, meatballs were ok, fried cheese ok, Bolognese not great. I know there are other better places on the strip and we will not go here again.

9iNSoIqzMcgUnTzui-qfmg.text: We ordered the meatballs had found that they had hair in them. Then ordered the Carbonara it was so salty the worse ever. The service was terrible! I'm sorry but my advice avoid this place. So overrated.

s820B7pDw2x4nYybUvTtLg.text: Disappointing.  Famous for Italian from New York to Vegas but the food has gone downhill. I went for the first time last year and loved the atmosphere and the food was really good. Just went back and it was really disappointing. I'm Italian American and can really appreciate home style Italian cooking. I also like to taste a lot of different things and ordered a lot of food to try.  The baked clams were charred on top and the clams were over cooked. One even had that hint of fishiness you never want to taste or smell. We ordered Gnocchi  special as it was not on the menu. Gnocchi should melt in your mouth, these were rubbery. The lemon chicken, a speciality of the house, was dry.  1 sub par dish is a bad night. 3 is a restaurant past its prime. Was hoping to make it an annual pilgrimage to Rao's but unfortunately will not go back.

znttzv9nVRmFcX9lbxBQNA.text: Went there for Dinner during the week, about 6pm, was disappointed, the pasta dish, pillows, there like small, raviolis, where good, but there were only about 7 of them, in the plate, not enough for a dinner.

G9tN6pSV35cjyIKDLCnlSw.text: The perfect eatery for people who love old-world Italian. Servers who know the menu inside out and a delicious selection of dishes make this the perfect dinner spot. Everything I've ever had here has been perfect. Light cream sauces, delicious reds, and perfectly cooked pasta! Oh my gosh...goodness on a fork! The only reason I gave 4 stars is that this place is a little pricey.

-3sRg_sw5VdsGL0-D_NauQ.text: Went here for the first time with my boyfriends family for dinner. I would definitely say it's mediocre at best. I've had much better Italian food for much less $$. The bill ended up being nearly $200 at the end of it all. Definitely would not return here next time I visit.  And oh yea, we went in late March and the Christmas decorations were still up. ...Like what??

T4FVFRmIqZLokcDIYUltOQ.text: Food was pretty good, not my all time fav but fresh. They say their signature dish is the veal wasn't impressed, the service was wonderful. Prepare to pay a hefty penny for some pasta!

photos.caption: Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

phNoVD2ND4Km58XKxqEfRA.text: I didn't know about Rao's until some friends invited me to go. I didn't know about the original Rao's in NYC that was founded in the late 1800s. I didn't know how hard it was to get a reservation at the original until I started looking at some reviews.  What I DO know is that this was the best Osso Bucco I've ever tasted! Just the right blend of meaty flavor, delicious fat, and chewy gristle broken down to a melt-in-your mouth feel. Loved, loved, loved!

7vVMng7putPkql-fuheHNQ.text: Classic spot from east coast poorly duplicated in Vegas. Sorry to the fans but go elsewhere. There are plenty of great Italian restaurant in Vegas. Invest your food fund elsewhere.

Qbw_17xf_mbRDQQ0NTrFLA.text: Finally reached the holy shrine of Rao's after watching it on TV all these times.  I was fairly excited to secure a table.  Service was warm and friendly.  Meatballs?  Fughetaboutit, it was delicious as advertised.  Kids also loved the bread and crackers.  Pasta on the other hand, was very ordinary, in a way, underwhelmed.  The lemon chicken was a bit undercooked and not "lemony" enough.  Porkchop on the other hand I'd recommend.  The outside was grilled to a crispy crust, while the inside was perfectly medium.  I am glad to say I have been to Rao's, but the same amount of money probably would have been better spent at the buffet at Caesar's.

NfukkmPExdq8fH3c-Hvsng.text: I go here nearly every time I'm in Vegas (a few times a year).  I just love it.  The food is good, not amazing, but always, always good.  And the service and ambiance are exactly perfect.  The food has always been quality, and I've never had something here I didn't like.  It's a perfect place for a nice dinner with one friend or a big corporate meal...either way, it works just right.    This last trip, I went there once with all my work peeps (9 of us total).  We all loved everything we got for appetizers and entrees and desserts.  The portions are ginormous.  The prices are high, but you really get a lot for what you pay for.  Just know: you will only finish about half of what you get.   The wine list is insane, with many bottles well over $500, $1000, and up.  This place definitely isn't a cheap place, but you gotta splurge sometimes, right???  I also went there a few times before dinners elsewhere for a dirty martini (I was staying at Caesar's).  The bartenders are all very old-school...and it really feels like you're in a mafia bar.  I do love it.  The dirty martinis are giant and come with blue-cheese stuffed olives, so they make me happy.  I also went my last night in town with a friend to sit at the bar and have an appetizer and a cocktail before heading out for the night.  Whether you're ordering a $300 dinner or a $30 snack, the staff still treats you the same way.  They're very polite and professional, but super friendly.  We both got martinis and ordered the Fritto Misto Deep Fried Calamari, Shrimp, Cod Fish and Julienne Zucchini with Remoulade and Marinara Sauce ($21).  Even though I've been there about 10 times and know that the portions are HUGE, I was shocked by how big this appetizer was.  It was the prettiest Fritto Misto I've ever seen (and I've seen many), as well as one of the best tasting ones I've ever eaten.  The zucchini was a nice little touch, too.  The shrimp were fantastic, the cod was flakey and good, but the calamari was the best part.  So, So, So good!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  We had just stopped in for a snack, but left feeling full!  And now it's a week later, and I'm still thinking about how delicious this was!  Some other favorites from the menu are the softball sized meatballs (sooo good!...but honestly, you can get one order to feed an entire table), the caprese salad (big wedges of tomatoes and buffalo mozzarella instead of thin slices of each), the pastas are all good (especially the shrimp fra diavola), but the real stars are the meat and veal entrees.  The parmesans and milaneses are so big they don't even really fit onto the plate, but gosh darn they taste delicious!  Can't wait for my next Vegas trip...where you'll definitely find me here at the bar and noshing on something delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

23WWi4TetRSBUuzP_SJyZw.text: Food was decent, service was good. Desserts were excellent!

itG2XaltuO9LEY2oLZLCPQ.text: One of the criterion I have for rating a restaurant is whether I will return. I will return to Rao's. I went to Rao's during Restaurant Week last August and my husband and I were still treated well even though we ate off the RW menu. That is not always the case. The food was excellent as was the service. The Roasted Beet Salad and the NY Cheesecake are out of this world.

TT0UmnMacBihMVoqlnTeKA.text: Service: Spotty Food: Above Average Atmosphere: Awesome Cleanliness: Top Notch Music: Did not get it...... Mafioso wanna be factor: High  Service started out a little strained but got better as the evening went along.  Music was a little to loud, did not get the music selection for the  type of establishment.......  Place looks great, clean and fun.....  Food: Octopus appetizer was good not enough food on the plate though, Caprese salad was excellent, Brodo soup was bland, Sausage and Cabbage dish was excellent, Bolognaise was excellent , Vongole was excellent.  Server forgot to bring butter with the bread.  The wanna be mafioso's were out in full force, it was quite entertaining to watch how the old school get's it done!  I would go back and recommend this restaurant.  It is a bit over-priced but isn't everything in Vegas!

x7QnHI3XA_CIByvEGZ6rMQ.text: Service started out a little slow due to a large group near us that was having language difficulties.   Once they got squared away, service picked up considerably.  The antipasto is very good.    The fusilli and the taglioline were both awesome and portions were huge.    We ordered a side of meatballs based on the Yelp reviews and they did not disappoint.   The only downside was that after having the meatballs, I could not finish my taglioline.  The wine list is decent but a tad expensive so we ordered a couple glasses instead.

MV0eOx-tnZZ9_B1Ek3l37Q.text: I really enjoyed my dinner there.  I went straight up to the bar and was greeted.  I ordered the double cut pork chop with hot and sweet pepper sauce.  It was awesome!  Perfectly cooked...meat was very moist.  I saw the people next to me mop up their bolognese and clams with white wine sauce.  I would definitely recommend this as a stop while in Vegas!

-pIZc-e7jLjgqBIy-WTlbg.text: Rao's is home away from home.  In a city that is full of glitz, glamour, and high prices; Rao's is a place where life slows down and allows you to savor what is truly great in life.  Frankie and his staff are second to none!  Go for the amazing food, come back for the superb service.  Few things in this life are as memorable as the Rao's experience.  Rao's is family, Rao's is good friends...and hey, while you're there - try the clams!

nLgwfeU-iEfTUnage9Av1g.text: This restaurant is amazing. The meatballs were to die for. Huge serving but so tender and flavorful ! I had Veal Piccata and the veal was fork tender. My husband ordered Shrimp Risotto and it was creamy and delicious . Cannollis for dessert. Have eaten fab cannollis before in Philly but these were the best ever. Service was superb

2dDjz-ZR60DpyHBhZaaG1w.text: With most of the dinners and lunches I had on the strip, it was a major breath of fresh air to dine here.  Friend here in vegas highly recommended EVERYTHING on the menu but we had to choose.  We started with the baked clams and they were divine. Great blend of cheese and italian herbs. Very well seasoned.  Our mains were the rigatoni with proccuito in a red sauce, (forgot dish name..this is next day) and the penne vodka.  Both of the extremely delicious.  I also ordered the side of meatballs since they are often talked about.  I have got to figure out the blend they use for those balls because they were amazing.  I don't understand some peoples bad experience here.   Yes the pasta is served al dente.  This is the best way to eat pasta, especially health wise. Look it up. Yes, this place is pricey but it is definitely worth it.  Though I was shocked that house merlot was $16 a glass, we enjoyed our last night in vegas.  Will return in a heartbeat when we visit again!!

ajvevtoAYrAp7UqjypAilg.text: Staying in Caesars we decided to check out Raos, we were seated outside which is nice, eating and watching people stroll by in hunger or not:) They brought out the bread and I took a piece and one of our friend commented that the bread is so hard, it's old and told our waiter to bring us new one. Our waiter happily replace the bread.   For appetizers we had the cocktail shrimp - descent, and the calamari - yum.. I was craving for it. Our meal too forever to come out, but for the main course, I had the clam linguine- average they prepared it kind of salty and I bit into several sand or tiny little rocks, dammit. otherwise I was satisfied. My hubby and friend had the salmon, it came out burnt and dry. It didn't look too good. There were definitely other yummy dishes that I might want to try later.

TUTBjHMVSHZMKa3zsYbnQg.text: First off, the food here was excellent! The service was fast, friendly and very professional. So why only 4 stars? The price. Just because you are an "upper scale" restaurant doesn't mean your food is worth what you have on the menu.  We started off with a bread basket filled with various breads that I enjoyed with balsamic vinegar and oil for the dipping. My meal was shells with ricotta cheese. It was really good and I finished everything. All you got however was about 15 shells, sauce and cheese. That was $23! Maybe I am not wise to the ways of high end restaurants but the food portion and price just didn't add up for me. Maybe they fly their pasta in from Italy every day. If so I understand the price, but otherwise, come on.   I enjoyed the food, the atmosphere and the break from the typical Vegas buffet fare, just beware the price. Would I come back again. Maybe if I hit it big at the table games and had a few extra hundred to spare. Otherwise, I may try something else.

RUN6DYfnItjzl-xO5v5pYQ.text: Ok- just had a SUPER yummy burger here! We have eaten here twice this weekend. Yesterday, we had the meatballs which were great as was our server Tiffany. Today, we were able to get the burger which seems to sell out. We can see why! Red pepper something something- yummo! We don't even eat cheese- and I ate mine with our the bun- it was delish! Peter who waited on us was also great! Friendly, fast!

YG9wG8WEDirctgURB7gE5w.text: Way overpriced for the amount of food you get! I was here a few years ago and the prices have certainly increased since then. Service was good but I felt like I was robbed after walking away from this place.

YBgsueU94cGUMcN1-tL8RQ.text: Extremely overpriced, mediocre Italian food; no atmosphere of any kind (other than strip mall kind) - but service at least is fast so you don't suffer too long.  Best thing that can be said is that it's close to the exits from Caesar's ... so you can get out quickly.

PgbpxyymqkdgFeJlcK7jsA.text: I LIKE it very much! I love the interior of this restaurant. It feels old fashion, romantic, and friendly, Our waiter was awesome and our food was spectacular! Food was Outstanding! I had Vinny's lemon chicken. and the Peas with ham. These were such simple dishes but so awesome. To me that is what I look for is a Chef who can take the simplest of ingredients and make magic! That to me is the True art of cooking.

qFxkGS4MA1pJ4_1n-TnaOQ.text: I only stopped in here for a couple drinks. The atmosphere was inviting and the cocktails exceptional. We had their take on a Manhattan and it was spectacular. The Bartender for sure knew what he was doing and took his time making proper cocktails. I look forward to trying their food next time.

gwskVztFgXdMnEjx_CIAZA.text: Great meal.  Traditional Italian well done!

vQSnSdQBtMlVzt-tUDrhLQ.text: this will be a different type of review because it started off a little weird but ended up being better.  We went on Wednsday night for dinner, a group of 6 of us.  We showed up for our reservation and were seated right away.  The menu's came out along with water and the waiter came by asking us for drinks.  i ordered a Rum and Coke and his dickhead response was "I'd imagine Bacardi is ok....", i told him to surprise me even though i was a bit irritated.  He asked if we were getting appetizers to split and we said yes and picked up the "Antipasto Della CASA" which had amazing cheeses and meats, the "Fritto Misto" which was the best Calamari i ever tasted, and he suggested the famous Meatballs (which again, the best i ever had).  After the appetizer order, he took our menus which seemed a bit off but we didn't think much of it since we were having a good time.  After we ate the appetizers he came back over and asked if everything was good and if we needed anything else.  He was SHOCKED when we said we had been waiting to order more drinks and dinner.  His attitude completely changed and then he was all over our table being the nicest guy ever.    The food was really good, i got the "Chicken Scarpariello" which was amazing, but seemed a little small and mostly peppers in the bowl, i wish it had a bit more sausage.  The veal chop was amazing too, i'm glad i was able to try my friends.   Overall it turned into a good night was lots of food and drinks, i just wish the our waiter wouldn't have irked me the wrong way right off the bat!

VoTP2FkjqwVCPMBHTs23pw.text: This place is expensive, but oh so good.  I went to Rao's after watching a special on the travel channel about the best places in Vegas and I loved it.  The history behind the restaurant is amazing and since it seems that I will never be able to get a table a Rao's in NYC, I am lucky that I was able to enjoy the food at Rao's in Las Vegas.  The meatballs are just as amazing as people described them and everything else, including the service was above and beyond.  I recommend this restaurant to anyone who is staying in Las Vegas......  You will not regret it.

DCpmkGoVB3ODO6T0AQQC8A.text: Wonderful as always, our waiter Russ  was just the best! You can't beat this wonderful yummy food

qa0LpbgAPhU5-q26m9ycmA.text: We've always used Rao's sauce when making pasta at home so we were super excited to eat at Rao's. And they didn't disappoint. Food was amazing! Pene Vodka was perfect, sauce fantastic and pasta Al dente. Make sure you order the Meatball appetizer, it's sooooo good.

photos.caption: Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pene Vodka, amazing!!!
Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meatballs, the best!!!!

TyIaZtmwGKGSV0cpDv01Iw.text: Went back and tried the famous meatballs -- not worth it. They were fine and some of the better meatballs I've had. They are large and soft but not the tastiest I've ever had. For the price, they are definitely not a good deal. The rigatoni pasta also has nothing special.   Service was excellent though. I wish I stuck with the veal parm that I had the last time.

5WyUFzRwYx9U3OWLu4Ia5Q.text: I'm not going to read any Yelp reviews about Rao's. I'm sure the black squid ink pasta you had in LA is far superior to this NYC red sauce joint. Wanna know something? My meal was 5 stars, I enjoyed every moment of my stay.   The pasta? Made from a box, you can't fool me. I asked my waiter, he said we use De Cecco. There's no shame in that, some pasta snobs may hate on this place not using fresh pasta. Don't care.  My wife and I are seated in a lovely garden room. The bread comes out with 3 different types of butter.  I order wine and I tell my waiter, I have a show in less than 2 hours. I don't want to have a carb overload and crash during the performance. Not to worry, we'll make it all work.  While waiting my wife drops a bomb and says she doesn't want to order meatballs. WHAT?! I'm sweating until my waiter comes back, not to worry, you can order a single ball. Whew... The meatball comes out and it's amazing. The sauce, the soft tender meat, all working together to create harmonious love on my plate.   I wanted to try the bolognese sauce with pasta but my waiter dissuaded me, you're having meatballs which is the same taste, try the penne vodka sauce? Sold! We also ordered the Chicken Scarpariello dish. Rao's, like most Italian restaurants offer large plates that's meant to share. Who's better than us Italians? What's mine is yours!*  The penne (yeah yeah, boxed pasta) was something my mom would make. The sauce (not gravy! If you say gravy you're a track suit wearing guido from jersey) was perfecto!   And the Chicken Scarpariello was world class with sausage, two different peppers, onions and lemony white wine sauce. Man that's some nonna love right there!   Our waiter? Pulls up a chair to take our order! He was telling us, he was here when the place opened. "Frankie No" liked him so much he flew some wait staff to NYC to observe the operation. Now that's just world class folks. Rao's Vegas really has a great operation, the service and food were impeccable. If you're looking for some great NYC Italian food on your vacation, I highly recommend Rao's Las Vegas  *my cars are off limits. NOBODY drive the Corvette. Nobody...

photos.caption: Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A reproduction of the NYC Raos dining room
Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Penne Vodka
Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

t0hR9ZmnePa58oyH1W9v9Q.text: The meatballs are the best I have ever had. The pork chop is also excellent. I have been here several times and it is definitely the best Italian in Vegas.

2G42GB1qd1b7UrAoGHoQwQ.text: My buddy, Mark Olson of Findley Kia, suggested we try out this joint. Considering he recommended a place that had outstanding food, he wanted bragging rights.  One of the first things one has to do to gauge a decent Italian restaurant, it's the sauce... or gravy. Second, the meatballs. So, we ordered the meatballs for an appetizer. They quickly served out two decently sized meatballs, covered in marinara. If you like creamy meatballs, these will probably be the best you've had. The assorted breads (including olive loaf) were perfect for scooping up some sauce.  For my entree, I decided to put them to the ultimate test... Ossobucco. And they delivered. First off, I love how they chose saffron risotto instead of pasta. Perfectly creamy with a mild saffron flavor; b-e-a-utifully done. The veal was perfectly braised, fork-tender; it was topped with marinara. This was by far, the best Italian food that I've had all year. The only thing lacking was the service. My drink sat empty for over 30-minutes, and even when he came to ask about dessert, I had to bring to his attention. Drinks must never run dry. It's a desert out there.

photos.caption: Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My newest, best ossobucco in Las Vegas. Robust flavors and fork-tender.
Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. These meatballs were nice and creamy, if you&#39;re into that style. Personally, I love meatier meatballs. Still, these were delicious

It_ahVxRzel4BfUzE6_OiA.text: Came here for a late Friday night dinner with my daughter husband and cousin visiting from the Philippines ... the meatballs for appetizer and a drink called "All in the Family" which was like a mix of lemonade soda and Vodka, was so good. We ordered the linguini and clams, shrimp scampi and chicken Parmesan and all were so delish, and the servings were extremely generous.  We had great service and the ambiance was very relaxing...a must go to for an exquisite Italian experience!
