Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nzeO43lnDWhOSvobC9M0ow.text: I've never had a bad meal here - never. The meatballs are great, order them with a side of ricotta cheese:) My favorite dish is the Osso Buco...it's by far the best version of this dish I've ever had. The bone marrow cooks out all over the meat and drains down into the risotto...it's just fantastic. Really I come here just for that dish and the meat balls...I've tried the chicken parm and it's good but the Osso Buco is the ticket!

photos.caption: Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Osso Buco is the best I&#39;ve ever had...the risotto catches all the marrow and meat juices...it&#39;s amazing.

cDYrzsxIDGSZsV7IA6SarA.text: I dislike Caesar's to begin with..so..so..SO much! Then you throw in a s*** show like Rao's and you might as well go home.   We were a large party (17) and called in advance for reservations. They indicated that they had to split us into 2 groups because they couldn't seat 17 together. Not great, but ok. What they failed to mention is that they would seat us 45 minutes apart (even though the restaurant was 1/2 empty!   The food was a whole different pile! It was obvious that everything was pre cooked and sitting under heat lamps before being sauced and served.  All of the meats were dry and tough, pastas over cooked and nearly mushy. No one was able to make it past 1/2 their plate before just giving up in disgust.  With so much great food in Vegas, DON'T waste any time here!

PdhbijLbjN6Kq2XaUKRGAw.text: This place is very hit or miss. Most times the food is great but I had issues when eating with a large party.  I have had many types of waiters here as well. I actually had the sweetest waiter sit at our table and chat with us about food because we are looking to move to Las Vegas. Last night I did not have a nice waiter. Jimmy V was our waiter and acted like he couldn't be bothered with us. I asked for a menu change that I get all the time at Rao's. He wouldn't ask the kitchen and shot me down before the words were completely out of my mouth. Fortunately, he did not come to our table often to check on us.  The staff working with him were nice and attentive. I tipped more then 20% on their behalf.

kIbFOntoZCtEv2F_A0aj0Q.text: The food was ok, not great, but this a warning to folks. I picked a Drumhreller Cabernet from two wines on the menu, got the smaller pour, and paid 19 dollars for it. Was a decent wine. Looked it up when I got back to the room. A bottle of this wine costs $12! How obnoxious is that? Industry standard for by-the-glass wines is 25% of cost. Marking up a wine to this extent is just downright unethical. Shame on the folks who are hosing innocent customers like that.  I'd give them less than one star if I could. Find another place to eat.

SgRbZvjnAYIQQ-WQufTxQw.text: We've lost that loving feeling. This was our third time dining at Rao's in Caesar's Palace and will be our last.  The visit before this one was sub-par, but we gave it another chance thinking we may have caught them on an off night. This time, we were a party of six. Thought we would treat family from out of town. The bad experience began at the hostess stand when we arrived for our reservation. We were greeted with indifference. The two young women at the hostess stand were borderline rude. Never-the-less, we were taken to a lovely round table that would have been perfect for conversation, however, we couldn't even talk to the person beside us because of the noise level. Probably the noisiest place we have ever eaten.  We all had different salads, they were all bland. I had to add lemon, oil and salt and pepper to doctor up my Caesar salad. The linguine and clam sauce, which I remembered being so good, was incredibly bland and tasteless. I asked for some red pepper flakes to sprinkle on and the server brought them over and decided to spoon them over my dish himself for some reason without asking, a full teaspoon! Who does that? The dish was inedible after that. He was a nice guy, but this was not a good move.  I tried my niece's chicken Piccata. It was dry and tough.  Probably the worst part is that this Italian restaurant does not have gluten free pasta. What? My daughter-in-law has celiac. What restaurant in today's world doesn't have gluten free pasta?? Especially one that specializes in PASTA. Unheard of. If you are looking for spaghetti and meatballs and good bread, I would recommend. No complaints there. And of course, their legendary marinara (that you can buy at your local supermarket) is still the best. Other than that, I'd definitely go to one of the other thousands of great restaurants in Vegas instead.

W8et1x36k3pRmqooTugOCQ.text: Loved the food, average service, extremely noisy.   We chose Rao's for our pre-show dinner at Caesars. The original restaurant in New York has only 12 tables and they have a recreation of that room in the Caesar's location which we asked to be seated in. We arrived just after 5:00 and seated in the "New York room".   Our server was right over to introduce herself and take drink orders. We ordered some wine and looked over the menu. They offer all of the Italian classics plus some of their own recipes like Uncle Vincents lemon chicken. We started off with the famous meatballs and split a caesar salad. We chose the veal parm and the lamb chops for our entrees which our server said was one of her favorite dishes.   The wine and bread came out quickly with the meatballs shortly after. The meatballs were excellent! Huge baseball size meatballs that were so moist I don't know how they didn't fall apart. Their marinara sauce on top was just perfect.   Now we waited, and waited for our salads. They didn't come out until 6:00 PM, 45 minutes after we ordered, or about 30-35 minutes after the meatballs. Our server never came over to check on us or apologize for the wait. Im not sure if she put them in late or the kitchen got backed up, but it was way too long. Once the salad finally came out we really enjoyed it. Plenty big to share for two. A very traditional caesar topped with large pieces of shaved parmesan.   The entrees arrived right after the salads as they should. The veal parm was huge, served bone-in and covered in melted cheese and marinara, an excellent choice. The lamp chops were three smaller sized chops cooked perfectly medium rare. They were served with potatoes and green beans. Although the potatoes were good, the green beans were boiled to death and lacked any seasoning.   For dessert we chose the peanut butter tart and the tiramisu. Both of the desserts were fantastic! Would order either of them again in a second. The tiramisu was super creamy, one of the best Ive had.   After about 5:30 the NY room was packed full and the noise level was extremely loud to the point you couldn't even carry on a conversation. I would not sit there again.   Our server wasn't unfriendly, but just didn't provide great service for this type of restaurant. This was a 3.5 star experience but I will up it to 4 because the food was so good.

RjrMDYlrzG5ri6UOucjbag.text: I didnt realize the Rao's pasta sauce in our Kroger was famous.  Rao's was a suggestion for our Vegas trip.  It is located in Caesars Palace.  We made dinner reservations on a Wednesday.  We shared the meatball appetizer-- comes with two, perfect to share; very tender and delicious.  I got the lasagna and learned after the fact that it was recently on a Food Network show!  It was very good, but highly suggest you share it; it is very rich and hearty.  The prices are pretty steep for Italian food, but everything we ordered was well done.  The bread was fresh and soft.  And our waiter was great, very personable.  Highly recommend.

Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef lasagna

VIXGg1petKgMqTgp2Jq23w.text: Wow!!!! This was amazing food! Great service and the cheese cake was the best I've ever had! We can't wait to go back!

i2yPPbYoMoDR8ngVYfR0jw.text: The restaurant is located in Caesar's Palace but is set up as a restaurant with an "outside" dining area.  The value of the outside area is that if you want to watch a sports event, you can see the screens at the bar right next to the restaurant.   I had the beet salad which was quite large and had lots of beets and greens with a dusting of goat cheese.  It was very tasty and I enjoyed it.  For my entree, I had the beef lasagne that has beef bolognese sauce and three cheeses.  It was very good and quite filling.  I couldn't finish it all.  The wines range from about 12-19 dollars a glass-similar to most prices in Vegas.  The service was excellent throughout my meal.  The one downside in eating on the outside portion was that there were quite a few smokers that stood by the rail.  It may not always be that way but something to consider.

aWhBHcTfeRXP5_UGE3_GLw.text: Excellent service and food from start to finish!  Wonderful bread basket, clams as appetizer, vodka penne pasta, meatballs and an amazing pear-ricotta ravioli(May sound like an add combo, but really fantastic. The server was attention and made sure we were able to get out in time for our show. It's on the pricey side but that is to be expected on the Strip. It's at Caesar's Palace so great place to go before seeing Absinthe show!

R9neV15izmv8SqdMTZkryg.text: Fantastic Italian meal. Our table of 4 had no complaints about anything. Crab carbonara was my favorite.

photos.caption: Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9-RvbeoL1tZgwrslS5LlzA.text: We make sure to come here every time we are in Vegas! We recently came here with a large party for my sisters birthday.  We were fortunate to be served by Ricky.  He was so sweet, professional and took such wonderful care of us.  At one point my sister spilled marinara on her blouse and there he was with a Tide stick! Best service and meatballs!

dbB7ifYBNFWg4kqDgJQQqg.text: Great restaurant!!  Best Italian food in Vegas.  Better than Il Mulino and the others.  And they are all pretty good.  The pork chop dish is the best.  The past a dishes are very good as well as the chipinno.  They have a very good happy hour.  Try the seafood dip; it's delicious.  This is a must try restaurant.

yLDkX9sUxpjqvtJBR0VOXw.text: The food was all very good, however, the mediocre service brought down the experience. Hostess was not friendly, and barely spoke. Waiter was lukewarm and inattentive. Water glasses weren't ever refilled, basically threw the dessert menus at us, then waited over 15 minutes for our check. Complete opposite of the real Rao experience in Harlem.

NCvQgJt6xfO4cUbRT7tikw.text: I love this place, John our waiter was 1st class all the way. Thank you for an amazing dinner.

YKHvzWMCN14-RENCr8iLsQ.text: Good drinks and fun atmosphere. I really wish that the bartenders were wearing name tags though. I couldn't get there attention to get a drink because I had no idea what there name was!!

iZOAh-umwjxmDSfw8WZgPQ.text: Spectacular as usual. Great food, great service, great cocktails. A must when we come to Vegas!

GunZWsQjCkCnO9UFm0xLCQ.text: Nice atmosphere, very good service. Baked clams overcooked and dry. Rigatoni with meat sauce I enjoyed. Cannoli was very good. Meatballs I heard so much about sitting around way to long probably on a steam table was so acidic I had heartburn for hours. The arugula beet salad excellent!! I would not rush to go back

AwROG26p292lS2GsleGCCA.text: We had eaten at Nobu's the night before and were very disappointed. Eating at Rao's was a totally different experience. I had the Osso Bucco and my wife had the shrimp scampi. Both were great. The service was prompt and attentive. Prices were moderate. Eat here first if you love Italian food.   We will go back to eat their famous meatballs.

5qeLD6B9qjMhenWA3yT2Tg.text: Wonderfully decorated restaurant with fabulous staff including the owner we met on this trip! Special thank you to the owner for singing to our birthday girl, Jessica C, and offering up complimentary tray of desserts!  I like the ordering options here. You can order individually, or choose some dishes that are made for sharing. However, when I dine with friends all our food ends up being sharing!  Also it is a good place to pick for diners who like solely plant based food and/or meat.   Our dining experience happened after a show at the Palace, so we dined late. This may be a tip for late diners, some menu items may be out! Eeeeeekkkk... this happened to my friend, Mel K, but luckily she found another suitable option.  Our table sampled a variety of dishes:  -roasted beet salad -caesar salad -special of the day - salmon -grilled veggies -several of the pasta dishes -and not to forget the meats  I really enjoyed the roasted beet salad for the flavour and fresh ingredients. I also liked that my greens were not soaked in dressing =D  Caesar salad was good but nothing interesting to make it stand out. The salmon was terrific as well as the grilled veggies.  One con is the restroom situation. For the size of this restaurant and location within the Caesars Palace, there is a single stall bathroom for each male and females. This means for the ladies, a LOOOONNNNG line. Not a favourite when dining.  However, the bathroom was large and cozy for those "private" moments.

photos.caption: Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Compliments of the house!
Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan seared salmon

MNPusOJFEomWzcFdt70gqA.text: My girlfriend picked this restaurant because it is the same as the original one from Harlem, New York.  I loved it, the food, the New Yorker, their signature martini and the waitress.   Great service!

wWXAHcjufd4_6hEbz9YYug.text: This place is awsome, a piece of history straight out of Harlem.  Food and service was excellent.

ev4Gox5iNMZAQe-gmalzUA.text: I love the show "Best Thing I Ever Ate"  ,on the Las Vegas episode Anne Burrell talks about her favorite dish at Rao's. She made The Chicken Scarpariello sound so delectable, that on this trip to Vegas I went to Rao's to try Chicken Scarpariello for myself. Oh my goodness Anne has one amazing pallet!! The Chicken Scarpariello was     one stunning dish. The dish comes with fork tender chicken and sausage, fresh peppers and onion, pickled hot peppers, and a lemon buttery white wine briney sauce, that's flavorful and unique. I can usually can never finish my plate, but with this dish I licked it clean. It's so hard to look classy eating this dish. I was picking up the chicken with my fingers, sopping up the sauce with my bread, licking my fingers, and moaning in ecstasy with every bite.  In other words I recommend Rao's. The staff was great too!

photos.caption: Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I ate it ALL!!!

P1uP5QGy_F3RUltmMMvRcQ.text: Restaurant Week is a great time to experience new places, so at long last Diane and I opted to give Rao's a try.  It was offering an array of several choices including dead-ahead NYC red sauce Italian fare.  And, that is exactly what we received.  What I had was delicious.  We began with very good bread and butter, which for me was followed by an excellent House Salad that included radicchio, white cucumber, bright red tomato, lettuce consisting of fresh crisp mixed greens, Red Onions, and a very tasty light Italian vinaigrette.  Meanwhile, Diane devoured her gooey Mozzarella in Carrozza, which was just what a diner would want to receive for an appetizer of fried mozzarella.  For an entree I was presented with Spaghetti and Meatballs, or more correctly Spaghetti and Meatball.  But the quite large 6 oz. meatball--constructed of a mixture of beef, veal, and pork--truly delivered excellent flavor, along with the tasty Marinara Sauce that was generously ladled over it and al dente spaghetti.  Uncle Vincent's Famous Lemon Chicken was good, too, but the lemon flavor was strong, tart, and a bit overpowering for those not overly fond of lemon.  The Roasted Potatoes accompanying this dish were simply great.  The service staff was extremely friendly and helpful, except our busboy briefly fell down on the job by forgetting to replace removed silverware even after our entrees arrived.  Our helpful and extremely knowledgeable waitress stepped in to correct the error, and enable us to continue on a fine gustatory adventure.  For dessert, creamy Cheesecake was very satisfying accompanied by plump and juicy blueberries, although for Restaurant Week it was in rounded rather than classic form as a junior version of the classic V-shaped wedge.  And, Diane enjoyed her small Tiramisu.  It was a memorable meal, and I look forward to returning to Caesars Palace soon for another Rao's meatball fix and trying other attractive menu items here.

photos.caption: Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vincent&#39;s Famous Lemon Chicken
Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Finished Product: Rao&#39;s Meatball &amp; Spaghetti in Marinara Sauce
Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tossing and Ladling Spaghetti and Marinara Sauce Tableside

grGz6gOOrqMILosUObx_Hg.text: Sitting at the bar I ordered a Caesar Salad/light dressing the Eggplant Parmesan and a glass of red wine. The salad was returned drenched with dressing for a replacement. Portion was very good and was served with large square slices of cheese. Romaine was crisp as were the croutons.  The Eggplant was served on an oval plate with about 6 rounds of thick Eggplant fried, covered with cheese and a minimal amount of red sauce, no side of pasta. I asked the Server and was told no pasta with the entree. Entree was minimal, Eggplant was not tender and I would guess it was prepped, frozen and reheated. I did not confirm that but I've had Eggplant Parmesan millions of times and this did not taste fresh and was below average with higher than average pricing.  Sorry to say this is a one and done.

1RyobDaEmUXQ80AR7Vid3Q.text: Never disappoints. Been coming here for 10 years and have never had a bad meal. Excellent wine list, Service and food. Reservations on open table. Easy to get seating for large parties and is not loud like other restaurants so you can have a proper business meeting. Get half orders of pasta (portions are huge) to get the meatballs.

bnYpJ8YE0uN661IPWtQKTg.text: What a wonderful, nostalgic restaurant with great food and drinks. Made reservations months ago and was not disappointed! Staff was friendly and very attentive.

cWhFhRVwit8XE-XRt40NYw.text: We made reservations for dinner here before going to see a show.  It came highly recommended.  We were not disappointed!  Appetizer:  We shared the meatballs as an appetizer.  They were very tasty, especially with the bread that was served.  Dinner:  I ordered the linguine with tomato sauce and my husband ordered the lasagna.  The red sauce was amazing!!  Dessert:  despite being stuffed, we ordered the tiramisu.  I don't even generally like tiramisu, but, this one was amazing!  To top it off, the service was excellent!  We will be back!

Zfa3CO1lfxGPZA1MZTpFUA.text: Love this place. Tucked away in back of Caesars Palace - quiet and dimly lit ambiance. Really nice inside with pictures of old celebrities, etc. service was impeccable. They bring you fresh bread first, and had the meatballs as starters. They are huge! Easily spilt between two people. The Eggplant Parmigiana was excellent as well as the house salad with vinaigrette. Just a good place to enjoy a nice night out in Vegas.

ygL0sJqVGbAnQX2tLu_vsA.text: Would have liked to go with 3.5, but can't do on Yelp.  I'll keep this a little briefer than some of my other Yelpers, but I will echo what a lot of people say:  Service: Good, but impersonal. I'm not a big fan of the 'fawning waitstaff' but I don't mind a little how-do-you-do, where you all from, etc. Nothing of that sort here. I also like a little feedback and input on food choices and while 'It's up to you' is a fine answer, just not the best one. Greeting at the front was nothing special; just the usual 'girl got the job because she's pretty' hosting style.   Food: As everyone says, the meatballs are fantastic. Everyone at the table enjoyed what they received and we got a variety. My veal I felt was a bit overdone but I inferred that 'well done' is their style. Portions of everything are large. We all ordered salads but could have easily ordered half and split them; no one finished their salads. Desserts were marvelous, again the table got a variety and all were gone.   Pricing: It's in a high-end hotel on the LV Strip, so expect a little bit of a bump. I would argue a little too big, but nothing to get excited about.   We had no issues with delivery times or with our table placement. Yes, it was a bit louder than I would like but again nothing to get excited about.   Reservations are a must. Give yourself a little extra time to get there as it is 'in the back'. Also, we were late as the front of Caesars gets crazy at that time and we didn't give ourselves enough time to get there.

F0dhqSelD6KsoYZt_bYUVQ.text: My out of town buddy wanted Italian somewhere he hadn't been before.  He's a frequent visitor to Vegas so he has been to most of the good ones on the strip (thanks to me! ha!).  Throw in Restaurant Week and a lack of last minute tables available at 9pm on a Saturday and I was back at Rao's for the first time in 6 years.    I wanted to dine in the Christmas room again but there was a wait so we just opted for the lower floor area facing the pool.  We ordered a plate of antipasto (prosciutto di parma, mild sopresata, marinated artichokes, gaeta olives, buffalo mozzarella, tomatoes, grana padano, gorgonzola cheese, dressed arugula) to kick things off and that was very good.  Everything was fresh and that was a nice substitute instead of four people getting individual salads.  The osso bucco was literally calling my name right off the page but I figured I could come back for that any other time of the year.  I decided to take advantage of the great value of Restaurant Week and use the couple of bucks saved on drinking more wine.    The appetizer was "Mozzarella in Carrozza" which was described as fried fresh mozzarella sandwich served with marinara.  In reality it was 2 HUGE wedges of deep fried breaded mozzarella.  So unhealthy yet so delicious.  Fried cheese has never tasted bad...ever.  There were four options for the main course but since everyone else was getting pasta (scampi, spaghetti and meatballs, shells) I decided on the pork chop and MAN OH MAN was that a solid choice.  It was a double cut of pork that was pan seared and sauteed with hot and sweet cherry peppers.  It was juicy, spicy, well seasoned and I ended up gnawing on the bones at the end like a dog.    I took only one bite of the tiramisu since I was so full and my wife ate the rest of it.    There are so, so, so many Italian options around these days (and better values to be had) but I wouldn't mind splurging a little more for this gem a few times a year.

z-SC1jGcUQlph2Z0F4_tcg.text: We got lucky and found seats at the bar.  Service was quick and prompt.  Bartender was busy but attentive.  Our orders came out fast.  Meatballs were yummy, my favorite.  Pasta dish was just okay.  Dessert was a huge serving.  Yummy bread served with a buffet of spreads to sample.

photos.caption: Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pbIiySkMCbsIikzQ77owTQ.text: Hands down the best Italian food I've had. The meatballs are to die for. My son said he could've had the fried cheese as a meal it was so good. I got the sundried tomato and chicken pasta, it was fabulous. The chicken parmesan was great, but huge, my kids could've shared one. Can't wait to go back when I visit again.

yspSksCjoE6FCljIQeVJVw.text: Let's start with the good. Service was excellent. Wait staff was very attentive, prompt and courteous.  That's all I can say positive.  The food was only just barely average.  Meatballs were terrible.  Chicken parm was ok but nothing to rave about.  Portions were small.  The prices were ridiculously high even for Vegas standards.  Definitely won't be back. Oh and when it came time for the check they refused to split it by person. Only would split it equally 2 or 4 ways.

G6AI9ZjH6ZtdeyC8XfakBg.text: OK, so, I didn't want to eat here. I felt it was too touristy and ridiculous and I didn't want pasta. But, in order to appease my traveling companions, I agree to come here. And, it was OK, but I'm still a little upset about my $36 shrimp fra diavolo WITH NO PASTA and only 5 shrimp. It wasn't special enough for that price. To be completely honest, I'm also still upset about my teeny tiny escarole and bean soup that cost $15. Don't get me wrong: I get it. Restaurants are expensive and even moreso in Las Vegas but I have issues paying this much for traditional Italian-American cuisine. I'll stick to my local places in the future and skip this one. There are MUCH better places in Vegas where I'd choose to drop my cash.

fWE60QqVHzs9C79Ba1FZ4g.text: We've been here twice - both times we had great service and wonderful food.  The price...meh.  It's Vegas.  You want cheap, head to Circus Circus for a hot dog.  My husband and I get pasta and the lemon chicken and share - it's the perfect amount, so then we can have the peanut butter chocolate tart, which should not be missed. The pasta is always cooked perfectly (one of my pet peeves at too many restaurants) and the lemon chicken is delicious! As I mentioned, the service is great and Frankie, the owner is a sweetheart - very genuine. When you make a reso, ask to sit in a booth.  Better ambiance.

cfXk7hpgYIHbydVNU2TL2w.text: I was watching Food Network one day and i saw a competition between Mesa Grill (Bobby Flay's restaurant) and Rao's in Las Vegas.  About a month or so after watching the show...I had the opportunity to go to Vegas and stay at the Caesar's Palace (where both restaurants are in)....so we decided to try both restaurants for ourselves.  Rao's was just OK.  I ordered the meatballs (which were supposed to be amazing....but were just ok...actually kinda bland to me)  My BF ordered the Spaghetii (which we shared), Connie ordered some kind of risotto dish and her hubby ordered some kind of shrimp pasta in olive oil dish that was also...pretty bland.  Rao's was just another Italian Restaurant...nothing to drool over or dream about.   Service was decent...  Mesa Grill was my winner (5 stars for me!)

02HX4C_2WJja9stY46p6CA.text: Went to Rao's last night with some friends who were in from the East Coast. The service was excellent, the food was fantastic - one friend had the spinach ravioli special, another had the Pollo Scarpariello with special requests, my husband had the Gnocchi alla Bolognese, and I had the Vitello alla Parmigiana. We all split a side of meatballs, and there were plenty to go around.  I haven't had food like this in years. The meatballs alone rivaled my Italian grandmother's, and everything else was fantastic. We will definitely be back.

yQCoe6I-bfPCa3bIXN8jkw.text: The most expensive plate of spaghetti and meatballs I've ever had, but also the best. Holy god, it's good. They sure don't make it easy for you, though, as two meatballs are $15 and a plate of spaghetti marinara was $22.   Worth it? Definitely once. Am I coming back? Who knows. That pasta will sure live on in my memories though. Yum.  I'm gonna try and recreate it from the cookbook.

photos.caption: Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RZcgs1c8Bbc-wDTNMZYbrQ.text: I ate here with my fiance in May of 2015. We wanted a quick dinner before we went to see our show so we decided to try out Rao's.  We decided to go eat at the bar.  I can verify that the customer service was top notch here.  Our server/bartender, whose name I forgot,  was excellent serving us.  He explained in detail and recommended us food and served it quick and fast, even assuring us that we wouldn't be late for our show.  Not only did he provide us with knowledge of the menu but he made us feel welcome and chatted about our trip.  A dinner is not only good food but excellent service.  My fiance raved about the steak they brought out and told me it was one of the best steaks he had.  I had a cheese pasta,  it was delicious.  They also give you complimentary bread and I think it was fried cheese.  The only thing I was disappointed about was not having enough time to actually enjoy my food since we were in a rush.  I've also ordered a majito and was worried that I wouldn't finish it in time.  Our bartender took my drink and put it in a to go cup for free.  Now that's what I would call a restaurant I would eat at again!

wrHhpO-8M9-pfIhSAImrCQ.text: The food was good - pasta was cooked just right. Vodka sauce was so good. Meatball was above the average.  The only problem was the price. Although lots of Vegas restaurants are overpriced, it's not worthy to pay $30 for the pasta I had. Do I want to go back in the future? Probably NY location, but not one in Vegas.

MUA5O0_fDTRVlYAxNaDGVA.text: Terrible service for a place that is priced so high. The good was decent but nothing to get too excited about. I was also annoyed that they would not split our checks.overall I would not recommend.

zq9Ko2oIC6zmR2q2HJl9tA.text: Excellent dinner last night with my family. The eggplant Parmesan was cooked to perfection, the crunch on the outside was so tasty. Everyone enjoyed their meal.

1RcjFFb2Hyn7TGaPYCX2wg.text: Disappointed with the reviews.. I gave this a 2 star because I have had better pasta at Olive Garden.. We stopped here for lunch in high hopes of great food but we should have gone across the walk way to the bakery and gotten a sandwich. The pasta came back hard and our pizza was unappetizing..

iFw1OZrCAB9w88yWKY1QzQ.text: My girlfriend and I visited this "fine" establishment in May of 2010. We had budgeted about 150-200 dollars for that evening's food. We were planning on treating ourselves and as such we had heard of this wonderful place at Caesar's... Little did we know what offense we had committed by being ever so slightly hungry ever so slightly too early.   We dropped by Rao's about a half hour before they opened and inquired as to when they were opening for the night. A rather friendly woman informed us that we would have to come back a bit later. Oh well... that's just fine, but right as we were leaving a waiter swept us up and no you don't have to leave. Take a seat and I'll get you a couple of menus. And right as we were about to sit down a lovely curve ball.   "No you can't sit down... I was just messing with you.. leave!" He started laughing at us and just walked away. This sort of behavior is simply inexcusable.   The Bottom line: This may have been one individual that should lose his job. I only went there once. Their food may be wonderful, but I will never eat there on future trips to Vegas and I hope this gives you pause before going there yourself.

FEVVBb-3c9yoh0O5Nmj4IQ.text: Good atmosphere. But the food was nothing special, especially considering the price.

ZwyQiIuu94nD8BiaenxVIg.text: I don't get to the New York area lately so I was eager to try this outpost of a renown New York Italian restaurant.  I had the veal parmigiana and it was great. A big piece of pounded veal, lightly breaded but still juicy. It was covered in san marzano tomatoes and generous amount of cheese. Even I could not finish it. The house wine was surprisingly good.  Reading some of the other reviews of this place, I am debating on how to deal with the pricing at this establishment. The pricing is high for Italian food but normal for what you pay at a restaurant for a meal in a better hotel in Las Vegas. And if it comes down to quality - that is definitely there.  Plus they turned away Madonna at the NY location - that's worth an extra star by itself.

fPaesmLDwxcy0i-pq73KZg.text: Staying at Caesars for a convention, wanted to stay inside the hotel, so we made reservations at Rao's.  Good, not great.  We had good service, good food.  I got the lemon chicken and it was not a disappointment.  Quite good, really.    The reason I find it to be so-so it that there was really nothing special about it.  We went in, ate dinner off a typical menu, that was it.    Not an 'experience' which one would expect at Caesar's

NG4gYyQzenIl9xrVFDX2Dg.text: I went in there with high expectations and came out disappointed. I got the linguine and clams. It was alright but for $30, definitely not worth it. The dish had plenty of linguine but maybe a dozen real clams. The rest of the chopped clams came from a can. My husband had their famous $30 Lemon chicken. He liked it but he said the chicken had too many small bones in the pieces. Caesar salad was excellent. The verdict, we probably will never go back there.

67-L4y304s7HF99cAuxJfQ.text: This place was pretty good. We walked around on a Thursday night looking for a place to eat and were laughed at by places for not having a reservation. We found this place and they sat us within 15 minutes! With all the food we had and tried my fav was the Ceaser salad and the meatballs. The linguini was not very good. The penne was not cooked all the way. Someone got the ravioli purses which were good but really sweet. I couldnt see eating a whole bowl of that. I ate 2 and that was plenty. Overall the service was great. For 4 of us our bill was about $200 an that included a bottle of wine two beers and two long islands. They even gave us glasses to take our drinks to go! I wish more places at home in st Louis did that :-)

7816TgaozQVb9BlPzsKQSA.text: Had a reservation, the hostess was totally rude.  We were seated at a table with no set-up, salt...nothing.  Took about 10 minutes for waiter to appear. My sister asked a few questions and the waiter appeared to be slightly bored as he answered her questions.  We had to ask for bread and olive oil as our overly dressed salads were delivered.  45 minutes later a different waiter appeared and asked if we would like coffee and dessert, HELLO- we never received our entrees.  We were told that our waiter had gone home lol!  This is getting worse by the minute.  Our clams arrived and 6 of 12 were not open, we also split a pasta dish which was so undercooked, al dente would be stretching it.  The worst service I have ever experienced, the food was terrible, and suffice it to say, the Rao's fiasco ruined a much awaited evening.

9WR9M6WiXODbSGS23CTx-Q.text: We squeezed in lunch at this place between losing on the slots and a two hour streak on the craps table.  The meatballs were meatballs. Large, tomatoey and tasty. Not everyone loved the maranara spaghetti. I ordered the quatro formaggio pizza and it was great. The white truffle oil they drizzled on top wasn't overpowering but just enough. Our party of 7 shared everything we ordered, and I think my pizza was the most tasty. Other things I liked were the prosciutto, sausage rosemary-crusted pizza and the cheese in the calzone. wow.  The Caesar's salad (lol) was pretty good, and the (housemade?) pickled anchovies on the side were so great (if you are a True fish lover).   Sometimes it is difficult to separate the food from the company, and what really gives a restaurant 4 stars? I had excellent company on a great vacation, but still, the food here stood out with fresh and quality ingredients. It was a lot of fun sitting on the padded park benches outside the place eating lunch with friends and family!

FpB_8jHrswegswH8UK0RIQ.text: Meatballs, Meatballs, Meatballs. That's all I can say. My fiancee and I decided to try Rao's as we can never get into the one here in NyC. They are known for their meatballs, so in passing through Caesar's for lunch, we stopped in. We ordered meatball calzones. Unreal. We also had antipasto salad to start. All delicious, amazing, and priced right. And there was no wait for a table. I think it wouldve been more appropriate to have this place in NYNY, but it was great nonetheless. No matter what you order GET A SIDE OF MEATBALLS.

nVts-7SCs9tNLaLqi3g_JA.text: Had dinner here right when they opened for dinner, so the place was pretty empty and the wait was short.  Ordered an appetizer to share between me and one other person, a pasta each, and a glass of wine each. The food was mediocre...my friend ordered the ravioli with cranberries, which was much better than the penne vodka I ordered.  Probably wouldn't come back here...food was just ok and extremely overpriced.

FJAg8oKiOsbgpfTjQ8d5tw.text: Great classic Italian.  The meatball, eggplant parm, and lemon chicken were delicious.  The cheesecake and tiramisu were also worth the calories.

sgNcMpabbqEi4qTDxzU6rA.text: We had a lovely dinner at Rao's. We went for the famous meatballs so were a little surprised that they are only available as a side dish since my DH had his heart set on spaghetti and meatballs. Of course we had to order them as a side dish. we went with friends who use the Rao's meatball recipe at home and of course wanted to see if theirs measure up. Be warned that the meatballs can be a meal in themselves. You only get 2, but they are enormous! as a result we ordered too much food. Between us the DH and I got the spaghetti bolognese, the meatballs, and lamb chops. We would have been happy after the spaghetti and the meatballs. The lamb chops were absolutely delicious, but put me way past the point of being stuffed.   The bolognese was delicious, as were the meatballs. for wine we got a chianti classico which was just ok. It would be nice to see more affordable options on their wine list. Our service was very good and the prices weren't outrageous, especially for Vegas. After trying the meatballs I had to come home and look up the recipe, and it has now replaced our old standby meatball recipe. There are a lot of great restaurants in Vegas, but I wouldn't hesitate returning to Rao's.

pwCt5nKlb2kRHslqbIEN_A.text: THE BEST Spicy Bloody Mary can be had at Rao's. I spent 4 days at a conference at Caesar's and everyday I stopped in for that most delicious drink. Make sure Peter, the bartender makes it for you. Tell him the doctors sent you.

iqbdzbYFRUut09U7sfSKnQ.text: I wish I could give it more stars but the service is very inconsistent. My husband and I have not tried all the food on the menu but I like the famous Lemon Chicken and the Frito Misto. However, the service is always lacking. When we eat here, it's always full so I figure it's the reason, but I wish for once, the service would be better. It always feel like we get ignored :( I will go back because I like the food, but if the service doesn't change, well, I think I will just do what the locals do, get away from the Strip!

3KhKJ0wJRtytKdudUH-Dyw.text: Terrible service, rude manager, mediocre food.  Do yourself a favor and go down a few stores to the Palm or even down the strip a little to McDonalds.  Anything would be better than this place.

7ufHAZeVuMKw_wHe5ASekA.text: Okay, admission up front, we saw Rao's on Throwdown on the Food Channel too.  That out of the way, we had a very good meal - not sublime, but very good.  The insalata de frutti de mare is very nice, everything is very fresh and light, and the dressing was very good.  The gnocci bolognese was very good (probably top dish), and the meatballs were a very nice companion (not the best meatballs I've ever had, those would be Arturo's mama's at Amalfi in Indianapolis of all places, but still very tasty), and then the veal chop was also a very nice finish to the evening.  We also enjoyed a very nice and very reasonably priced bottle of Amarone to go with the meal.  Despite some of the other comments, service was very good, even though we were there on a Friday night and it was quite busy (is it never not busy here?).  All in all, a fun evening, and certainly easier than hassling "Frankie No" for a reservation for 6 months to eat in New York!

xbWFW-V9JWzb88AdbZPFUg.text: So happy to be able to try this restaurant in Vegas. Definitely a must while in town. Food was amazing and so was the atmosphere

C1hGSF0iNNpEOVqxue96eA.text: The ambiance is charming. We sat with a view looking out to a patio. The service was very good efficient without being intrusive.  My husband and I split a seafood salad, which was very good. However, my lasagna was mediocre and my husband was disappointed with his spaghetti.

Hj3GkwZcThVp24ixBEvwuA.text: My Wife and I dined at Rao the other night.  The food was wonderful and the service was better.  Russ was a great waiter, and Evan was a great bus boy who brought us anything we ask for in a flash.  The food was exceptional after we were seated immediately without a reservation on a Saturday night.  Great food.  Great Service, and good prices.  Wallace Eastman

5DGLZarklW-OoZIMvCLTzw.text: I ate here mainly for convenience sake because I was seeing a show later the same evening at Caesar's. After skimming some reviews and learning of the New York roots this establishment has I would say that my expectations were set high. I have no complaints about the service or the atmosphere. Both were top notch. I really don't have a complaint about the food either. However,  three main dishes with an appetizer and desert and three sodas came to $220.  Which would be fine except that the food was really no better than a run of the mill macaroni grill or whichever chain Italian restaurant you choose.

J7DNf1gQ03dgN8eSvVN16A.text: Do people even realize what Rao's is in New York?  I had to try Rao's in Las Vegas because the chances of me actually eating at the NY location is slim to none.  First of all, the Manhattan location doesn't accept reservations (calling their number is hilarious - basically a thank you for calling but go away message).  Secondly, I don't know any mobsters.  My chances of actually getting Regis Philbin to invite me is slim (though oddly enough, I think this is my only likely hope).  Lastly, I can't pony up enough $$ to actually buy myself a table there (one of 11 I think), that would be if one actually became free, which would never happen.  Then there are the logistics of eating at Rao's - since they are in the Hood, and you have to hire a car service to wait for you while you eat, or have someone drive your car and wait or something...     In short, Las Vegas will have to be a flimsy, Disney-fied, substitute to experiencing the real thing.  The first question I had was, how could they open such a large restaurant, with so many tables and translate the experience from New York to Vegas?  The answer - Since no one has actually eaten at the original, it doesn't matter.  The decor is upscale pizza joint like, red and white checkered tableclothes and lots of photos of celebrities who apparently have made it in to Rao's.  I ordered the stuffed zucchini blossoms that were stuffed with cheese and anchovies and deep fried.  It was salty and gooey goodness.  At any Italian restaurant, I like to order either a bolognese or a red sauce type pasta, as I think it's a barometer to how good it is.  So, I had the rigatoni with red sauce and pancetta.  I have to say, it was very good, but not out of this world exceptional.  The meatballs didn't disappoint - moist and tasty.    The service was very attentive - I think they imported some characters from New York to add charm.  It worked.  Overall, the atmosphere was an upscale but down home Italian American restaurant.  Here it seems like the recipes were handed down through generations, and there is lots of care taken to make solid dishes.  You won't find the food complicated by new fangled things like truffle oil and flavored foams.  I think it's exactly this which keeps Rao's in New York exclusive and packed every night with loyal diners, and they were successful in recreating (some of) the moment in Las Vegas.

FHipk0h4ha_dM8FlZlNjNQ.text: Right now, it's my favorite place to eat in Las Vegas.  The food is just so darn good.  The only part I don't like is having to make a reservation months in advance....but it's worth it.  I love how they encourage you to split everything and then serve it in courses...Here are my recommendations:  Start with the Antipasto Platter - yummy poopoo platter of proscuitto, cheeses, roasted red peppers, olives...oh so good.  The roasted red peppers alone would be great too.  Then, share/sample the Pasta in Vodka sauce and the Meat Balls (huge savory moist meat).  They say they are famous for the Lemon Chicken...but we had the Veal.  If you do the above, stick with the Veal Chop with Cherry Peppers.   We did the Veal Chop and the Veal Parmesan (which is also fabulous - so much melted cheese it looks like a pizza)!  But the contrast of the veal chop to the pasta and meatball is really superb!  No room for dessert...but go win some money - you're in Vegas, baby!  Rao's - please open up a location in Los Angeles.

cx_JB1r3vSuZU95YQfIQRg.text: It was our first GNO (girls night out) and also wanted to celebrate the Las Vegas Restaurant Week.  My friend decided to go to Rao's since they had several options in their prix fixe menu compared to the other restaurants participating in this event.  So we made a reservation and was seated right away.  The restaurant was probably 3/4 full when we got in at 7:15pm.  The waiter did get our drinks and orders immediately.  I got a pear martini and it was good.  My friends got a Malibu and Pomegranate martini and they all enjoyed it.  All four of us ordered the prix fixe menu. We had baked clams topped with bread crumbs for the appetizer and it was good but just a tad salty.  The main entree took a little longer to arrive after the appetizer.  This was when the service started to suck. So we got our entrees and I got the ravioli with Bartlett pears and ricotta cheese topped with dried cranberries and basil.  It was pretty good.  You can taste the sweetness of the pear, tartness of the cranberries and saltiness of the Parmesan cheese.  I liked the favors all together.  My other friends got the pork chop with roasted vegetables and they both said that it was dry.  I believe one of them even mentioned that they wanted medium and both still came out dry.  So probably 15 minutes after we finished our entrees, that's when the waiter decided to show up and asked us if we wanted desserts.  I got the strawberry shortcake and it was disappointing. It was very ordinary and it tasted like it was not from a upper scale restaurant.  Some of my friends had tiramisu and I tasted it, it was just mediocre. I'm a dessert person and I always look forward to happy ending desserts.  After desserts, we probably waited 20 minutes to get our bill! Unbelievable.   I was expecting better service, food and decor since this restaurant is a Michelin starred restaurant.   Even though the food was mediocre, I still enjoyed my girl friends' company!

slgqzgt0I93-3Xl70aI7vQ.text: The wife heard of this place on the internet that the original restaurant is in New York City and Cesar's Palace was able to convince the owners to open one in the hotel.  The name is pronounced ray-ohs which we got completely wrong.  We came here with friends. I got the linguine with clams in white sauce and I tried the spaghetti bolgonese, meatballs and mushroom risotto.  The risotto was the best dish and the rest were good.  I can't say the food is better than other Italian restaurants we've been to.  The prices are expensive here for what you get.  They give a decent amount of food but not huge portions. We left satisfied but not stuffed.

UzfAOvqQGfCKOJzSqDwmBw.text: Besides the meatball the food was not good.  Had the veal piccotta which was drowned in sauce and the mash potatoes were out of a box!!!

W1yf3GD4VWDXK4UsTtFQ_Q.text: Fantasic meal all around at Rao's!  I cannot say enough good things about this restaurant. I was a little hesitant to try this place, thinking they just have classic dishes and I didn't want to be disappointed by such a historic establishment. So glad I was wrong! While the menu is comprised of all the classic Italian dishes, they are done extremely well. Our server was great. He got the vibe we wanted to take our time and paced our meal beautifully. The meatballs were incredible, the best I have ever had. The vodka penne was also one of the best dishes I've ever had. It wasn't too heavy, but full of flavor. The decor is great too, typical Italian joint!  Highly recommend Rao's for a great meal all around.

fq3g6MQUR7BmFUZ1iIzb2A.text: Really good southern Italian cooking. Great staff who are really warm and friendly. I would recommend this place w/o hesitation to anyone.

u-vQ95s2nJeMyM--QWd_yQ.text: Wow this place is expensive! I wouldn't go here on your own dime. Tried several people's entrees but the lasagna was the best by far. Probably the best I've ever had.  It's like $30 bucks per "course". Good enough for two to share but not much more.

--cj8HbXv4matZ-xIMV3Ag.text: This place was freaking unbelievable!  Hands down, one of the best meals I have ever had.  Ever!  We waltzed into this place on a Thursday evening expecting a long wait.  Instead, we were seated almost immediately and were happy to be seated in the area near the bar.  Our waitress was friendly and helpful when we had menu and wine questions.  She helped us choose a fantastic Chianti and she suggested we try the meatballs...I am SO GLAD she "made" us get them!    Everyone at our table ordered something different and we each loved our entrees.  We had two appetizers - bruschetta and caprese salad.  The bruschetta was unbelievable and the caprese salad was perfection.    The stars at this restaurant are truly the sauces and the meatballs.  The sauce I had on my angel hair pasta was marinara and was just out of this world.  The meatballs were fantastic and melt-in-your-mouth heaven!    We cannot wait to go back to Rao's the next time we are in Vegas!

qkeJgRu517_O7FgUo7B_Pw.text: Really loved the beet salad and the lemon chicken here! Very good! Expensive but we were prepared for it. lol

cPxMqstUD1m-UdMNGa8wGw.text: Have a meatball and all will be well.  Try for more than that, and disappointment may lurk.  Great meatball, I don't trust anything else anymore.

my76a5wJ1DjDIQLyzlzKIw.text: Impeccable dining experience from start to finish. Pretty dimly light old school Italian restaurant where the service is as good as the food and the food was some of the best I've had. I'm an east coast Italian food snob, and this place blew me away. BAR NONE, the best meatballs I've ever had. The lasagna was ridiculous. Even the bread is awesome and they give you three different butters to try! We will definitely be back

kaClE4n14JQRvEax4HsA1g.text: Staying at Caesar's for the week and decided to go to Rao's for dinner one night. I would normally buy a steak, but tonight I decided to ask my awesome bartender Robert what he recommended on the menu.   He was very enthusiastic about the Grilled Lamb. Sold! Get me the Grilled Lamb. Medium.   A short wait later and my three Lamb Chops arrived. Amazing! I took one bite and had to thank Robert for his recommendation. They were very delicious on their own, no spices or sauces needed. A slightly sweet taste. 5 Stars.

euRO2EYhePy__leCKjaJdw.text: Rao's is not the Indian restaurant you thought it'd be, in fact, it's an Italian restaurant.  The pasta is amazing. Every dish was al dente, perfectly seasoned, well-paired with the sauce.  I was amazed as I've been low carb and every dish required a second look.  We started with the Fritto Misto - Calamari, clams, string beans, and some other stuff and it was lightly breaded, well fried, and perfectly cooked and salted.  The traditional meatballs were perfectly sized, seasoned, and tasty.  Capreze salad was well placed with fragrant tomatoes and a hearty burrata cheese lightly touched with a basal and balsamic reduction.  Ravioli Purses were the hit of the night. Outside was al dente, Bartlett Pears and Ricotta Cheese were accentuated with brown sugar and cranberries.  It was a dessert course.  Vodka Penne and Sundried Tomato Chicken Penne were just perfectly cooked.  Bistecca was perfectly medium rare, tasty and a good end to the second course.  Super impressed by a restaurant in one of my least favorite casinos, Caesar's which is the Frankenstein of properties.

VbHUONhCmZKghrwAOxAqcg.text: Angela server was very attentive. Caprese and beet salads and eggplant parmesan and clam linguine were all excellent as was sauvingnon blanc and st archer ipa. Table with view of pool and sunset. No smoking.

3eDJxXdniVMZbir1msrseQ.text: Ate here the night after eating at Sinatra.  I have had the pleasure of eating at the original Rao's and purchase pasta from the Rao's online store.  Native NY'er (born and raised) + 1st gen American (parents from Italy).  OK.  Decor. Loved the feeling inside. Took me back to NYC (sadly now living in Lost Angeles). The feel was truly authentic.   Hated having to access it via the casino (the freaking smoke really does me in).  Food wise. It was OK. A person in my party has severe allergies and we do as we always do, alert the restaurant, then the waiter / waitress, and do what we can to ensure they can have something safe and edible.  The appetizers are brought to the table and the one for person with the allergy contains everything they are allergic to. The waiter says he didn't know which plate was not to have it on it (all of them!).  The meal itself was not good at all. The sauce was OK, but you can get that kind of sauce at Buco Di Beppo (where no self respecting Italian would eat).  The price for admission exceeded that of Sinatra, which is heads above in both food and service.  Will continue to purchase from Rao's online, but will not visit this restaurant again.

EJDKX9ZK_-5esR6eRuEsHg.text: If you like your $200 bottle of red wine chilled like a white, your drinking water mixed with sprite, your meals over priced that take forever to get, drink orders that are taken for only half of your table and a staff that are rude and  not accommodating then you've found the place to go. Considering we brought in a party of 10 and that we are all locals of Las Vegas this was a horrible experience right from the moment we came in. We consistently had to ask for silverware, drinks, linens etc.  None of us will event return. Vegas has too many choices with better food and service.

N2zJ9ipkwdYqrO_2RjJz7Q.text: If your looking for Italian and you love meatballs!  This place is definitely for you. Had dinner with my lady here because she loves Italian and it did not disappoint. The waiter was awesome and very informative. We had some wine to start off and then we were advised that this restaurant is known for their meatballs. So we tried one and it was delicious. So soft and flavorfull. As our entree I had some salmon and my lady had the lasagna. Both were amazing dishes.   Overall it was a great dinner. Very satisfied with the service, the environment and the food. It is a bit on the pricy side depending on what you order but worth it.

ekbqEWcbQVhH1Y26EGnzeA.text: So so....free bread basket was ok...service was terrible..out waitress had her parents there I think , Sunday March 4th around 8p ish....cuz we kept looking around to get a wine and she was conversatiing we noticed. And her table in front of us was waving her down as she kept conversatiing, won't be going back, I tried the meatballs it was good and I had to wave our waitress down to get parmesan cheese, if I would have paid for dinner she would have got nothing for a tip, luckily I didn't phew !!! Joe's stone crab and Al Mulino at ceasars palace go there,  Amazing service and AMAZING food

NyKKdKM6mvacwwQrUR2W5w.text: This is Italian food at its best. Lovely bread basket with three toppings, excellent fried green tomatoes. Meatballs are large and two/three can easily share an app portion. Service was outstanding and dessert was as beautiful as it looked

Yi9FzJYeRE3V1vbwu3vAbg.text: Perfection. Period. Go here for best Italian on the strip. I wish I remembered our server's name but he made us feel like regulars. Best seafood salad and meatballs ever. And get the lemon chicken - you won't be disappointed. A drink at the bar before and a cannoli for dessert for a perfect start and ending to a great dinner. Can't wait to return. I would go to Vegas just to go back here.

fUpESy_Rhsv_QjLAZwE6yQ.text: Great team dinner there last night!  Their gravy (marinara) is absolutely insane... Try not to fill up on bread and meatballs which are amazing.  Must haves are the veal parm, the peas and prosciutto, baked clams... Heck, it was all good.  Limited wine selection makes it easy to focus on the food... Read a few reviews that complained about that, but most of the more complex reds would be washed out by the tomato sauce anyway.  Service was stellar.  5 stars.

Bp1D1RmdbxsNlw0hiJ68WA.text: We have been going to this iconic Italian eatery for years and it has been one of our favorite places. However, with the recent passing of the patriarch of the Restaurant, Frank Pellegrino, the food, service & attention to detail are a thing of the past.  During our recent visit I ordered a Bloody Mary at the bar (while waiting 4 a table), it was made from a 6.5 oz can of mix with ice! Not home made, zero accoutrements I.E. salted glass, celery, olives. At $15 a pop, WTF?  At dinner we ordered the meatballs as an appetizer and what once was their signature dish was a disaster. The meatballs were burnt and didn't have the flavor we are accustomed to. What was really shocking was the tomato sauce, it was a dark burgundy and tasted like it was made days if not weeks in advance. WTF x2! Having had enough of the Bloody Mary, I switched to a bottled beer. Imagine my chagrin when it showed up already poured. Even a low-brow  eatery pours your beer in front of a patron. WTFx3! I sent it back and kindly requested they bring a new bottle with a cold glass and try again.  For the main course my guest ordered pasta, which was virtually uneatable due to the heretofore mentioned tainted tomato-sauce. My main course was the veal chop with the hot cherry peppers (my former favorite) which was way off the mark. The veal which in the past was a robust serving was tiny and unsatisfactory. WTF x 4! During this visit we also noticed tables that were not bused for over 20 minutes. Something is remiss with RAOS.  RIP Frankie, if RAOS doesn't get their act together they will be joining you sooner than later

5tpVxusVzd_B21wcxPitMw.text: It was fun! Great experienced staff, very confortable and attentive. The food was simple but bang on in flavour. Great portions; thank you for the great service and look forward to returning!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veal chop parmasan

plXS8gWQHOwvvl2Ah-Hg9w.text: Bit of a disappointment. The eggplant Parmesan was not good - it was over cooked and just a bit blah. The carbonara and the bread and red pepper butter was pretty good and the wait staff was friendly and helpful. We also got a cheesecake for dessert for my brothers 21st birthday and they sang happy birthday and the cheesecake was probably one of the best I've ever had.

kK_oCfx2aw3ooDQ30DSdQg.text: Rao's is hands down one of my favorite Italian restaurants in Vegas. I've never had a bad experience and the food is consistently good. I love the decor and overall feel of the place, especially when sitting at the bar for happy hour. You almost forget you're in the middle of a casino.   I highly recommend the penne alla vodka (they sell their vodka sauce at grocery stores because its so good) and the lamb chops!

mkKve6nrs-cAgvpUkd7khw.text: Before my show last night, I had dinner at Rao's, something that had been on my radar for awhile.  I made a reservation for 5 PM so I had lots of time for a leisurely meal before the 7:30 show.  I was greeted promptly and taken to a table on the far side of the bar and down a few steps.  It's the last area before you go to their patio.  I had a view of the pool area and one of Caesars iconic Roman statues in a columned structure.  My server, Howard, quickly appeared and asked for my drink order.  He brought my iced tea quickly.  Having read about the size of Rao's portion, I was careful to choose wisely.  I went with the baked clams for an appetizer and the ravioli purses for the main course.  I was soon brought a nice bread basket.  Howard asked me if I wanted some balsamic with the olive oil and I declined.  I poured some of the oil onto the plate, salted it a bit, and then dipped some of the olive bread that was part of the basket.  Within a short time, my baked clams were delivered.  They are littleneck clams that had an oregano bread crumb topping.  I squeezed some lemon on the clams and dug in.  It's been a long time since I got baked clams and they were great!  The lemon mixed with the juices from the clams and I had another dipping "sauce" for my bread.  Very tasty!  The main course came. Rao's calls them beggar purse ravioli.  The ravioli were stuffed with a mixture of pear and ricotta cheese and they were in a sauce of brown butter seasoned with sage and topped with dried cranberries.  This caught my eye when I was reading the menu because it was such a different dish.  It was excellent, too!  The pear taste with the cheese was very mild and the butter with the dried cranberries was a True winner!  A good dish that's really different.  Also, I had dipping sauce #3--the brown butter with sage was a wonderful place to dip a few cubes of the good bread.  For dessert, I asked Howard for his advice.  He gave me a listing of the entire dessert menu without having to bring one to me.  Of the things on the menu, he recommended one, the peanut butter tart, something his wife makes--she's one of the pastry chefs at Rao's.  The tart had a graham cracker crust, a layer of chocolate ganache, and it was topped with peanut butter mousse.  It was superb!  I'll have the other dessert he recommended on my next visit.  The dinner was very very good!  Service was exemplary.  The staff or Howard was always around to refill water, get more iced tea, remove dirty dishes, and simply to do a great job!  I am a big fan of Rao's.

photos.caption: Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The sign by the man says, &#34;Rao&#39;s meatballs only $1&#34; and the man is saying, &#34;Welcome to LV. Gimme a dollar.&#34;  Near check in.
Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Roman statue seen from the patio.
