6jQGroZzd-xDhN_icJoXAw.text: Such an amazing place! Friendly staff and the food is outstanding! The butter is great! We really liked the chicken parm and the red pepper butter. Please visit - you won't regret it.

RFHrsQXn7SchWhfiOQ8s3Q.text: Food was fine but very overpriced. That's just kinda how Vegas is though. The real kiss of death was that I had to eat beneath a picture of war criminal Henry Kissinger. Hard to enjoy a meal with the man who had Cambodia and Laos bombed illegally for years, purposefully prolonged the Vietnam war to get Nixon elected l, and aided in a number of genocides looking down on you.

LdAVHzG8Nsl_Zr9BO-1Daw.text: The food and service was fantastic.   The food was excellent and just the right amount.  Our waiter treated us like we were the only people there.   Thank you so much for a great evening.

bbJiTFru_HZPluTVaMB4Sg.text: Epic. This food was amazing. I can't wait to go back. Piece of advice though....when they ask if you want water, clarify they mean tap otherwise you are looking at paying 10.00 for a bottle of water. This was a "surprise" that I will not have again.

QteQjs9F7F9E-8anSiMRnw.text: Enjoyed a quick late bite at the bar on a random Monday evening. The service was speedy and while it's a bit pricey you definitely taste the quality of ingredients. If nothing else stop in and enjoy the meatballs - and bring a big appetite!

photos.caption: Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meatballs - enough for a meal!
Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caprese - with burrata!

zH1_GHe4WHtZFap1Mof7xg.text: So I have been to the one in NYC.  This one you can get a table at.  Food was great excepts for a very minor things.  Roster potatoes lacked salt.  Went here during restaurant week and they were sold out on a special by Tuesday of restaurant week?  Service was a bit slow.  All in all a delicious meal.

_YRN2zpXW319jT-VXJn19A.text: This place is amazing! The atmosphere is nice enough but the service was the best and we felt like we were not just customers but guests where nothing was too much trouble! The drinks (alcoholic) we ordered were flavoursome and strong enough, all food and courses were very well presented and all came out in good time and were delicious! We all shared a few plates, but personally, the meatballs are a MUST and the mozzarella starter is excellent too! Even The accompanying bread and red pepper butter was delicious. For dessert, we tried the chocolate peanut butter pie, the tiramisu and the creme brulee and portion sizes were very generous. All were tasty but the creme brulee was SO creamy and tasty.  SO impressed!

VTjCPJagAH3NFEaYHSSw_A.text: First time customer. Had a wonderful experience. Russ was our server and he was exceptional. Really enjoyed the fried green tomatoes and mozzarella appetizer and beggars purse ravioli. Russ recommended a delicious bottle of wine. We'll be back!

sIxl62QtHjSKEC1p0m52Yw.text: Apparently it's much easier to get a table at the Vegas location than the New York one (I haven't tried though) so my friend insisted that we come for dinner on night one in sin city. I'll say that my food was nothing special, but the service definitely was. Our server was joyful, helpful, and really made us feel at home. We all checked in for our free cocktail, and enjoyed the delicious bread while he broke down the menu and suggested what to go for. I can elaborate best on the eggplant parm that I got- order a side of pasta if you can because it's just eggplant with tomato sauce and cheese, almost no carbs (which I consider vital, and which actually may render you unable to finish the eggplant, but then again maybe if you're doing a high-fat low-carb thing may be unnecessary). The consensus was that it was nothing spectacular but a decent, Vegas-priced and Vegas-sized place to eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggplant parm (order some pasta to go with it!)

2XkL2ecaw_hWB0N9e5Y8Lg.text: Was it good? Yes.   Was it the best Italian food we've ever eaten? No.  Was it overpriced by 30-50%, like just about any other restaurant on the Strip? Most definitely.  Our party of 5, including my 7-year-old nephew, had reservations at Rao's early on a Saturday night. We were seated promptly in the back of the half-full restaurant. The wall nearest to us was full of pictures of famous athletes, most with some connection to New York. Oddly the bar seemed to be sporting Christmas decorations in the middle of March.   Our server was all business but courteous and efficient. He seemed to not be thrilled that we had a kid with us. On that note, there is no kid's menu but we knew that and plus my nephew was fine with a plate of plain pasta & sauce.  Portion sizes for the adults were decent. My sister and I made the mistake of ordering salads, which are large enough to be entrees by themselves. Between the salads and our actual entrees, we were too full to sample dessert.

bufLFvyIUfJFDY2Z-2fdbw.text: A great place for American style Italian food in Vegas.   I went here for the famous meatballs and the veal spaghetti bolengese  The pasta was el dente and perfectly cooked.   You have to get the meatballs and everything comes in big portions   Great place to have good quality Italian food

AKYYh05m0jxW-ubyWoKSvg.text: Very poor service, food was very mediocre for the price that we had to pay. Your money and time would be better off spent elsewhere. Our server seemed to always be hard to reach even though we could always see him wandering around the tables. Overall very disappointing experience in terms of service and taste as it was quite salty.

P94jJP2-Pofm8iBfYcd5_w.text: This place has been bookmarked for the longest time, as I definitely love the Rao's sauce that you can get at the market.  Best sauce on the market, hands down.  So I decided to bite the bullet and have dinner here after the Elton John show, and made reservations at 9:45 (Elton lets out at 9:30).   The place closes at 10:00, so there were only a handful of patrons when we arrived.  No real small chat by the hostess, as in "are we celebrating anything"? (we were) or "how's your evening".  We were placed in the back facing the pool and bocce court.   Service was just ok.  No one described the 3 butters to us (so we eaves dropped on the next door table to hear what they were).  We started off with the "famous" meatballs as appetizers. When we were finished we had to wave down our server to complete our order, which we ended up splitting lasagna and peas.  She  messed up our lasagna order because she either forgot to enter it in or the kitchen forgot it, so we were served a bowl of peas and no entree. She apologized but meanwhile for 15-20 minutes we were eating peas, and bread.  As for the food, I wasn't blown away. Perhaps it didn't live up to the HYPE?  The meatballs were good but not orgasmic, especially for $17.  The lasagna was supposed to be "huge", but I could have eaten it by myself.  The big serving was the bowl of peas with prosciutto, and I thought that was the best of the 3 items.    The saving grace is I got to use my Total Reward points to pay for this meal. I did tip the server 25% since she had to stay late, and she did chat us up at the end. Otherwise, had it not been a "free" meal,  she would have gotten a smaller tip.  I must have missed the 5 star memo.  Too bad.

photos.caption: Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lasagna covered in shaved Parmesan
Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Peas and prosciutto/ lasagna
Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meatball

fGZrnzS7_cSiIUbjJgP2-A.text: I have to say everything we ate here last night was great. We first started with the bread they served and we all know if the bread is good to start everything else will be better. The red peppered butter they use is addictive so beware haha.  We then ordered the Caesar salad which was great and they even split it up for us in the back (no charge).   My girlfriend ordered the penne pasta and I ordered the eggplant Parmesan and both were amazing. I will definitely be coming back here for some great Italian food. I def recommend this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CHHpNCXeO7dHME3coRoRVQ.text: We waited an hour for them to mess up our order. They served us and we told them what was wrong and they magically came out with our correct food literally two minutes later. What made us wait for so long if they had the food already ready so quickly? We got crab carbonara, regular linguine carbonara, a beef lasagna and penne vodka.  The food itself was fine, not worth the money we paid. The service felt unorganized and uncoordinated at best.

Uq7rURtXaxve1kUxKXbJxg.text: I have to say that this is the worst restaurant in Caesars palace. the food was nasty and cold our waitress  her name was Angela. She was the worst waitress i've ever experienced in my life. Rude obnoxious and very on professional.  she ruined  our Mother's Day dinner. But I have to say the manager came out and she was really nice and she was very professional about the whole situation.  she should take this in consideration and do something with that waitress  anyways I have to leave a star not for the food. Definitely not for  the waitress but I will leave one for the manager.

Z4U_vmtKl4J2bP4zFfiYEg.text: All I have to say is get the ravioli purses... wow, just wow.  Make sure to put some parmesan cheese on it to give it the perfect bit of salty to contrast the delicate sweetness of the pear and ricotta.

photos.caption: Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

U1G1Uh9KQcbE2AGH55qGeg.text: The penne alla vodka was delicious. I would definitely recommend that dish. My friends and I had a great time at this restaurant. The food was delicious and the staff was great. We made a reservation using open table a week before and we had no issues. (For those who like to make reservations-- use OpenTable! No cc required to save your reservation. Most places ask for a card to reserve the table which is annoying)

photos.caption: Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JIufMi0rvQ-KFbD619Gojg.text: Only in Vegas two nights and we wanted to enjoy a couple of nice dining concepts.    Unfortunately, Rao's was not on its game the night we were there.  The server seemed to be in a rush to get out and added very little to a pleasant dining experience.  The food was not exceptional.  The special of the night sounded wonderful so two from our party ordered it and were disappointed.  The rest was good but not great.    I can not recommend Rao's knowing what value other restaurants are delivering.

Q3rshFcsw2sS-loVkvwakg.text: Looking forward celebrating our anniversary dinner at Rao's tonight. Ordered wine, meatballs as appetizer, and our entrees ...as we finished ordering we were told that their kitchen was dark and had a problem and would check if whether they would be able to serve us... our waiter came back and said yes, everything was ok. Meatballs came out and I planned saving meatballs to have with my pasta dish. Caesars salad was ok. After the Caesar salad, waiter came and said; sorry the kitchen cannot fulfill our entree order..... ok what do we do!!!! Ate the rest of the meatball and bread..  waiter returns and now they can fulfill our entrees. We decided  to cancel because we ate the meatballs with bread... and starting dealing full.  Caesars started charging for self parking; 1-4 hours, $12.00 and $18.00 valet respectively. N Then waiter comes back

U_9Z0wYCd-0LqUr6DkOKAw.text: Ate at Rao's last night and had a great experience! The staff was extremely friendly and the food was fantastic! We had a great table next to the window and overall would recommend this restaurant!

xHyDIwybx6GM8rtQ1FVp-w.text: What a bad restaurant. Caesar salad had boxed croutons and no anchovies. Linguini and clams tasteless and over cooked pasta. Sauce on chicken scarpiella watered down and tasteless.   Summary- STAY AWAY. BETTER CHOICES FOR 1/2 price.

jeGt56Rr3M6Zwsdq9BvrqA.text: Before I start let me state that my experience with the wait staff was phenomenal, and this should in no way reflect on front of house or waiters.  We went last Sunday for my first time and a celebratory night out. Ordered the meatballs and veal parmesan and my grandfather ordered one as well. Our total with a glass of house wine and bottled blue moon was $169.95.  It was the worst and most expensive Italian meal I've ever had.   Not sure if the chef wasn't in or someone was replacing them but holy shit it was almost completely inedible.  The meatballs themselves were fine but the sauce was so incredibly acidic it tasted like stomach bile after vomiting.  The veal was so tough I had to saw through it with a steak knife, trying to chew it was like rubber. For $53 that thing should have fallen apart it if I looked at it wrong, never had veal that tough in my life.  Maybe it was a off night or maybe I just had bad luck? Not really sure what happened but it was a shame since I had high hopes after hearing all the stories and legends about Rao's.

G6Ba4NLCaKjcU1nskc7u5g.text: My wife and I had dinner at Rao's the other night.  Food was phenomenal as always.  Did want to share one part of our experience however.  We ordered two appetizers.  One had not arrived by the time our entrees came out.  I mentioned this to the gentleman who brought the entrees over, he asked if we still would like the other app we'd ordered , we said yes, and he said it would be right out.  So a few minutes later he came back with the other app, told us it was with his compliments, and also said he would like to buy us both dessert.  Was extremely impressed with that kind of attention to customer service.  Can't wait to eat there again when we come back to Las Vegas next year!

E-joZ5707FbDCxoHtf1W-g.text: Rao's... Good restaurant, great pasta! A bit expensive (for pasta it is!) I guess by now I'm on a quest to find the best gnocchi bolognese out there, and at Rao's it was pretty damn good! If anyone has other places.... Let me know!

photos.caption: Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great gnocchi!! Highly recommended

8tnvK3uZWXWXTzhBCkP0dQ.text: We called and were told the ONLY reservations available were at 5:00 - fine, we were on East Coast time, felt like 8:00 to us.  When myself and a co-worker arrived at at 4:59 (told over the phone if we were late or no showed, they would charge our card $50) there was no one at the hostess stand to greet us.  Had to wander to the bar to announce our arrival ---- only to find that the 2 young ladies sitting with the 2 older men RIGHT NEXT TO THE HOSTESS STAND were actually the hostesses who should have greeted and seated us.  Owners, if you are reading this, NOT THE WAY TO START A MEAL FOR 2 FOR OVER $150 - work it out.  Stay off TV and fix this.  I can't overlook this, hire better.  Unless you can back it up at the end, start strong.  Once seated our waiter was knowledgeable and reasonably accommodating but we felt so rushed.  Everything we ordered arrived within 5 minutes...just as quickly we were asked if they could take FULL plates.  NO - go away.  The waiter also sat on chairs that were weirdly blocking access to our booth - I expect Hooters waitresses to sit at my table, not Rao's waiters.  Started with the antipasta appetizer for 2 - amazing,  Also ordered the Meatball side dish, they were fine, I truly make better, I also serve mine hot.  The Pasta with Vodka sauce was simply amazing.  Also had an order of the Fussilli with spicy sausage and cabbage - the pasta was perfect, the cabbage was a good addition - the sausage was over cooked, just short of burned, the sauce was acceptable, bordering on too acidic.  When leaving, I was put off that the only res was at 5:00, we felt rushed and left at 7:00 to an almost empty restaurant.  Should I ever have the option to try the Harlem version, I would be hard pressed to say yes, sorry.  Work is needed.

TsnpT6v5_H0LYtEHaHqhGw.text: We came for an early dinner, the service was fantastic, the food came out fast and was as expected.  Now this is not the best Italian food I have ever had, but it is good home style Italian american food, if you want some good lasagna or some fantastic meatballs this is place to go on the strip.  The lasagna was above average, the burrata caprice salad was fantastic, the meatballs are perfect.  We didn't try anything else...but I look forward to coming back for other dishes.

ELITqp7AHMEVi4VxXz3Qag.text: 2.5 STARS Prices are not cheap,food is nothing exciting at all. Had a huge ass pizza sign, we go in craving pizza, they said its only for lunch.  TAKE IN THE SIGN DUMBASSES Anyways, parents had linguini and clams , I had pasta with pomodoro sauce or something like that. Very basic, ordinary meal, and we spent $130 for three, no sides, no appetizers, just couple drinks. Waay too pricey for limited menu and food they offer. They have one shitty soup on the menu, and an overpriced $21 seafood salad thats probably tiny.  Pass this place unless you want basic plain pasta with sauces, and want to spend $30/40 a person for that.

Ta-7BQaWFe1ZyvSfZT8hrA.text: A little to shy to say but I heard of this place through the food network on my behalf it was Bobby flay who said to come here for the best bolognese if I spelled that correctly anyhow . It was my first time at a fancy Italian place so I'll add it has a nice authentic vibe to it I showed up with out a reservation so it was about a 30 minute wait would definitely  recommend a reservation but overall the service was great it was fast the food was delicious it is served with complimentary bread so that goes great with all the meals overall very happy with my visit

1EAVPsPg13TEhq6SzV2sgA.text: Rao's is in a fairly nice location in Caesar's Palace--it's located in between casinos, and it has indoor (inside the restaurant), and "outdoor" (overlooking the walkways between casinos) seating.  We were looking for a quick place to have lunch, and this place was right in our way.  The waitstaff was very nice and very polite to us.  Water was regularly refilled, and freebees were ample, like bread and olive oil.  The table and linens were clean.  There was a very limited selection of wine--a definite no-no in the world of Italian dining.  Both wine and beer are overpriced, but that is part of being in Las Vegas.    Pizzas were about 8 to 10 inches--all were personal pizzas.  The size wasn't so much the issue as was how they were dressed.  In other restaurants, their pizzas would have been classified as appetizers rather than entrees.    My biggest complaint has to do with the meatball entree.  For lunch, this included 1 large meatball, but it didn't come with anything at all--no pasta, no salad, no bread, nothing.  WHO orders a meatball and NOTHING ELSE?  What was worse was the sneaky way the server tacked on what was less than a half-order of pasta to make it a meal...for an extra $13!  I actually don't think the meatball may have cost that much.  In a place like Las Vegas, famous for gourmet all-you-can-eat buffets, Rao's is NOT WORTH YOUR TIME.  Small portions, service that deliberately did not disclose information about the menu, and a much larger than warranted bill at the end of the experience was enough to keep me searching for a better deal and better food.

DB_0hF5IE6bR_Ifd7eY1ow.text: The food here was awesome. And the servers were attentive without hovering. The meatballs, lamb chop and penne were all on par with the best Italian I've ever had. Highly recommend.

UGHQimBWwsixCsSr5Ew4Ew.text: A bit overpriced for my taste in Italian but I feel a bit overrated just because of the name.  I tried the meatball specialty and of course the sauce was delicious :)   I would have it forlunch...if you don't have reservations, you can sit by the bar..there's enough to seat 4 in their mini tables by the bar..

n0Z2NYquI1V-GvkqsB2lWQ.text: OK as an ex NJ / NY guy dining in Rao's in Manhattan that simply is not a privilege the regular guy will ever get to experience. Having been invited once about 10 years ago, I truly can state back then I wasn't quite sure if I was in a great restaurant with great food, or If all the hype skewed my judgment as coming away from that experience As Teddy KGB said in Rounder's, like a teenager coming in for a quickie, I feel so unsatisfied.    Now some 10 years later the Las Vegas venue obviously not the same chefs, ingredients etc, were on our horizon this past Super Bowl weekend as 4 of us headed to the Forum shops of Ceases to give this location a whirl. 3 of us to dine for dinner tonight and Saturday night Super Bowl weekend the place is crowded but not packed to the rafters. Greeted by a very nice Italian looking gentlemen who was as pleasant as can be. (More on this later).  Seated in the lower area courtyard facing the windows to the pool, its dark out so not much to see. Well as things go I sit down on what can only be described on a soaking wet back half of the chair and I'm drenched. Here I am in a $300.00 shirt and expensive slacks that are soaked. Not even an apology from the waiters, host, mgr, nothing. They changed the chair out and it was like ok sit down shut the F*** up and eat. OK.  Ordered a bottle of wine that was marked up a little excessively but nothing I couldn't live with based on the venue. The place is well appointed abet my wet chair with white table cloths attentive servers. Bread was hot & crispy with a nice good olive oil / balsamic to mix and dip. Butter was also served.  3 Appetizers were ordered the famous Rao's meatballs (+1) so we each had one, an order of the Mozzarella in Carrozza Crispy Fried Fresh Mozzarella Sandwich served with marinara Sauce and an order of the baked stuffed little neck clams.    The meatballs were good nothing special and my mothers are far superior but I'm biased. The sauce again was ok, nothing great and I asked for "Ricotta Cheese" and the 3 waiters this is not a racist or culturally biased statement being Hispanic had no idea what I was referring to, then stated no we don't have that for the meatballs. OK Must be dreaming thought I saw a scoop being presented with the stuffed shells at the table next to me but if you say so.  The Carrozza was again nothing special was no great improvement over fried mozzarella at any chain restaurant and the same sauce as the meatballs and not enough of it. The clams were a hunk of bread crumb that I could not find them. Hmm. Maybe it was bread crumb stuffed in the clam shells.   On to Dinner where 3 entries were ordered Conchiglie al Pomodoro e Ricotta Shell Pasta with Fresh Ricotta Cheese and Marinara Sauce (Son of a B***) I knew there was Ricotta in this place, A Pollo Scarpariello Chicken Sauteed with Hot and Sweet Italian Sausage and Yellow and Red Bell Peppers in a White Wine Sauce & Vitello alla Parmigiana Pounded and Breaded Veal Chop Topped with Marinara Sauce, Parmesan and Melted Mozzarella.     The Shell Pasta was excellent you can taste the San Maranzano Tomatoes bursting with every bite  unfortunately for $28.00 the size of the portion could have fed my 5 year old nephews. MAYBE.  The Veal Chop $48.00 was truly good, fresh veal, pounded but not too thin with a nice sweet mozzarella cheese with a tasty marinara sauce.  A good Sized portion that would not hesitate to order again.  The Pollo Scarpariello which should have been one of the highlights, unfortunately got low marks from me. Normally rich in flavor especially when chicken remains on the bone as this was prepared, it should have had a nice vinegar base or spicy taste, but the sauce was bland like natural juice or chicken broth. Sausage was tasteless if not forgetful, and the peppers were mush.  No deserts were tried but some Espressos were served. Coffee was bitter / burnt tasting and even a shot of sambucca couldn't help.   All and all a very unremarkable meal that as New York had done 10 years ago left me shall we say "UNSATISFIED"   With the abundant amount of restaurants to choose from in Las Vegas now days I certainly expected and to be honest demanded more of this place. It was a 2.5 stars but her at Yelp we don't have that 1/2 star ability. I've had better, I've had worse, but at these prices we shouldn't be in the 2 Star range. PASS for Me.  On a sad note the nice gentlemen (Older Italian Guy) who greeted us upon entering was celebrating a birthday on the way out with the "Rao Family of staff and friend" I was informed last night that he passed away last night from a friend of mine who lives in Las Vegas. Truly makes you remember to take nothing for granted in life as tomorrow  is promised to no one.

mrZxIwNZY9-7F4v3LX9toA.text: What a huge disappointment.  Stay at home and make ur own pasta, it will be just as good, if not better.  We were seated at a table overlooking the Caesar's pool area.  The DJ playing was so loud that all we could hear was the thumping of the base.  Not very romantic.  My husband ordered the spaghetti and meatballs, and being $43 I expected something worthy of the price.  Instead, we both agreed it lacked flavor and woefully inadequate seasoning. My penne vodka was even worse.  I only ate a few bites and that was good enough for me to be done.  Will not be returning to this Vegas location.  Will stick to the real deal in NYC.

LtqGMAAppTDCnh9tqS8wNw.text: We had a reservation but still had to wait 15 minutes on a Wednesday evening. The hostesses weren't very friendly. I still give it 5 stars because the food was so amazing. Best meatballs I've ever eaten!

LQ3UEB09G1wG5YDLpLaLrQ.text: I had extremely high expectations for this place due to the amazing pasta sauce with the same name.  Its ok, decent ingredients but lacking significant flavor.  Pricing is ok for Vegas.  The music selection doesn't match the resturant

Gx9Aotdr2au5YGumD18B0w.text: So I live in the Bay Area (CA) and while here we have a good selection of Chinese, Vietnamese, and Mexican food; here I am deprived of legitimate Italian food. Rao's in NY has some sort of crazy reservation system in which it's a two year wait list so the one In Vegas is your only shot without a reservation.  When we went there my girlfriend and I were greeted by this nice older dude who I presume was the manager siting in the corner taking a break (I think). We were seated quickly and had good service throughout the meal.  I have tried different chicken parmigiana, but have never found one I liked. When I saw on the menu that Rao's had Veal Parmigiana (I've heard that's how it's traditionally made) I had to try. The idea of breading and frying something, then covering it with melted mozzarella cheese and marinara sauce sounds so delicious to me, but I have just come to accept that it's just not for me. Nothing wrong with the meat itself, in fact I was surprised at how big the portion was, I just find this dish is always to salty for me, no matter which restaurant I try it at. One thing about Rao's Parmigiana dish is that it does not come with a side of pasta, all you get is the veal (huge bummer). My girlfriend had the pasta shells with, I believe was, ricotta and marinara sauce. It was really good and I wished I had gotten that instead.    The reason I give this place 4 instead of 5 stars is because while the food is delicious and is some of the better Italian fair that I have ever had, it did not blow my mind like I had hoped it would or how Food Network's "Throwdown with Bobby Flay" portrayed it as the holy grail of Italian food. If I am ever near the Las Vegas area again though, I will surely give this place another shot.

lzaUS1cRTMoRwCnhuGwn7Q.text: Friends and I had a gift certificate for dinner here so my opinion does not account for the cost of the meal. Given that, the food was delicious, one of the best Italian meals that I've had. Of course, I haven't been to Italy so I am hoping this won't be the best Italian meal ever for me.

Y1wQNeV6PuopIg_HdjPPAA.text: Start - Meatball. (the best) Dine - Penne Vodka - (hold the proscutto) Desert - head across the way to Payard. - but anything on the menu at Raos is very tasty.   Result? - happy belly.

0tlA6fjMa8238OjVoli9_w.text: We were so excited to get a reservation, because it is almost impossible to get a reservation for the one in New York. It is sad that we were very disappointed that we did not think much of the cooking at this restaurant. The baked clams were salty, and burnt, and my side dish of meatball did not come out. The linguini and white clam sauce was quite dry, and too little garlic. My wife was not happy either, she thought the food served was pretty average for New York's standards, where we are from.

rpLBE3PUdy214PJPLp-0ug.text: Came here with my Mom a couple months ago.     Apparently, unless your name is Regis Philbin, the one in NYC is near impossible to get into.   So we were glad to be able to try the Vegas location.     Very nice and attentive staff.   They encourage ordering several dishes and splitting everything, family style.   We felt like we were back east.  We ordered the Lemon chicken, the surf and turf, and a bunch of other stuff.  We basically  just pigged out on everything.   Everything was very tasty.   I'll post some pics.

tYdvizGw-4AEbo0WhppemA.text: our first time eating here was horrible! the waitress was slooooow and gave us the wrong order.  we ordered calamari she brought us bruschetta... how you confuse the two, i dont' know.    i ordered the gnocchi  the meat sauce tasted burnt and scorched it was really bad.  just not edible.  my man ordered Pollo Scarpariello Chicken Sauteed with Hot and Sweet Italian Sausage and Yellow and Red Bell Peppers in a White Wine Sauce. chicken was good, but the sausage was EXTREMELY spicy.  i love spicy food, but this was completely overwhelming, it killed our palates.  we paid about $200 for dinner and completely unsatisfied...the only thing good was the wine, but yellow label is served from the bottle.  the GM came over and wanted to give it another shot.    On our second visit,  i have to say they really gave us the red carpet treatment... and this time the food was amazing!  Fritto Misto di Mare Deep Fried Calamari, Shrimp, Cod Fish and Julienne Zucchini with Remoulade and Marinara Sauce... light crisp and tender... huge serving  OSSOBUCCO ALLA MILANESE Braised Veal shank in gremolatta sauce over Safron Risotto....it was a large large serving and it was delicious... so tender and the risotto was creamy and perfect.  Agnello Grigliatto Single Cut Lamb Chop, Broiled, and Served with Roasted Potatoes and Sauteed French Beans... what a huge lambchop! very impressive, fred flinstone would have been happy.

d_pqj1bvZ2e-6mCDMMP8YA.text: Met a Caesars Employee for a business meeting at 5 pm.  Sat in the bar at a table and was accused of being a liar by Angelia, a waitress, because we were sitting at a table and not ordering food.  The hostess, Leslie, told us it was fine to sit there.  Angelia proceeded to tell us that the restaurant was fully booked that night - but there were empty tables everywhere.  It was ONLY 5:30 pm!  Probably the MOST horrible customer service I have ever experienced in a restaurant.  Patrick, the Manager was somewhat kind about the situation, but the owner just happened to be in from New York and was defensive with us.  Very snobby;  should have been profusely apologizing!  I highly suggest not eating here. Being insulted for ordering a $19 glass of wine x three when I sat at a table that I was told I could sit at in front of one of my customers is not appropriate. I will tell everyone I know not to ever eat at this restaurant or their location in NYC.  PATHETIC Customer Service in a bad economy. Good luck at surviving!  GO BACK TO NEW YORK!

r3aM87mQEG3Euqj8iA1X5w.text: Robert is the most attentive bar tender ..... he was so responsive and checked on me regularly. So nice to be recognized as a customer .... we need more Robert's in this world!!

IY-vpQ8JaYtGnwH4YkDFew.text: Great meatballs. Assorted butters accompanying bread were a plus.   Recommended: veal chops

Yn9Jy0tuCaMoPdwBZDK6lA.text: Being born a New York Italian American I am highly critical of Italian food. Had my favorite pasta (Angel Hair) with meat sauce since Rao's has a famous line of Pasta Sauces in most supermarkets. PHENOMENAL!! Flavorful & excellent quality meat LEAN (ZERO FAT) melt in your mouth tender - BRAVO!!! This is where old school Italian New Yorkers come to die!

H-Z874-2ZCzvcA0DrkSb-g.text: Excellent but beware if they say spicy its spicy. Great flavors great food great drinks if you want a really well done meal try them. The fried green tomato appetizer is excellent a meal in itself. Had linguini w seafood. Very nice flavor to the seafood. Loved it

OrosHZVcrvEDfAFoOu4UsA.text: Ask for Matt...he's the BEST server ...we've had the pleasure of sitting in his section a few times now...he's the best.

CK5_0I9mJXlgf_CwcTO2Dw.text: Delicious!  The ambiance was nice, romantic, dark and cozy.    The pimento spread with their bread basket was tasty and different.  My husband and I went all out and ordered the meatballs which they're famous for but were just okay.  I wouldn't order those again.  A MUST is their ravioli which were filled with ricotta, pears and cooked in a brown butter with cinnamon and dried cherries/cranberries.  That was hands down the best plate of food I've had in a long time.  We also had the lasagne which was hot, cheesy and perfectly sauced.  We ended the meal with tiramisu which was the perfect texture and a nice mix of flavors.    The hostess needed an attitude adjustment but the waitstaff was friendly, welcoming and easy to talk to.

Kz1KEFfHzfH2UFZu_Z9Grw.text: Maybe our favorite stop this time.   Excellent service.  Reasonable prices (compared to some of the other big names).  And the food was great.  Everyone talks about the meatballs, and they were tremendous,   We had them as an appetizer for the table and then one member of our group got them as an entree.  Lasagna and Bolognese were also really good.  Caesar salad excellent and so was the dessert shared by our table of four - a peanut butter creation.

sm6cEkslgyje6EEKY3VYqA.text: Amazing appetizers, amazing bread selection, amazing waitstaff & very romantic vibe. Pasta cooked just right. I recommend the fried mozzarella, best ive ever tasted!! The earlier you eat the faster the food service- reservations at 5, out by 6.

p86XcfceprarYV1-qP0UsQ.text: Amazing bar staff! They were very fun and friendly. My husband and I had a good time with them! Food was delicious too. Great meatballs and wings.  Only thing that didn't like was the year round Christmas decor! Am I missing something?

ZONgbQNt6e8sEB9vsDtdcQ.text: Dinner at Rao's was delish! We were a bit skeptical because of Yelp reviews, but really had a great meal!  Spreads for the bread were super good.  Ordered the antipasto platter, spaghetti bolognese, veal chop and cannoli.  All were totally worth it.  Our server was awesome! Would go back!

-WlnEiYHOycicM6IbZt1GQ.text: I should start by admitting that I'm sad to write this review. I was excited to go to Rao's. The service was impeccable (except for the hostesses, who had pretty negative, snooty attitudes).  I had three great wines and the wine steward was very helpful and down-to-earth.   We started with the meatballs, as an appetizer. Good news: they were very nice--juicy, soft, tasty and the sauce was simple and nice.   They were not mind-blowing, though. They were fine.   We split a bolognese for our first course. We both found it to be bland but acceptable, if a bit oily. It wasn't offensive, just really disappointing.  The pasta was spaghetti and, to be fair, it was cooked correctly. Again, plating table side was very nicely done.  We each ate maybe half of this dish.   We decided to split the second course, which was Chicken Scarpariello.  I was really surprised at this dish. It's well-reviewed and our waiter recommended it. All I can comment on was what was served on this night and on this night it was incredibly salty and sour. The number of cherry peppers was so high that the brine overpowered the entire dish.  I felt almost sick after eating. Between two of us, most of the dish was uneaten. I think we each suffered through one piece of the cut up half chicken. The dish includes a cream or butter but, for us, it just could not diminish the impact of all of those pickled cherry peppers.  We took it home and I gave it another shot the next day and felt exactly the same way.   The cannoli for dessert was overly sweet.  I like the glaceed (sp?) fruit pieces and this version had none. They opt instead to infuse the ricotta with Cointreau. It was fine, but not great. I missed a trace of cinnamon and vanilla. The shell was fresh and crunchy and good.   The bread basket was acceptable but uninteresting. They served a great, earthy  olive oil for dipping.  Its a shame. Much was fine but the Bolognese and the chicken were so disappointing.  I'm glad I went but I would not go again.

photos.caption: Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rao&#39;s spaghetti Bolognese.

kzWjLpeStfGErdSw2ObW3A.text: I have to admit that I give this review based on the taste and overall food experience only. Average at best. Granted i am a New Yorker who has eaten the best Italian food, from homemade to the best in NYC. If I was from another place and think the Olive Garden is Italian food, then I would say this experience was amazing.  I am not impressed, but again you may be..

PijO1xQdnLETtq0rxQDsVA.text: Great Italian food. We needed a quick (and by quick I mean wicked fast) bite before a show. We had 45mins and the bar made it happen. Not only was the food great but we aren't even sure how they got our meals out to us so quickly. Great staff, friendly and fun. Thank you!

9COHpz-e_zXjBudD_UbLIg.text: We ate here for dinner on a recent trip to Vegas. The service was prompt and polite. They were able to accommodate special requests with a salad without batting an eye. Our appetizer and salads were good. Our dinners, however, were subpar. I ordered the special which was a pasta dish with seafood and yellow peppers. It was cloying and tasted like perfume. The other dish we ordered was an eggplant dish. It was average at best. This is the second time I've eaten here and been disappointed.

s3kkfQdySipPr7CLFxZjjA.text: I have not written a review in quite some time, but this restaurant definitely merits a review. I very much enjoyed the fish special. It was a sole fish prepared with a lemon sauce and green beans. It was amazing! My husband ordered the chicken Parmesan and it was also very good. The bread basket consisted of three choices of bread and three different butters. Again quite delicious. I highly recommend Rao's, and I certainly hope to be back in the future.

EbrJNQR0Q2n3iW476-Y0Ng.text: Lovely restaurant, great atmosphere.  Very nice bar.  Read many reviews.  Had to try the meatballs....absolutely delicious!  Large portions and good service.

MjhLEh9ddSCvq_2Nr0U4rw.text: Olive Garden has nothing to worry about! The food is no better, but the prices? Ouch!  This is a great place to go to show you don't care about the value of a product.  For example, a Caesar Salad is $15.  Is it better than the Caesar at Italian Village in Chicago?  Not even close IMHO.  The croutons were good though.  I had the Spaghetti Bolognese upgraded to linguini with no problems.  It was a nice dish of pasta, not too large, but $28?  Not worth it at all; if it came in at around $12 at most, it would be acceptable.  So spending over $40 for a plate of pasta and a salad (no drinks) is unthinkable unless there is something magical about the food.  The only magic was the disappearance of my money.  For appetizers, we had a family platter of calamari with a few shrimp and a fillet of a white fish.  Great texture to the calamari, but I'm sure other restaurants can make the same quality for much less.  The meatballs in marinara sauce were really good, tender, flavourful and a nice size.  If this restaurant has some notoriety, it is not for the food.  Looks like the Wolf of Wall Street took a bite out of me...

KA-74GXs_QZGQVAsQ4v5Gg.text: Lasagna was great (I usually dislike it but I liked this) and the calamari appetizer was amazing. The pasta was ok, nothing to write home about. A member in our group got eggplant and wasn't to thrilled. My fiance got the roasted chicken and was fine with it. Our waitress (Jessica) was very kind and accommodating when we needed the check divided evenly. I probably wouldn't go back again (unless I really wanted lasagna) just because there are so many other options.

o6FSzbYmLgIUYSwKHGa04Q.text: Very good NY Italian Food. The quantity of food is ridiculous and you will not go away hungry. The veal piccata is a True representation of Italian food. I would recommend this place for the folks that want Italian and lots of it!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Bar. Excellent G&amp;T

jDVFT8LqEEi9-hLc1Fevig.text: We came here last night before the Sebastian Maniscalco show, I had really high hopes for this place since the one in NYC is so talked about, However that's not really the case here.  Lets start with the service, It was ok, not great but ok, I was dying of thirst before my drink was replaced, it wasn't even that busy here so I would imagine the waiter would have been on top of it a little more, I had to constantly ask for certain things which was annoying , anyway lets move on to the food, we ordered the meatball appetizer that were so talked about from the other reviews , again they were good, not great I wasn't blown away.  we then ordered our dinners, I ordered the penne al a vodka, it was good but again not the best I have tasted in Las Vegas and believe me I tried many Italian restaurants here in Vegas ranging from expensive to not so expensive. so overall this place was ok, not great but ok. It was an experience and something to add to my bucket list, will I be back? Probably not!   there are so many other places here in Vegas that in my opinion are way better and half the price.

e93-CdAiYESJvBv894TeXQ.text: Excellent place for great Italian food. Share an order of meatballs -- they're big and very flavorful. Lots of protein and seafood choices, in addition to their delicious pasta. Service is first rate. Make a reservation to be sure you can have a wonderful meal here.

XvrjGARqthnScJ1DVZyylQ.text: Hubby and I just got back from Vegas and we always stay at Caesar's Palace.  For some reason, we had not tried Rao's so I made sure we checked it out this trip.  It was one of the best Italian resturats I have been to.  It wasn't super busy when we got there, so the staff was pretty attentive.  I asked to have a table in the replica room when I originally made the reservations.  It was awesome!  I loved the old style look.  It was a little dark, but we used our phone flashlights when we needed to.   We started off with the Mozzarella Carrozza.  They were like two giant fried cheese triangles.  They were perfectly breaded and the mozzarella was rich and creamy.  The marinara sauce was pretty tasty too - very fresh and flavorful.  For our entrees, hubby had the Veal Parm and I had the Penne Vodka w/Meatballs on the side.  Seriously, the veal was HUGE!!  And bone in!!!  It was so tender that hubby was cutting it with his fork.  The penne was cooked to a perfect al dente and the vodka sauce was heavanly.  I have become a big fan of Vodka sauce, so I've had it in a few resturants and this has to be one of the best, if not the best.  I thought it was pretty cool the way they presented it.  The waiter came to the table and plated it from the pan that it was cooking in.  The real star of the evening was the meatballs.  They melted in your mouth like butter.  We were actually taking slices off of them with our forks.  We were so stuffed, but I felt horrible having so much left over, so we over ate...again.  We didn't finish them, but couldn't take them with us, it was really a damn shame.    No room for dessert this time, which is shocking since I LOVE sweets.  I think next time we'll scale it back so we can try the cheesecake.  Hubby was very grateful that I set this up for us.  We will definately return.  Cheers!

Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mozzarella Carrozza

Lrvq-fY920uIU6wRLqWFmQ.text: Great meatballs and sauce. Little pricey. Had the ravioli and loved it.  They gave us a nice desert for my sons bday. Would recommend it.

ObCLJ6gChX7mRSpqLGjTRg.text: CAESARS PALACE SWEEPSTAKES WINNER ADVENTURE #1: FIRST COMPED DINNER  As a recipient of the Caesars Palace 50th Anniversary "Indulgence" Sweepstakes winner one of the perks I received was $600 dining credit, which I can use at any Caesars Entertainment restaurants. Since I was staying 3 nights at Caesars Palace with $600 dining credit I was going to have dinner 3 times during my stay. Each dinner I would use no more than $200 dining credit per night. About a couple of months ago before I booked my trip I looked at other restaurants that I might be interested for dinner. One of those place was Rao's at Caesars Palace. The other was Giada at The Cromwell, which is across the street from Caesars Palace. Since they were both Italian restaurants I decided to eat at Rao's as I wanted to fully experience the dining scene at Caesars Palace.  Last week on Monday was my first day at Vegas. I ate here that night. Several months before I searched through the online menu and YouTube videos. The two meat dishes that customers seem to crave about are the Rao's Traditional Meatballs and Uncle Vincent's Lemon Chicken. I knew I couldn't order two meat dishes. I had to choose one. During my research the pasta I was interested was the linguini with Manila clams and mint. As a Filipino I hated Filipino spaghetti due to the bright red hot dog, sweet Jufran banana sauce, and soggy spaghetti. However I felt the linguini with Manila clams pasta dish could influence me to cook my own version of Filipino spaghetti. So for about several months before I entered Rao's I knew what dishes to order.   When I went to Rao's I asked my server what meat dish he would recommend Rao's Traditional Meatballs or Uncle Vincent's Lemon Chicken. He recommended the Uncle Vincent's Lemon Chicken. However I decided to order the meatballs. Growing up I hated meatballs because of my experience of eating them in a cafeteria in elementary school, middle school, and high school. Since I wasn't paying for dinner I felt that I might as well order them to give meatballs another chance. The pasta on the other hand had a slightly different change than the one I saw on the online menu. Instead of mint there was parsley. Besides those two dishes there was Caesar salad, shrimp scampi, and a glass of sangiovese.   The meatballs arrived. The verdict? I liked the meatballs at Rao's a lot as they're not heavy or dense as other meatballs I've had in the past. The meatballs at Rao's have a combination of beef, veal, and pork that give different texture of flavors. The marinara sauce cuts the richness of the meatballs. Even though they meatballs were delicious they didn't stand out as a "wow" factor. The linguini with Manila clams were ok. I have nothing against parsley but I think mint would have added a little more bite to this dish. Overall I think I was too passive in using my $200 dining credit as the bill was well under $200. Also I thought Rao's would be much more better than I expected. Even though I liked the Rao's Meatballs I did regret not ordering Uncle Vincent's Lemon Chicken. I think my dining experience that first night was a good experience of how to maximize your dining credit. There is a gambling saying "Never leave money on the table". That first night I did.

EsaCV-NE77YGSBtSfeZ3qg.text: We were really excited about trying Rao's. However, we found the overall experience to be a disappointment. Food is good, but not great. The prices are sky high for what you get.  I don't mind expensive if the quality and food is awesome.  We found the quality and taste just to be average.  We had the meatballs for a starter. You get two large, tasty meatballs.  This was the best part of the meal, but not worth the $10 per meatball that we paid. We also had the eggplant parm.  The eggplant was cut very thick (we prefer thinly cut) that are nicely breaded and fried. They are good, but really nothing special.  They come with nothing (just 5 slices of eggplant) on a plate with a little sauce and parmigiana cheese on top. Pretty average at best and not worth $30.   With so many great Italian restaurants in Vegas, there is no need to pay for average at Rao's.

id8fji_NL48QxbqJrD5P4Q.text: Planning a nice night out, we decided to try Rao's and we were very pleased with our decision. The service was excellent, and the food was great. The staff made sure we did not have to wait for anything, but did not pester us constantly. It was truly a relaxing atmosphere where we could simply enjoy our meals and conversation. The pasta was al dente and the sauce was balanced just right so you could taste it all. The wine was also great, and not too pricey, inspiring me to put it on my list to pick up a bottle for home some time.

xHPor5RG6jSgo48RR6B5qQ.text: Great place.  Lots of fun.  I highly recommend if you in the area.  It is worth making reservations.  The food is excellent as is the service.  Everyone is very professional and welcoming.

kxqf_Kz10fsztDu4VU3gqA.text: This place was very good, although the sommelier, looked like we kicked her dog when we said we would order wine by the glass instead by the bottle. However, the server was excellent. He was extremely knowledgeable about the menu and all the food items. He had great suggestions for our two kids as well and was spot on with food choices and portions.   The food was really good. I had the Crab Carbonara and it had a very generous amount of crab which was a fantastic surprise. My kids had penne vodka, and spaghetti marinara, and shared and order of meatballs. They loved their food. All in all I would strongly recommend this place.   I was going to remove one star for them not allowing me to wear my hat to dinner, but thought better of it. Lol But seriously, they do not allow hats.

Js2cGixHEcCFgRWuRD5FdQ.text: Had diner at Rao's in Caesers palace last night, and I enjoyed it overall. We started with the seafood salad, $27 which was extremely fresh and delicious, one of the best I've had. For an entree I had the shrimp scampi which I had an option of pasta or a vegetable, so I chose spinach. $38. It tasted absolutely amazing!!! But 5 shrimps with spinach for 38$ seems a little high. Everyone really enjoyed the fresh and delicious food, just seemed a little pricey. AMAZING service though! John was an outstanding waiter and I really appreciate good service. Overall I would definitely recommend!

RsapEiwogjnQADCQiY1vtw.text: Very good our waiter John was super nice and friendly I am happy we got to go there since I will never be able to get a reservation at raos nyc..the meatballs were very good my husband said and they were the size of baseball if your in Vegas this is the place to go for real authentic Italian food

MJ0LjV9nbESxMzQazLKECw.text: I've wanted to eat a RAO's for a long time I would love a shot at eating at the one in NY but while in Vegas it was definitely a spot I wanted to try out...my wife and I stopped in for drinks and an app prior to going out in Vegas.  I am always looking for the best meatballs around so neutrally we had an order of those as well as fried green tomato caprese and needless to say both were very good I was impressed with the baseball sized meatballs and red sauce just like I would make for family and friends.  The fried green tomatoes were also very good.  The happy hour wine was a good deal which we enjoyed.  Also I thought the staff behind the bar was very top notch taking good care of us even though we were having happy hour and apps.  I would give it a 5 star but I didn't try the pasta I will have to do that next time I am in town

o1dQdPBa55_alIkpYap1Rw.text: My meal was simple (shrimp fradiavlo with linguine) and shockingly bad given that it cost $50. Shrimp were inedible.

fs_20P9T6-byVEruFJ8hpQ.text: I was craving for italian food so bad and hubby and I decided to go to Rao's. It has a nice environment and good service. We had to wait for a short time although we didn't have a reservation. The server was an italian man and unfortunately I forgot his name and I feel so bad. Because he was so nice and funny and helping. We asked his recommendations for the drinks, appetizers and food.... he came up with the best of them. We really enjoyed our dinner but at the end we got a little shocked about the price. It's a little pricey so be careful

UtMfYA6e9PdfcsIH9nVFRQ.text: We always enjoy a meal at rao's while in Vegas  Service is attentive  Food is excellent  Fresh ingredients  The meatballs are tops made of a combination of chopped veal, pork and Beef I was told  The rack of lamb is delicious  It's a little more expensive than our local Italian good food places however in Vegas. It's priced normally -- just expensive

79UT9yVGiecVms5VtXGXSQ.text: They still have Christmas decor up which I guess I get it. They are trying to do the whole ivies and lights like an old school Italian joint but I'm reading it as Christmas. We were seated by the window to see the pool. I ordered a seafood salad and thought there will be lettuce in it but nope. It was a small bowl of boiled seafood, mostly calamari. I was calamari-ed out because we ordered fried calamari too. The sauces were good. The pastas were good too.The service was a little creepy but whatever.

mhUJ_MbFGz9xnzAgUE_dWA.text: Excellent evening out with friends made even better with the hospitality and food enjoyed at Raos. Our server assisted in finding a wine enjoyed by everyone while we shared a couple appetizers - the ravioli purses are a must!  Love veal parmigiana? Then make sure to have it here ... best in a long time.

TGwkyq6nlQUWt-ocWh6rqg.text: Menu looked promising, service was fast and friendly, atmosphere was good, and the bread was tasty. However, things went downhill from there. The signature meatballs were watery and flavorless, the sausage tasted off, and the pasta sauces were quite lackluster. None of the dishes stood out as particularly tasty, and one was nearly inedible. My father, generally very forgiving, commented, 'that was the worst meal I can remember in years.' That may be an exaggeration, but the whole family agreed that the price was way too high for the quality of the food.

8cbiy_uLkBfzNcNRxWqstQ.text: My family and I chose this restaurant because the line at Bachanal seemed too long. I ordered the crab carbonara, my wife ordered the veal parmesan, and my kids split the chicken sun-dried tomato penne dish.  The crab carbonara was lacking in any flavor, which was odd because it had a medely of visible ingredients.   The veal was a mammoth chunk of flattened meat by itself on a plate... Not nearly as tender as it should have been and completely underwhelming in every regard.  The chicken penne dish was equally lackluster. The sun-dried tomatoes were not dried at all, the chicken had pieces of gristle, and the sauce was flavorless.  Additionally, the service was less than stellar. The food took quite a while to come out, and our waitress apparently forgot that after people eat they need to pay so they can leave at some point.  Overall a very disappointing experience. Definitely wouldn't come back or ever recommend this place to anyone.

E7c2NotNc1JtMSutgQ83VA.text: A quick review  for a quick happy hour visit.  We jumped in at 6p on a Tuesday and sat at the bar.  We were treated like kings/queens- with place settings, water immediately, and two bread baskets for the 4 of us.  They took our orders quickly and food came out just as fast.  Everything was very good and baked ravioli (I think) was excellent.  -loved the visit!

2TypyzCrNVf58uEN59IPuQ.text: Rao's in New York City is a bit of an urban legend / myth. It exists, but you can't eat there. Seats are more less owned and resold for literally thousands of dollars a pop. Seemed foolish to pass on the opportunity to eat at the same restaurant in Vegas since the one in NYC will likely never happen.   We were able to get last minute reservations on a Thursday for 9:30. Restaurant has a very cool feel to it, kinda like something out of an old school Italian mob movie.   Bread basket - surprisingly enjoyable. What really makes this is the free different types of butter served with the bread. Don't ask me what they are; no one told us.   Meatballs - these were highly recommended  by our waiter; he said they always sell out of these. 15 minutes prior to closing, they still had them. When I think of excellent meatballs, I think of places like Lavo or Carbone where the meatball is full of texture and you can plainly see and taste the different meats. This was more of a uniform, over mixed meatball. It's fine, but nothing to wax poetic about. The meatballs at Lavo are.   Frito misto - so, so, so much food. This could easily serve five people comfortably, and really was good. The calamari was super, super tender, as was the shrimp. This was one of the two dishes that truly excelled.   Mozzarella Carrozza - this is basically a giant mozzarella stick. It's good, for what it is, but let's be honest about what it is. Again, it's fine, but nothing that special.   Pastas had a cool presentation factor, and were brought to you table side in stainless steel pots and mixed there, then served.   Penne Vodka - this is excellent. Pasta tastes fresh with a nice chew factor and the sauce is rich and creamy.   Linguini and Clams - there is no reason to order this. Seriously. It is spaghetti and clams with basically no real flavor. Resist temptation and skip this. We barely are it and didn't bother to bring it home.   Veal Parm - the other dish that the waiter said they always run out of was also still available at 9:45. The only thing that really distinguished this veal park from most every other one I've ever had was that it comes on the bone. Like the meatball, it's fine, but nothing you could have and call life changing.   The biggest thing this place has going for it is the novelty of what it is, and the allure to anyone from NYC that you can actually get in here. It's more less standard, expensive Italian food. If you are really dying to try Rao's in NYC and can't, coming here will satisfy the urge and make you feel like you didn't really miss out if this is the same as the original.

vo-6c77sKuxKnTq5I7n5ow.text: The place is huge (it's Las Vegas after all) but perhaps the well known Raos charm suffers a bit. Food is good and plentiful. The portions are a bit overwhelming. The only odd thing is that the was one maitre de who was super loud and sort of annoying. Plus he kept telling a nearby table about the special stuff he gave them which made us feel a little less special!

hVi0Qh8w7NY9nJk0OwEhxA.text: A very good meal (my meal in particular, which was standard pasta and meatballs, was outstanding), but given the mystique surrounding Rao's, I was expecting near-perfection, and didn't get there.  My advice to visitors would be to stick with the classics--I played it safe, and was rewarded, whereas some other members of my group made decisions that they didn't enjoy quite as much.  Definitely a good option for classic Italian food--service was very good, and Rao's has a fantastic wine list.

QGcuBM01iXiyh8DJGDBzYw.text: I tried the orecchiette with broccoli rappe and sausage and it was one of the worst things I ever ate. It was the first time in my life I ever sent food back at a restaurant. The sausage was dry and tasteless, the pasta and broccoli were WAY too salty and bitter. It was aweful. My friend tried the "famous lemon chicken" and it tasted like dry, plain bone in chicken with lemon juice squeezed on top. Utter Crap. I had the waiter replace my dish with the cheesy vodka pasta and it was good but the meat was scarce and tasteless. The meat balls were good, but not amazing. The table bread was also cold instead of fresh baked which I didn't care for.  This food isn't very good, and it hurts even more when you get the bill.

qfqTAvC43Up_aoe7ylWAbA.text: I could eat Italian food for breakfast, lunch, and dinner every single day... and it's because of places like this that the cuisine has won me over. I so wish there was a Rao's in my hometown! It's old school and they know how to do it right. The decor is certainly nothing fancy. It is based off the original restaurant in NYC, and both locations keep Christmas decorations up year round and have pictures of celebrity diners covering the walls. However, what it lacks in "prettiness" it more than makes up with in the food...  The food, oh, the glorious food! I admit that I'm a carboholic, and their bread basket offers a variety of tasty options. They also have one of the best caesar salads around, so my husband and I usually split one to start off our meal. The most recent dish I tried has been my favorite to date... Penne Vodka. It was a simple dish, but the sauce was just perfect! My dining companions all favored this dish as well out of our particular selections, but they did enjoy their own entrees very much to say the least. I know my husband loved his monsterous portion of lasagna.  Rao's will continue to be a go-to spot for my husband and I when in town. It never disappoints when you're in the mood for a good, hearty Italian meal... and for me, that's often.

4zmewIsO4VPILkCLFgClkQ.text: Just ate here again last night. The food was great as alway's.  We shared the antipasto plate.  It was delicious.  I had the veal chop in a hot and sweet pepper sauce.  My favorite.  My wife had the lamb chops, her favorite. Every thing was done perfectly. We always eat the bar and the service couldn't be better.

lpgBO6DTxzEanHjpTZuG4Q.text: First of all we went in and they were rude. We ordered the waitress was horrible. We received our salads and it took them 50 minutes to get our food. Everyone around us received their food before us when we arrived before them. The food was horrible. My seven yr old could make a better dish....for the price we paid...the 4 of agreed we should have gone to subway and had more of a quality dining experience,,, 190 tab for four people. ..horrible horrible!!!!!!!

uRIA4UgCIJ5nirTtqh0dIA.text: The Las Vegas of today is vastly unlike the Las Vegas of the early eighties when I made my first visits. In the old days finding a decent meal for a New Orleans' boy was next to impossible. Of course people did not go to Las Vegas to dine. And food was inexpensive at the same time. That has changed.   Today you pass a grand time enjoying some very palatable culinary wonders. Rao's is a restaurant I would recommend. The original restaurant was started in New York, New York in 1896 and is still owned and operated by the same family. They do a very good job as far as the food, service and atmosphere along with a respectable wine list.  One thing that stood out to me was the statute of the Blessed Mother. For those of Italian decent and Catholics I am sure that was notice. There is no pushing of religion at all but I do believe the owners are just showing respect.  Reservations were made long in advance and there was no problem with the handling of those reservations. Since my wife and I were staying at Caesar's we can't tell you about parking for the place. I signed up for their player's card and received a $20.00 discount for any restaurant in Caesar's. With the prices now at this play spot that is helpful.  The servers were all personable and professional. We informed our waiter we were not in a rush and from New Orleans and there to dine. All went well. Jim, Mike, and Adam who assisted with wine selection could not have provided better service without being invasive for a night out with my wife.   The Penne Vodka was totally enjoyed by my wife. San Marzano Tomatoes, Prosciutto Cotto, Vodka, and Cream in a very tasty and large portion made her contented.   My choice was the Veal Parmesan which was pounded and breaded. This is a most enjoyable piece of meat and the serving is large. Cost is high and portions are large.   Could not resist and knew it was a bit much but also had to taste the Meatball. Humongous meatball made with Ground Veal, Pork and Beef. Well seasoned and covered with Italian Breadcrumbs and Marinara Sauce.  A bottle of Jordan Cabernet Sauvignon was just dandy with the meal and we ended with some very fine Cappuccino.  The tables are apart so that conversations are private. The background music is at an acceptable level and the music being played was perfect for the ambiance of the restaurant. Food is tasty and flavorful and it is accompanied with attentive but not invasive service. So happy to have selected Rao's over so many choices and will return on any future visit to Las Vegas.

J5O90W1ZzlKDWHTfE-rVNA.text: We loved it. Service was fantastic, food was very good. Rao's Vegas is everything we hoped for. And yes the meatballs are amazing. A must when you're in Las Vegas - 'cause you ain't gett'en in the one in New York City.

b_yHCLQ8nflgtSMJ6liFhA.text: Fantastic! I had the opportunity to try many items on the menu and everything was exquisite. It will cost you an arm and a leg, but also might be the best Italian food you've ever had.

8v39bNxHrGpIGurpVxaFWw.text: Walked in bc I got tired of waiting in line for buffet (45 min and only halfway). I walked in and the three hostesses looked at ne like I was crazy, then told me I would have to wait 15 minutes to be seated...when there were only tables outside! I then had to ask where I woukd be seated and she grudgingly stated that there was a seat for one inside...or I could sit outside if I wanted. I wanted! Just as I was about to go find another restaurant she allowed me to sit. I was immediately greeted by one of the people working with the server, but it took the actual server a good 5 minutes to come over. I asked questiones, he made honest suggestions, and we got off to a good start. The baked clams came out within minutes...a bit on the salty side, but tasty. Spaghetti and a side of meatballs came not too soon afterwards. Pasta twirled onto the plate tableside...nice touch. But, I found it ok, not great. Overall, an overpriced and over-rated experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spaghetti and meatballs
Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baked clams

EXdypv3qqCANTr5Msaut5Q.text: I know I have said that when I travel I prefer to go to places that I can't when I'm home. Rao's NYC might be the toughest reservation on the planet; Rao's Las Vegas is much easier. It's the same family who owns it and not a private equity or franchise like some other big name 'chains', from what I understand. When we checked in with the hostess, she did give me advice on how to get into NYC and I will let you know if it works. Rao's is an old school, family style Italian restaurant. Keep that in mind when ordering or you'll end up with left overs for days, or so full you may explode. Many of the pastas and salads can be halved (which isn't noted on the menu). We started with a roasted beet salad. It was your typical beet salad with arugula. Gramercy Guy and I disagree though; I think the beets were from a can and not roasted in house. One of my favorite dishes ever is chicken scarpiello or sometimes called country chicken. It's chicken on the bone with sweet and spicy sausage and onions and peppers. I get it often when I see on a menu. The Rao's version is exceptional. I don't even need to look at the menu, I know I will always get this. We did try a new pasta this time, the ravioli purses which had pear and ricotta in a butter and sage sauce with dried cranberries. They were really, really good. Happy we only got a 1/2 order because otherwise, I wouldn't have eaten my chicken. They had a nice sweetness that I think in a strange way would work well as a dessert. How great would pasta for dessert be? For dessert we got the profiteroles. They looked amazing and were huge, but I wasn't impressed. Maybe it was my fault for getting a French dessert in an Italian restaurant, the puff pastry was chewy and there was way too much chocolate sauce which was cold. I like it when they drizzle warm, semi-sweet chocolate right on top so the chocolate and ice cream melt together. This dessert misstep will not stop me from going back to Rao's in the future. For pictures and more reviews gramercygirl.blogspot.co...

mRz8vx9fFb5OFYYNSqK8jw.text: Came here with an open mind and a large group...  Was not sure what to expect, but on our way over we read, on yelp of course, how amazing the meatballs were..  We ordered food to share and the servings size were decent enough to share but not over the top a small but decent serving..we started with the mixed appetizer plate and the meatballs..the app plate was good has a wide selection for everyone to try something..we orderd two for our group and it was more then enough..  The meatballs alone would get a 5 star, I absolutely loved them and the sauce it came in was amazing..I was somewhat selfish with the meatballs because they were so good.  I split a plate of spaghetti with my daughter and it was good, could of used more sauce as they actually bring it out already split, but good nonetheless.  Service: is ok, waited about 20 minutes to get a glass of wine, on top of that it was kind of stuffy and average at best..compared to many other places in LV service was lacking..  All in all 3 stars is good, the place is really pricey for what you get..I doubt I will be back unless someone is adamant about going.

Y4qZ-j-23R8P8wRQIk9uLg.text: This was a great meal. We booked at the last minute, and had a lovely experience. The food was delicious, and the atmosphere relaxed. The burrata caprese salad was fantastic. Our only complaint would be that their pasta is not house made. For an Italian restaurant of this calibre, this was a surprise.

Ll-iJ5xcWT6nGMgywSMVsg.text: I was in Vegas recently for a business trip and stayed at the Caesars. I was surprised to see Rao's there knowing their reputably exclusive family-bought-out tables at their NYC location. My boss and I sat at the bar for dinner, and it was his second night in a row. We both ordered from the special menu of the night, my boss ordered the salmon which he seemed to enjoy while I got the mushroom pasta in cream sauce. The pasta was simply delicious, full of flavors with generous portion i couldn't finish.  I've always believed Italian food should be simple, cozy and not overly fancy. Rao does just that with its hearty and honest pasta thats specially comforting after a long and tiring day of work.

iJaR3ysUR01hrTw2cKmqFw.text: They provide nice food and service but I don't think it is that kind of good. Everything is just average!

YSRmhH8LF4KasXd1RpVY9Q.text: Love, love, LOVE this place.  It's a must whenever I'm in Vegas.  I typically get the caprese salad, pasta bolognese, and meatball.  All three items are fantastic, particularly the caprese and meatball.  Definitely stop here if you're on the strip!

1MHY2dXLGGTtrLViy1bqGg.text: My husband and I shared one order of each.  Seafood salad, spinach stuffed ravioli, veal Parmesan, and meatballs.  Everything was excellent, except the veal Parmesan was so, so. I'd skip it next time.  Service was great.

XGaZKF2wQApjIJWZw27Jbw.text: Looked forward to my dinner at Raos.  Lovely atmosphere but the food just average. I was expecting to be blown away. Not so much.  Risotto was just blah. Non creaminess or rich cheese flavor. Oh well.

3yTvi3Zmgdepb_4kQ3fRfQ.text: Hosts were prompt and cheerful in seating us.  Food was great.  Loved the Calamari, Shrimp, Zuchini appetizer! The shrimp flavor and texture was "the best" I have ever experienced!  Meatballs were impressive (size)  and pasta was very tasty. Service was excellent. Our water glasses and coffee cups were never close to being empty. Wine and Cheesecake dessert topped it all off.  We were staying at Cesars, however I would recommend Rao's as a good Italian Restaurant even if you are staying elsewhere in LV.  It's worth the trip into the casino!

FTFj0M_3miCvrEMtpZvT7w.text: Food was totally awesome and I'm a native NY'er.  We asked for a quiet spot for our anniversary, we got next to a family of 10 and another party of 8.  Not quiet but the food was worth it.  Service is slow if you are near a table of 10 or 8 that need a ton of attention.  The restuarant should be smart enough to assign multiple waiters to big tables so they don't get overwhelmed.  I've been here 2x in 2016 and both times the food was excellent.  Veal parm, amazing and huge, veal milanese, the best on the planet.  Meatballs are wonderful as well.  Definitely go.  Too many cute little hostesses, they need more real waiters!!!

PPcCcRWg6vQiOR8mx00cJg.text: The meatballs are worth the trip. Lemon chicken delicious. Great atmosphere even though it's a little dark. Service great.   Solid 4.5/5.

Stkeo6Sf1B7AWDybv2V7CQ.text: A classic NYC Italian restaurant with a location in Las Vegas.  The Vegas location is huge and very beautiful inside. Unlike NYC though, you can just walk right in and be seated without making a reservation two years ahead of time. I started off with the clams cooked in a garlic wine sauce expecting larger clams. Although they were the tiny ones, the dish itself was very good. Next came the Chicken Parm with spaghetti and a side order of meatballs. No complaints about either one of these either. My opinion is that if an Italian restaurant screws up meatballs and pasta, well what can they do right? In this case, they did it all right. I'm usually a Carmine's guy and gave this a shot. Although things were prepared slightly different, Carmine's does offer a larger portion for about 30% less. But the choice is yours here when it comes to that option since some do not care for family style dining like Carmine's and unlike Rao's.  Ambience is much more romantic in Rao's, so bring your lover here.
