mHxBsyq0ERns0EDZ3MlO1A.text: Having been to the real Raos in Harlem this one doesn't hold a candle to the food or ambience of the original - but how could it?  Very large place, nice bar and the food and service were very good. Definitely worth going for dinner

QVDdIci_35n5mmeoucr6Cg.text: Worst Veal Parmigiana ever  Loud place with overpriced food  White Castle would be better  At least you know what your getting  The menu was lacking and even though COSTCO sells thier sauce in store just not impressed  I do not know why Yelp insists I keep writing  Bad is Bad

photos.caption: Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Here is what the absolute over cooked overpriced veal parmigiana looks like So disappointing at least White Castle is consistent

kSX0U_zTPTTQ8eO9VwxdoQ.text: A must visit, make an an appointment sit inside and enjoy an amazing meal. Dinner for two, is a must with a great piece of filet mignon. Coming back for the lemon chicken!

3mM9dAPV-CfvtDoZbSJiLw.text: The whole experience was amazing! Had reservations at 9:45. Took us in right when we got there. The hostess was friendly. I believe our server was named Oscar. He was phenomenal! We always ask for any recommendations which he suggested the Penne Vodka. My husband got that and some meatballs. I got the Chicken Parmesan. Got the Mozzarella Carozza for an appetizer. This fried cheese was wonderful. Came with marinara. I've had fried cheese before but this was the best ever! The chicken in the Chicken Parmesan had a buttery flavor that made it soooo good. The meatballs were soft and the meat just crumbled and melted in our mouths! I must say though, Oscar was right about the Penne Vodka. It was the best thing of the meal. We went around our anniversary and I had mentioned that when making the reservation. We received a little scoop of vanilla ice cream with some fruit for free! We probably could have split a meal as the portions were on the larger size. Loved the dining experience and the service was top notch. It was a little pricey but extremely happy we went there!

photos.caption: Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meatballs and Penne Vodka...DELICIOUS!!!!
Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Special ice cream for our celebration.
Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Parmesan. Comes with pasta and marinara sauce. Chicken had a buttery flavor to it!

n_acAzOqJk22N7ZlvTGcAw.text: I had the chilled seafood salad to start as my appetizer.  It was my least favorite part of the meal.  I personally would not recommend it.  The seafood pasta, however, was delicious.  It had a little kick to it.  Service was a little on the slower side.

oDnpFLanLll-K8UYJKGCtg.text: Frank, the owner, and Russ, our waiter, at Rao's just made our night!!! I took my nephew for his 11th birthday - dinner and a show. I have always wanted to go to Rao's - and I thought they wouldn't have availability. I explained it was my nephews birthday and they accommodated us. Russ sat at our table, cracked jokes, and made us feel welcome. My nephew laughed and giggled and we had a great night. The food was delicious!! My nephew loved his penne vodka and fried mozzarella, and I really enjoyed the chicken parmesan. We had a great night, then as we were walking out, we saw Frank and told him how great the food was and how much we enjoyed talking with Russ. Frank gave my nephew an autographed cookbook!  My nephew has been talking about our experience all night. We can't wait to go back with the entire family - my nephew reminded me that Russ is off Sundays and Mondays

photos.caption: Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ozEf3JY92ekW6yB_UdcMdw.text: It's the Vegas tourist version and if you've never been to Rao's in NY... then you have no way to compare.   First, it's huge and pretty. But mostly huge. Like the portions other than chicken piccata which I'll get to later.   NY Rao's is a hidden gem and invitation or a lucky call to get in. Very inside and protected. Vegas is open to the world. So, be prepared to wait even with a ressie. The bar is also huge and a good spot to hang or even eat. Fun vibe.   Oscar did a nice job as a server and handled us and a crazy group of 18 guys behind us. Loud? You bet.   Started with wine by the glass and shared meatballs as big as your head. One each. Just ok.   Veal piccata was great with a zucchini perfectly cooked. But not enough to share.   So, all that for about $180. Hmmmmm, oh well you only live once.   I think I'll wait for the next lucky NY call.

GlTlnsZ_iNfQJSGR8coofQ.text: Located inside Ceasar's Palace on the famous Las Vegas Strip. This NY transplant made the journey out west quite well. I recommend going on Sunday and getting the famous Sunday Gravy. The service is spectacular. So if you are looking for a taste of classic New York, you've found your spot. Make sure to check in on Yelp for a free cocktail. Live It Up You Are In Las Vegas For Cryin' Out Loud!

photos.caption: Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Only Civilized Way To End A Meal.
Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Holy Cannoli
Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiramisu, It&#39;s What&#39;s For Dessert

ozF9LIe7qxhyRpbd1rrtiw.text: It was decent, but it wasn't worth coming back. I just had dinner at Rao's for the first time. The service was great, the ambiance was nice, and the food was good (not anything special). It was an overall pleasant experience. I had the caprese salad and spaghetti bolognese. The caprese salad didn't have enough basil, but the taste was really good. The spaghetti was good. The pasta is not made in-house and wasn't anything special.  I skipped dessert because I thought it looked overpriced for creme brulee ($14). Had the other food been outstanding, it may have been convincing to order a standard dessert and expect something worth double the price of an average restaurant's charge for the same.

cGJX9Gn-auO-vCg_90xYpA.text: I got to say that this place was a disappointment for sure! I read the reviews before going here and heard about the upselling on wine and some shaky service in general.  However I went in with an open mind looking forward to a good Italian dish. I got to say that the Seafood Salad was very good! I had the Shrimp Scampi over linguine, pretty good but nothing to get crazy about.  The server we had was slow and shaky, such as having to be asked 3 times for a glass of wine.  I never pay close attention to the bill, however my wife does. She asks me what this random $7 charge was on the bill. I was going to pay it do we could just go but she insisted on asking. The server says that was for distilled water. Then I was confused as we ordered a bottle of Pellegrino which was also $7 and was already on the bill. After a little back and forth, he finalyy had the $7 removed.  This little incident turned me off completely to this place and I would never even consider on going back.   Please either consider a different Italian Place or check your bill carefully.

2NSV_Ltv6KnVimH7o-bhFQ.text: Ate a fantastic meal here.  Family of four, one of us just had braces put on and the spaghetti was so perfectly served, presentation and delivery, just wonderful!  The wine was good, the service was fantastic too, we would definitely eat here again and again.  Not for the price conscious but we like to eat well when we are on vacation!!!

sj3pKiz2bT7vMGcaKblt2Q.text: Why 2 stars for "Overall?"  Well, we have been visiting the various Rao's in the country for years starting with the original in the Bronx.   Caesar's opened and we were there.....and finally we got our own in Los Angeles that we visit often and enjoy.   The issue with the dinner we had at Caesar's Place on Tuesday, October 13, 2016 with 6PM reservations for 5 adults is this;  We spent almost $425 to celebrate my Sisters 50th wedding anniversary.  When we were reviewing the menus and options for the evening, I had seen a plate go by that didn't look familiar and asked our waiter what it was and he responded "we can do anything you want with pasta and sauces."  Great answer....I thought!   One of the specials that day was Chicken Parmesan which I love and ordered.  I was told it came with spaghetti and marinara sauce and asked for penne or rigatoni instead.  Our waiter informed me that the Chef would not change the pasta on this dish but i could order a side dish for an additional charge and I asked why and was told that was "the rule."  Well, this is truly not acceptable.   I kindly spoke with a Manager and was informed the same thing.  Feeling defeated and not understanding the issue with placing penne on the plate instead of spaghetti with the same sauce made no sense.   Our meal was spectacle as always but the taste left in our mouth ruined the evening for me and my Guests.   More bad news came when the bill arrived.   $44 for the chicken parmesan with spaghetti.  $44 for a slab of pounded chicken...which was delicious and 4oz of spaghetti and I couldn't have a penne with it instead.   Will we return....uncertain.   If a simple request, in a world class restaurant can not be made, then it might be time to revisit your customer base and what message this sends.  (this is not a fast food Italian restaurant.  The restaurant was not busy as usual due to our early arrival time and to think that the kitchen could not handle a simple change is disturbing.

2U7n4J9feHA2yQStwkl4iw.text: Pros: It's very fancy with great atmosphere and great customer service.  Cons: the food and price.  Experience: The food really let me down. I came here for my friends 21st birthday and when we got the menu nothing in it made me think it was going to be elevated food because it all looked like food you can cook at home. But of course I try it and I was right. If it wasn't for the great customer service this place would get a star. It's overpriced because it's in a hotel, that's it.  Conclusion: You'll spend a lot of money for no reason and forget you came here

sQ5bN6an2hvqtJtkkg5tlw.text: We were here last night for NYE - ate at 7:30pm. First off, let me give a shout out to their jar sauces which you can buy in supermarket. We are so fond of their arribiatta sauce that when we learned there was a restaurant here we were thrilled.  Unfortunately, bc it was NYE we were at mercy of a prie fixe.   The caprice salad was the highlight of the meal.  For the pasta course I had these browned butter ravioli which were ok and David had penne with vodka sauce, same.  Dinner he had some chicken dish and I had the eggplant parm.  I love eggplant parm, but it was pretty obvious the hard little disks were not cooked to order and probably reheated from prep last night?  I had cheesecake for the prix fixe - a 2" square of it you might expect at an office party.  All in all, we let our expectations be too high based on the jar sauce. The cool thing is that we got to taste their olive oil - available online.  So we will continue ordering the good stuff but likely won't feel the need to return to the restaurant  Incidentally, excellent service.  But id rank this one on the same level as a bucca de beppo.

bqL2ivNEy2xcxEYDjdInZA.text: Having been a fan of their jarred sauce for a while (expensive but the best in my opinion) I was hoping I could give this place a 5 when I made the reservation.  Don't get me wrong the atmosphere is great and the staff was personable and professional, the antipasto the side of meatballs were great.   The problem is, I have a favorite dish and its one that every place does a little different and that's OK but when I saw that they had chicken scarpiello on the menu I thought I was in for a dinner to remember.  Rao's does it with bone in chicken pieces which I suppose is more authentic if harder to eat and that wasn't the problem the problem is I have had better for half the money at a little pizza/pasta place in Westchester NY! The sauce was just so so and the sausage was not the best (nor the worst certainly) that I have ever had and the chicken pieces were a little less than meaty.  Oh well I will dream that some day Martin Scorsese will cast me and I can get into the original and see how it stacks up!  If I had ordered anything else for dinner I probably would have given this place at least a 4 but it was sort of like meeting your child hood hero and finding out he has a beer gut and too much nose hair, he still might be a great guy but you built him up to be something better.

4qLc6VAfgjPyzAT1wcEmHg.text: The service was awesome and the food was incredible.  I had chicken scaperillo and hubby had linguini and clams.  Yummy 100 %.

4abM0BqeuvZtK3IZfNjjZg.text: This is our favorite Italian restaurant in Las Vegas. Whenever we are on the strip, we always go to this restaurant at Caesar's.  FYI - the whole restaurant is closed on thanksgiving week. We tried to go there thanksgiving 2014 and 2015.

tggCrPCi4m9eed30bKcE7Q.text: I have never been to the one in New York but the Vegas location didn't disappoint.  Delicious Italian cuisine, good service, amazing deserts and great wine selections.  Meatballs are to die for.

8CjDV34pp7bP0d-x7SMrMg.text: Hands down the best meal I've eaten in Las Vegas. The service was awesome. Be careful though, reservations go fast. Try the chicken scarpariello, perfect balance of flavors. Minestrone soup was amazing. I wish I hadn't filled up, I'll have to come back from Denver for dessert sometime!

LPPSRMwEehsknxq8dlNrww.text: The food here is good...it was your standard Italian hotel restaurant. They only had one dish that featured fresh, house made pasta. Our party ordered a few pastas and entrees that we all wanted to try which the servers divvied up so we all had a tasting portion.

photos.caption: Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great wine list
Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Made our own pasta trio

v39pmFYXxtm07pkzQjGRNg.text: Food is good, no complaints.... But I can't help but feel like Rao's is an upscale Old Spaghetti Factory. Rao's is a stereotypical Americanized Italian restaurant with above average quality and higher-end pricing.  Italian restaurant menus typically stay consistent and Rao's stays within the typical trattoria mold. Nothing exciting... just the classics.   In the end, I'd much rather go to Scarpetta @ Cosmo, Otto or B&B @ Venetian, or Fiamma @ MGM.

OFMnEYWZ2tnSZzT8Rxo4-g.text: Completely overpriced! Went specifically for the veal parm and while the portion is big it was extremely dry and sauce is an extra fee. Side of pasta is extra too. For $53 you could serve pasta with it. I am Italian and have eaten at Italian restaurants big and small all over the east coast and this was just disappointing. A lot of money and not a lot of food almost the opposite of a True Italian eating experience.

y9xX30GKkaOU-Xd8pYSMIA.text: I was excited to try this restaurant, especially after seeing the "original" NY version on Wolf of Wall Street. I was not disappointed. I really had no idea what to order so I just went with Caesar salad, Lasagna, and a scotch. Seemingly standard items, but they tasted very fresh, and as though better quality products were used. The wait staff was very friendly, and the ambience felt nostalgiac. I would love to return when back in Las Vegas.

s-9o_XBQDCR77ZKE4lCVEQ.text: This was one of my favorite places in Las Vegas, especially being from NY, because you can't get in the original in Harlem. It has gone corporate, service is bad and food value for money is poor.  Capresse salad $19, barely any fresh Mozzarella on the plate.  Meatballs tasty but you get half the portion of when it original opened.   Staff is disgruntled and openly complains.  $360, before tip, 4 people, save you money this place is no longer worth it.

fPUUpTkFd4KRHZf0Xc_ZgQ.text: I was super excited to eat here since I've heard all the tales about the exclusive New York location. It did not disappoint. The clams & linguine was easily the best I ever had. It was just very delicate, unlike most which can be overbearing and too rich. And absolutely loaded with clam meat. The pasta shell dish (forgot the exact name) was good but a little bit on the dry side. But overall the food was way above average compared to most Italian places. I look forward to going back and shoving more pasta into my greedy little eat hole.

LJyW5n65Q0tEL0fRGNrEDA.text: Service was good but the food was pretty bad... I ordered the lasagna bolognese, tasted like meat ragu sauce over spaghetti... My wife does it 100 times better.... She orderd the shrimp scampi which was also sub par... Stay away unless u just wana have drinks and people watch...

TurVP6Fu_P4UGGwiUhIPHw.text: Since the restaurant in East Harlem has been booked in advance for the last 35+ years, I really, really wanted to try Raos in Vegas. I might never get a chance to try those legendary meatballs in NYC, so this could be my only chance.   Alright, ordered two meatballs as an appetizer, with Penne alla Vodka as the main course. The meal came with rather plain jane bread that was good and fresh, but nothing spectacular.   So, the meatballs are about 5oz each and are covered in a thinly sweet Marinara sauce, sans any pasta. Real Italian Polpettine, perhaps a little too large for Napoli but delicious & soft while retaining an exterior form that prevents them from mushing. I tasted beef, pork, and veal, with parsley and garlic. Yum yum. Oh so yum yum!  Ah, the Penne alla Vodka? Now, it was served while I was still chowing on the meatballs (haha--did I write that?), and that is a faux pax of serving but I forgive them. Now, the sauce was a little too thick for my taste; I think a loosening of some starchy pasta water would have helped. But it was deliciously creamy, with a nice pepper bite to it, and a delicate balance of pancetta and garlic. The graininess from the vodka was perceptible, but not overwhelming.   Well-done.

L3WV36bHCB7Ldwn-a1I8ZA.text: Everything was great from our drinks, shared caeser salad, fresh bruschetta, Rao's meatballs, to the shelled pasta with 4 cheeses. Definitely would come back here.

dKBgfSiuqtVwUWRbbQ50sw.text: Fun and Enjoyable.  If you are looking for some fun dining experiences on the strip, Rao's is a fun and traditional establishment.  Reservations - Book early if you can, because this is a popular place due to Rao's in New York.  Good for Groups - they can accommodate groups of many sizes.  Service - The service is worth a 5.  They definitely know their stuff and will tell you what they like or what is popular.  Overall, it is like working together to create a great meal experience.  Starters- Not bad at all. Not a 5 but not a 3 either. 3.75!  a.  Meatballs - There were five of us and we actually ordered 3 meatballs to split. They are rather large, larger than you anticipate so this was perfect.  b.  Pasta - We split two of the Fusilli with Sausage and Cabbage. Very nice and light. We ordered two dishes and while rather small, we all had a bit of a helping so it was fine.  The sausage and the cabbage make for a nice mix.  c. Antipasto Della Casa - Very nice. Besides all the normal meats, cheese, peppers, tomatoes and olives, they also give you gran padano cheese. It is my favorite...  d.  Roasted Peppers - Very nice with pine nuts!  Main Entree -  We shared three meat dishes and it was plenty  a.  Grilled Lamb chops - Awesome and especially on the bone. So tasty!  b.  Osso Bucco - Huge shank and that means a lot of bone marrow to dig out.  Yum Yum for those that like the marrow!  c.  Veal Parmasan - Nice and tender.  It was pretty good.    Overall the Osso Bucco and Lamb Chops were great, the Antipasto and the meatballs were awesome and everything else was pretty good.  GK says check it out.  Remember, great service!

4DMDimgyFs66cd54zYJk-g.text: Dined at Rao's on Thursday night. Had always wanted to try the one in NY, so couldn't pass it up in LV. The decor is nice upscale casual, with no stuffy fine dining, very friendly service. Two rooms are exact replications of the whole tiny dining room in NY, even the placement of the autographed photos on the wall...pretty cool. Everything is ridiculously overpriced including wines by the glass ( $15-$20). Food also overpriced BUT extremely delicious...best red sauce I've ever had...seriously! Also probably best tiramisu which we don't usually order since it's pretty much the same everywhere but it was extraordinarily good. So your going to dig in your wallet same as everwhere in Vegas but u can expect a large, very filling, extremely delicious Italian meal here, which u don't often get everywhere else! I will hit again next time in Vegas!

TkVNZnw0M1V9FGtKGl9Mcg.text: Rao's lived up to the hype!  We made a reservation for 4 on a Friday night and arrived right at our reservation time.  We wound up having a party of 5 and we were told that they would be able to accommodate us, but it would take 10 minutes and we could sit at the bar and wait until the table is ready.  No thank you, especially when I see multiple tables in the courtyard area and inside.  We were finally seated in the courtyard area with Matt as our server.  We ordered the garden salad, meatballs, and baked clams for appetizers.  The meatballs were amazing!  Super moist and flavorful in every bite.  We then ordered three entrees to share, penne a la vodka, veal parmesan, and another chicken dish with sausage and peppers (I can't remember the name).  The wait staff shared the penne across 5 plates and we just added the meat dishes to our own plates.  Three entrees was more than enough for the five of us.  Service was great throughout the meal.  Unfortunately, we couldn't try dessert because we were all stuffed!

MPOABWDcbS1dBda0yAhjIQ.text: Wonderful pasta. And the meatballs were sublime if meatballs can be characterized that way. We could never get into the New York, location, but Las Vegas is way bigger and more accessible.

fJPMudapGZ8KB_ZS1BOppw.text: RAO's LV is awesome.  The meatballs, the pasta, the chops.  It does not get any better than this.  And if you are lucky, Frankie is around and is a terrific host.  BTW, killer wine list!

ym7y9WSaMC4NLT9jEatdVQ.text: 4 1/2-stars.  Why?  Because they have one of the best meatball dishes I've ever eaten in Las Vegas, but also because this review is a little different from other reviews I've done because I'm actually taking into account a bit of rare service.  A RARE CASE OF GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE I wasn't feeling hungry earlier today despite the fact that I had a reservation at Rao's - the Italian restaurant at Caesar's Palace.  Rao's is purported to have one of the best meatballs in all of Las Vegas so of course I had to try it.  The problem is, I don't think you can really can't rate food if you're completely full.  So I cancelled the reservation and headed off to my evening show. (Penn & Teller)  After the show, I headed straight to Caesars intending on eating dinner by racing over to Rao's. ...It was just under 11PM and I ran up to the maitre d' huffing & puffing and said, "I MADE IT!  You're still open right?  I'm dying for some meatballs."  She said, "Yes, we're open for the bar, but not for food."  I said, "What?"  She said, "The kitchen closes at 10:30PM!"  I suddenly frowned, became despondent - rolled my eyes and slowly turned around." ...Suddenly the girl said, "Wait.  Hold on."  I stopped, and she gestured to come in, and so I did.  She said, "ONE dish, right?"  I said, "Yeah.  Just the meatballs.  That's it."  She said, "Hold on - I'm going to ask the kitchen if they'll prepare just that dish."  She was gone for awhile but when she came back she said, "They're going to take care of you.  One dish of meatballs."  She turned to the bartender, where I was sitting by then, and said, "The kitchen said it's okay - one dish of meatballs."  The Bartender said, "Cool."  Needless to say, I tipped her $10 as she left.    THE MEATBALLS And sure enough, when the meatballs arrived, they were steaming hot, smothered in licktastic ally delicious marinara.  (Really - I ache for that marinara... it's so tasty!) The bartender came and put fresh aromatic parmesan cheese all over it that smelled heavenly and to me, marked the beginning of a fantastic meal.  Folks - any time your head swoons when you smell your meal, you know you're off to a good start. ...Taste & texture wise, the meatballs were moist & juicy.  It had good substance and you could tell it was cooked right.  If I had one criticism it would be that I personally could have used a little more sausage in the meat but overall it was a very good meatball.  What took it to the next level really were the parmesan and the marinara.  These folks at Rao's know they're frickin' marinara and cheese for certain.  I licked the plate up and left nothing to wash off.  CONCLUSION The food is the most important part but the service is what gets them to the "I-will-definitely-return" level.  The only reason I haven't cranked this to 5-stars is because I think I need to eat their Lasagna, their Spaghetti, and if they have it, Cannaloni, to give it a more thorough review.  4 1/2-stars.

hNFcq3SSF1SiA1apHWnI7A.text: Loved the veal parmesan and antipasto.  A bit noisy and pricey, but solid italian American food.

oF709nf1ca2WVOeZGv6h5Q.text: OKAY... I know you are Caesars Palace, but you are not gourmet! Okay, I admit my pasta was good, but it was DEFINITELY not worth 32 bucks with tip... 32 FREAKING BUCKS... I MEAN, seriously, I could have bought three sandwiches with that and fed my friends. Also, the pizzas my friends order at 20 bucks after tip and tax.. I mean, SERIOUSLY 20 dollars for that pizza was not worth it. I rather have normal cheap pizza at my cheap ass hotel, than to spend 20 dollars on a pizza that was not OUT OF THIS WORLD....   THE PASTA VODKA something blah blah was good, but not good enough that is deserves four stars from me. Excuse me, the ambiance is nice but I actually want to spend money elsewhere! Let alone, drop 30 on some pasta thats not out of this world! I definitely DO NOT recommend this place to anyone! Save your money and time, and go to a buffet instead!

SMedqbldbAxMVoTAXzXWdg.text: One of the worst meals I have ever eaten.  I was well aware of the history of Rao's and was super excited to try this famous food.  The prices were very steep, for lunch and splitting our meal my mom and I still spent $30 each.  The salad was boring and bland, the main course of meatballs and spaghetti was so incredibly boring.  I hated every bite.  We actually were so hungry after this meal we had to run to somewhere else to get another lunch.  Total ripoff and you can find better italian food pretty much anywhere else.  Really, really disappointing.

vJmgLrz8SSUIxqSpgPEFzg.text: Very good meal.  I started with the Insalata de Mare,which was an excellent seafood salad with chunks of calamari, octopus, crab, lobster, and plenty of shrimp.  Don't expect lettuce, but an excellent light simple dressing.  For my entree, I had Gnocci ala Bolognese.  The sauce was incredible: a perfect combo of their signature veal,beef, and pork combination that goes into their meatballs.  It was so good I ate it with a spoon to get as much sauce as possible.  My wife ordered the Lemon Chicken which was cooked perfectly and served on the bone.  Service was excellent.  For our children, they prepared half orders of penne with alfredo sauce and a pasta with smoked salmon.

PcytncoNRzlEt8NogbRPFA.text: seriously even if I'm not Zagat, I have at the very least travelled to many parts of the world and have sampled many authentic foods from different countries.  Italy being one of my favorite countries, and food.   Ceasars Palace Rao's is in my opinion a total rip off, in pricing and quality of food comparatively speaking.  When you pay 27 dollars for a spaghetti plate I expect something rather good, if not the best.  The spaghetti we got was no better than chili's or spaghetti warehouse type but they only charge 10 dollars.  Serious, I ordered Osso Buco, and it was 47 dollars, believe me, it was the worst i've had.  The buffets in vegas had better Osso Buco, the texture was bad, and had little to no taste to it.  considering the cost of this meal, come on Ceasars Palace you can do better.  Learn from Wynn, and learn from Ballagio.  The manager was nice to offer a comp desert and coffee, but seriously they should have done better, just for customer service.  I'm definitely not dining at any of the Ceasars group chains again, value is the name of the game to customer loyalty, you can't charge high prices just because, provide something decent in return.  total disappointment.

igZc8kYRe1IIzdPaxg0bWA.text: My family and I were so excited for the Sunday family dinner pre-fix.  What a disappointment! The waitress messed up our appetizer AND main course dishes.  The meatball (I only got ONE with my dish) was mediocre. The pasta was decent. But nothing to rave about.  To be honest, I didn't think Rao's in Vegas was anything special.  I'd hope that the original Rao's in NY is better, but i'd never be able to get a reservation...

raRQi916ylgz9lSB_CL-Ug.text: We were warned that Rao's gets very very busy so we went around 7pm on a saturday night and got right in, it was actually pretty empty. We ate at the bar and had indifferent service. Ordered the Caesar and meatballs to start. The Caesar was on par with a Caesar at Applebees, a total waste of money & calories, topped with pathetic out of the box croutons. The meatballs on the other hand were some of the finest I have ever had.  I had the lemon chicken and was really happy with the powerful flavors. Wife had the spaghetti with marinara and it was so-so. We did enjoy some surprisingly good and obscure Italian red wines by the glass.  It was hit and miss but we want to try it again.

LLDmS-1f-e2M3EDbX68fpw.text: Everything was on point. Service was exceptional food was impeccable. Also check out the awesome view from the patio when your done! Can't wait to go back next time I'M in Vegas.

aWcgukHbOwdgh_0EU6Fi3Q.text: Total scam.  $20 for a tiny bowl of spaghetti and marinara.  Anything else is extra.   If you eat here twice, you have way too much money and way too little sense.  Expensive does not equal good.

Z5AD4SQlC3zEff7ujhH1Pg.text: After watching Rao's on Food Network, I decided to give this place a try.  BIG disappointment!!  You're better off eating at Joe's Stone Crab if you're at Caesar's.  Everything was just alright.  Nothing special.  The meatballs tasted just like meatballs you defrost from Costco.  The highlight of my meal was the mozarella.

18sN43VOhvBAuJOJEtNPvg.text: Rao's was a bucket list restaurant, but knew my chances of getting into the Harlem location would be slim to none. So, when I found out they opened a location in Las Vegas, I was thrilled. Food was amazing (we had Uncle Vincent's lemon chicken, pasta and Cesar salad), but the service was horrible. Our wait staff was inattentive, didn't take the time to discuss menu items, actually threw salad plates on our table, never asked if we wanted pepper for the salads, more water refills, etc. They were quoting a 45 minute wait with empty tables (although front of the house staff friendly) and the staff looking a bit bored. Never saw a manager checking tables as they should ensure the dining guests are happy. We visited Bouchon the night before (price points are about the same and the difference in service was night and day). I believe if Mr. Rao was aware of the type of service we observed tonight he would be embarrassed.

CBH2KgRbbZozO93Z0S_GLg.text: good food, but unfortunately nothing amazing. my friend and i split meatballs as an appetizer and I was definitely disappointed. as awesome as it is to eat a meatball the size of a baseball, they just seemed dry and bland.  service was really good, as was everyone's entrees, so this wasn't a lost meal - just a sad display of meatballs.

8C_uEb-Qf4phrnNNjFffZw.text: I don't know how reliable my review is for the typical diner, but everything I had was fantastic and the service was fabulous.  We came in for a late night dinner for 10 and thanks to my mom and her best friend being close to the owners I had an exceptional time.  I cannot wait until my next trip to Vegas, I'll definitely be back.

j_Jcl6Hq3x-mXBkOEA4Eow.text: Had the occasion to stop in for lunch a few days before NYE.  Big mistake. First, my party of three walked up to the hostess stand where two young ladies were sitting around chatting while a bunch of dirty tables remained out in the front in an otherwise empty restaurant. We asked for a table and were quickly ushered to a booth. When I asked again for a table I was told that none were available because they were not cleaned off. I asked if maybe she could clean one off so that we could sit there. Begrudgingly she agreed to do. I ordered the chicken ceaser salad. It was pathetic. There was no dressing...none. The chicken was dry, yellow and disgusting.  The salad was turning. I asked for a manager. A manager never showed up. The waiter said she was busy in the back. No new salad, just a lot of attitude. Rather then spend the rest of the afternoon at Rao's or Ceasers Palace, we immediately left the hotel. This is the worst dining experience I've ever had. I will NEVER go back there. You shouldn't either.

N01f8cTl0yAbvB8E3KKUag.text: Waited for the chance to get to eat at the famous Rao's, yes I know its not the Harlem gem, but hey it should be the same.  This was our perception.  Honestly I absolutely love the sauce Rao's and think it is one of the best jar sauce out there on the market.  So I mean if I love the jar sauce, then even if I am not eating at the original Rao's the carbon copy in Vegas has to be good, right?  Not exactly, the atmosphere was beautiful, we ate outside overlooking the Caesar pool, the sun was setting and it was really romantic.  They serve you warm crispy on the outside soft on the inside bread and have olive oil for dipping.  Love that!!  The wait staff was very friendly and really took the time to recommend some famous dishes.  OK so they serve family style, which means enough for two to four people to share.  Perfect.  So their are four of us, we order the fried mozzarella appetizer, two Caesar salads, side of meatballs, veal parm and one person who doesn't eat meat orders the pasta with red clam sauce.  The verdict...the mozzarella appetizers was good, sauce thick but not like my Rao's in the jar.  Weird I think...the Caesars classic.  The meatballs were so disappointing.  Rubbery and not flavorful.  Reminded me of the ones that you can buy in the frozen food isle of your local supermarket.  The veal parm wasn't that good either, the breading was too thick and the mozz wasn't melted enough, not enough sauce.  The pasta with red clam sauce looked good and they seemed to enjoy it all.  We didn't go for dessert so I can't comment on that, but they do have a store in the front of the restaurant where you can buy Rao's products and cookbooks.  Very cool, but we have this here.  OK so we met this woman who has been to the original Rao's and said that this one is just as good.  Well we had to disagree stating the sauce is nothing like the sauce in the jar, so get this.  She tells us that is because Rao's just uses their name and they do not make the sauce.  Who knew, but have to say that jar sauce is so damn good.  I didn't care who makes it.  So if you want Italian, want the hype that Rao's has become being unattainable in Manhattan then I would say sure make a reservation and enjoy the Vegas but hey you were forewarned.

PqIcfAzPaCkzE-i0UsYjwg.text: Came on a weekday night; there were plenty of seats at this location, no wait time. Service is friendly and efficient. Food isn't anything special however. If visiting Vegas, no need to go out of the way.

JBoF-CHj2403V6QSIcRNAg.text: We had a good meal. 1. We walked up without a reservation (=never happen in NY) 2. Pasta was cooked flawlessly. Flavors were balanced. Portion sizes were "very healthy" (and not small) 3. Service was timely, attentive given how busy they were. Nice staff. 4. Priced appropriately. Given that there are other places that charge several hundred bucks a person on the strip, Rao's pricing is commensurate with the food service/quality. Consistency is key.

53A54frvxQC85CiwPVpVSA.text: The absolute best place in vegas for italian food.  Where to begin?  At the beginning I suppose, right?  They make a pear and gorgonzola stuffed tortellini's that are the best.  Served in butter with pine nuts.  Wow.  Another winner is the "Pepperoni Arrostitti", which are Roasted Red Bell Peppers, Tossed with Golden Raisins and Pine Nuts.  Incredible.  The pasta is perfect.  I recommend the Orecchiette, because I like the idea of eating little ears, aside from the fact that its entirely delicious in san marzano tomato sauce.  As a main course, you have to try Uncle Vincent's Lemon Chicken.  Don't ask why, just try it and send me a thank you note later.    Another main course you need to try (but maybe not at the same sitting..  maybe) is the Pollo Scarpariello (Chicken Sauteed with Hot and Sweet Italian Sausage and Yellow and Red Bell Peppers in a White Wine Sauce).  Try it, send me a thanks later, same place.  The meatballs?  What does one say about perfection?  When I went there, the waiter brought us out a couple meatballs without us asking for them.  I said "We didn't order these".  He said "Try them.  You don't like them, they're on me."  Well, they were gone when he came back 20 minutes later to check on us.  Enough said.  The Italian Ricotta Cheese Cake is sweet, but not too sweet, as is the Cannoli.  Both go perfect with the coffee, espresso, or some anisette.  You really can't go wrong with this place.  And why is it decorated like Christmas all year round?  Because the previous owner one year decided to leave the decorations up after the holidays, and never took them down again (at the NYC location).  Its in tribute to him.    Oh, and if you see a huge ox of a man at the front, thats Tiny.  Say hi, but be nice.  The desert is a big place my friend.

rDJZ8TZs0Y7-V6k2ftUvdw.text: Avoid the osso bucco.  Quite dry   The Risotto that surrounding it was good, but that makes for pretty expensive Risotto. Sigh.  My third marginal meal at Rao's. Silly me.

-8HnqhL2iurECH9OvBCzHA.text: Horrible food & service!!!! Been dying to go to Rao's for ever and it was a big disappointment ! Food sucked and so did service. Waiter totally ignored us we haf to tell the busboy twice to call him just to place an order!!!  Would give it zero!!! Stars

W1Mq-0VVLIoIn2d5gRBulw.text: 3.5 stars.  As I have not dined at the original Rao's in New York, I am uncertain of that restaurant's mood. The design of Rao's in Las Vegas resembles a steakhouse, a neighborhood bar, and an old family restaurant, with dark cherry walls, white table cloths, signed photographs on the walls, and a gaudy bar awkwardly situated in the middle of the dining space.   The selection of breads was uninteresting, but leavened by the intensely fruity, clear, beautiful olive oil at the table. The risotto with shrimp was a stellar rendition of the dish, though it released too many droplets of butter in the bowl as we lingered. The shrimp with spicy tomato sauce was visually stunning, with splashes of crimson gracing five gleaming tails, but the seafood was tough and slightly overcooked. And, the housemade sausage, traditionally but nicely seasoned, had a welcome, coarsely ground texture, but could not enliven its accompanying orecchiette and broccoli rabe.   However, the service was impeccable, and the wine pours were generous. Sigh.

H36a-RoRhWtPqz8npj0Xfg.text: This place was fantastic. We came for the Caesars buffet but line was way too long. The bruschetta was phenomenal and the meatballs and shells were amazing. This is coming from someone who eats Italian food in South Philly. We will def visit again.

sd934Et3QkUDUl0NvYYZ6A.text: I had no idea about the history of the original Rao's when I came here with a group of people for dinner, though one in our party - the one who had tried fruitlessly for years to eat at the original one - was kind enough to tell us about the famed sauce and meatballs.   Since he was the one with all the expectations, seeing him finally eat the meatballs and the enormous veal parmesan and not be underwhelmed was nice, as high expectations can ruin that dream meal.  The special seasonal pasta - purses with blue cheese, pears and cranberries in a sage butter sauce - was tasty, though the lemon chicken my friend ordered seemed to be *the* dish.  Our waiter was one of those old school guys, who'd been working at the high end restaurants in Vegas since the days of Frank and Sammy, and he certainly added to the ambiance, since the schizophrenic music selection (Christmas, Motown and a bit of Italian thrown in for measure) didn't do much.  And outside a small misunderstanding on the wine order where the sommelier gal opened up a bottle about 4x the price of the one we ordered, it was enjoyable, if a bit overpriced for the food and ambiance.  But hey, it's Vegas, right?

SeSwlRVgJ6ynNfMh0WPzBA.text: Super delicious. My boyfriend and I split the penned vodka, four seasons pizza, and both had a dirty belvedere martini. They split up the food we had so we didn't have to do it ourselves. Our waiter was awesome and very attentive. Loved it!

miPmIekicWWuA5Lvzhz9vA.text: Had a good meal here.  They were able to accommodate a group of 10 in need of an accessible table without issue.  The food was good, the numerous teeny biscottis in the biscotti dessert assortment were adorable and tasty, the wait staff was attentive, even the manager strolled through and was checking on every table to make sure people were having a good experience.  He spent a few minutes joking with us and it was great.    The atmosphere was classy but had a vague undercurrent that had a bit of mafia-gangster/Rat Pack type of feel, but that's the undercurrent of atmosphere I had been expecting throughout Caesar's anyway.    Overall, we had a good time, enjoyed the food and service, and would return.

w_gBJyuMYaKw7Bn6c75IOg.text: Do you think making garlic bread is a big deal? Well here at Rao's it Is.the chef refuses to make it what? Is it to difficult? Why go to a restaurant  were they won't  accommodate the customer?  Never has this happened!  Plus this restaurant food is no big deal I will. Never  go back Rao's good job making a customer happy!

dtjiDKklogPpZ_hE8KXRuw.text: First Class Italian.  My wife and I recently dined at Rao's. The atmosphere is very cool! Additionally, the large bar area is fun for drinks before dinner (killer by-the-glass wine list). Regarding the food, the chicken scarpiello, seafood salad, and pasta bolognese were perfect!  Note: the owner, Frank Jr., is a really nice guy. He works the room and seemed genuinely interested in our having a good experience. A real pro.  JB

JEtP0N07d77wzcCD9XHG5g.text: Excellent American Italian cuisine. Great service, wine list and the food, of course. Try the antipasta plate. Pricey-always worth the trip.

vzI1dFf5_Np3ZZzAmJBebg.text: We have been to Rao's 3 times in the past 5 years. Each  time thinking it must be better this time. Well, we were wrong! This was the worst dining experience ever. Even on Restaurant Week, really!? The corkage for 2 bottles of wine was $75! The special salmon in almond sauce was swimming in clarified butter with no taste, no sauce. The other 3 in our party ordered lemon chicken. (Don't!) What they got was  a big plate of chicken pieces, with barely a touch of lemon flavor ....nothing else. The $35 plate of mixed vegetables were extra and that translated to a plate of eggplant slices that no one touched. No one finished their meal. Total tab $250 + tip which my husband regretted.

UePljHn8BX1iz1OSG9Sd7w.text: Its always Christmas Raos !! Outstanding food and atmosphere. Frank Pellegrino Jr has got it dialed in. the food is always delicious. Best veal parmesan you will ever have in your life and the meatballs are absolutely a slice of heaven. When you eat in this restaurant it's like going to your moms house and eating the portions are huge and they are just absolutely delicious.

qE-hiq7lwnMxr84wO9uDVw.text: We FINALLY tried this place without going to NY! One of the best Italian place I've had! All four dishes were fantastic!

O3_CzzYtHk1BSMHu4d-anQ.text: Both the meals and the service were quite good at this restaurant.  We started with their cesar salad, which, in our opinion was good, not great due to the dressing.  However that's just our personal preference.  My wife had the Veal Marsala and I had their excellent lemon chicken.  It's definitely lemony, but very tasty.  The veal was also quite good - we've had better, but I certainly would not turn it down.  it's all alla carte so the price can add quickly, like most upscale Vegas restaurants.  If our meals were an example of the quality of their food I would give Rao's a try if you enjoy Italian.

H0YNnM5vF6ev66-PI9sGxQ.text: I would have given it a 2 star but the staff seems to believe its own "bs".  Besides being more than overpriced, the food was tasteless.  The parmigiana cheese on the Caesar salad was like eating a church wafer, the shrimp in the scampi was like eating old bread when you have a head cold.  This restaurant needs to go back to the basics and start over with a new chef.  It was terrible, don't mind paying for good food, paying for this insulted me..

B4xgLafTfbhFrk7QPkNSqw.text: Greatly disappointment. Caesar salad was limp with flavorless dressing. Veal was nothing special. Meatballs are huge, but only average. Christmas decorations still up... And it's March already. Noisy.

8ozxx6Uc7MXoh4tiOF6rqA.text: My wife and I have visited Rao's several times and were pleased again with what we had. It always seems to be a struggle getting a table here although I am not sure how happy they are just to seat two people who want to dine without a reservation. For the first time we were seated on the patio which was fine although our server was a little slow and not so attentive. The Caprese salad appetizer was good (great fresh mozzarella) although the tomato's werent too tasty. The pasta dishes we both had were very good and once our server found out we were locals, he managed to deliver a special desert on the house as it was our anniversary. A nice way to finish a pretty good meal.

ONxORPKz3OH8SwmL9cZ1EQ.text: Great food and atmosphere. Nice to get away from the loudness that is every other restaurant on the strip. Pasta is brought out and served fresh at the table. Will definitely be coming back when we're back in Vegas

hjCNA4rYawOgcZJWHZPDRg.text: Very tasty food and excellent service. I enjoyed the setting and ambience as well. Waiters were very attentive, menu is well thought out with lots of customizations available for steaks. Look forward to returning.

78A9UBSq5TgsgREjwutX2Q.text: Nothing special especially with the high prices. Noise level inside ridiculous. Service so so. Canaletto at Venetian so much better.

xd6FYciD_NqtLs2oNxleNA.text: Overview: Rao's was pretty good. Good New York style Italian. Not trying to do anything too fancy, for those of you who enjoy Classic Italian without a crazy twist. Although I will say that this place is totally overpriced. You could get just as good Italian food somewhere else for much less. But you won't be disappointed.   Vodka Penne: This was so good! Sometimes vodka sauces can be way too creamy and this one was the perfect balance between creamy and acidity. I think the pasta is all made in-house too, at least some of it is. And it's all really good.   Shrimp Scampi: Oh my goodness. I wish I could eat this every night forever. Out of all the meals I tried, this one was the best. Their shrimp were big, super meaty and had great flavor. The scampi sauce was the best I've ever had, and I make a mean scampi at home, so that's saying something. I recommend getting it with angel hair pasta. Super delicious. You have to try it.   Eggplant Parmesan: So this was the only thing we ordered that was just okay. I've had many eggplant parmesans in my life, so it's hard to find one that soars above the others. I think my issue was that it was a little bland and not crispy. Eggplant Parmesan needs to have a little crunch because of the natural sogginess of eggplant. This didn't really have it. Something that was good was the eggplant slices were really thick and there was a delicious layer of browned, melted cheese. Gotta love that cheese.   The salmon was also fantastic and very unique. Other favorites were the Steak Pizzaiola, and the Veal Parmesan.   I would say if you are a huge Italian fan, give it a try. It's definitely worth the trip if you are willing to spend a little more.

Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veal Parmesan
Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vodka penne. Super yummy.

3ADzNRjtp6WOqAjlwfw0qw.text: Had been to Rao's a couple of years ago and the experience then was so great decided to go again.  I will agree that it can be a little pricey but believe me you get what you pay for.  The food was incredible.  Ordered meatballs as appetizer; then salad and then entree.  Dessert was something else again.  Our food server, Jovann, did make us feel as if we were his guests.  His recommendations were spot on.  Could not have been more pleased with everything.   This will be a restaurant of choice the next time I visit.

_Sgh7xEuMFoRkFitN2thAw.text: Pretty disappointed.  2/6/2019 we ate at Raos Restaurant in Caesars Palace in Las Vegas, NV.  The Veal used in the veal picatta had a refrigerator taste, as if it had been unthawed and sitting in the frig AWHILE.  Certainly not fresh.  All in all the meal for two  was $180.  Service was good, but the food was very disappointing.  We will not be returning!  There's lots of excellent restaurants in Vegas and this is NOT ONE OF THEM!

fA-eHOD-Q6BE_5RcM45mfA.text: The same server was way more pleasant.  The mozzarella "sandwichs" were partially cold.  Excellent chicken piccata and meatballs (as always).  Nice quiet atmosphere.

9_RDfSqzxpb7bdr4O0oBnQ.text: Really good Italian food, with fantastic, fresh pasta. The service was friendly and fast. It's a bit noisy, but otherwise a great time!

bssIjmrXphjRGTOJZiiVIA.text: Fantastic food! From the fresh bread, the antipasto and the entrees! Oh, and our waiter was knowledgeable and really had a passion for the food he was describing to us. This is our second meal at Rao's and it has been great both times!

photos.caption: Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jOpbeabMZJf40gub8vWcgg.text: My friend saw this place on the Food Network or something and suggested we check it out during our most recent trip to Las Vegas.  I was down...being half Italian I'm always down for Italian food!!! One thing I don't like to do is make reservations for dinner while on vacation...I like to have my places picked out where I want to eat, but it's really hard to follow a set schedule/itinerary.  Based on that I suggested we just go here early to eat dinner, around 5 after they open.  That idea worked out great.  We came in on a Monday night shortly after they opened and we were seated promptly - no problems there.  For starters you get a bread basket with a tomato flavored dip which was really good along with these huge cheese flavored crisps.  The wine list wasn't the most expensive I've seen in Vegas, but wasn't the cheapest either.  Our server was able to recommend a wine that paired great with the penne vodka I ordered.  For starters we ordered the meatballs... pretty big in size, and reminded me a lot of the meatballs my Grandma used to make.  My dinner was the Penne Vodka - and added sausage to it for the added protein as pasta alone won't fill me up.  This wasn't your usual vodka sauce which is super creamy...it was much better than that.  I was pleasantly filled at the end of my meal but left just enough room to share the angel food cake for dessert - sugar free, fat free, and gluten free so ... a little less guilt there!  This place was great all around...great food, atmosphere, and service.  I highly recommend coming here for dinner!

photos.caption: Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dTKGNowzmpKutg94OCX5jg.text: The bread and cheese to start have been amazing! And I really like that they have the oil and pepper for your bread on the table ready for you to set up yourself. Yes I love it because it's the perfect amount of pepper I want so it's perfect. The waiter has been great and the ambience is amazing!! Love this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9L4SfwVn5V37atpsFt8Z0A.text: I like good meatballs. Rao's is famous for that. Their New York location is always busy and they say the best way to try Rao's is by going to this location.  We tried the lasagna and the meatballs. We had a show to go to so we let them know ahead of time that we're a bit pressed on time. The service wasn't all that great and they weren't even busy.  The lasagna was good but nothing special. The meatballs were huuuuuge and tasty. I won't mind coming back for these balls but I'd probably take them to-go so, I don't have to deal with the service.

photos.caption: Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lasagna
Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meatballs

d-GbJXHJ5hwLtchRvV3gYg.text: I like Rao's overall, but loved the Beef Lasagna.   Places in vegas have become relatively overpriced. I think it has something to do with Casino's winning less? But, RAO has great food and I'd still consider it a good value.

D-1P0G2V-9Km_qRw6DO6zQ.text: The atmosphere and our service was lovely and excellent ! Our waiter "Jerry " was working his first evening and was exceptional, pleasant, attentive and friendly. Our meals of our meat lasagna and the shrimp scampi were awesome. Couldn't finish. The appetizer of mozzarella and greens and roasted  peppers on crostini delicious!! Terrifico!!

x-GOFqd_eOQQcVorFuIfLA.text: As a renowned traveler and food critic it takes a lot to impress me after all there is a lot of competition out there...  today took me by surprise... - everything seemed like a total shambles at first until the spaghetti Bolognese arrived.  They NAILED it  The wine list is a roos. Scientifically engineered to gouge you in the wallet.   Gee I wonder what the corkage fee is now that I'm thinking about it!   The only reason I dropped the star is because of the minefield wine list.

HwLx45J2qxjs66UfqybEkA.text: I was told to come here and get the meatball. I don't get it. It was like McDonald's hamburger meat with some Prego on top. It was gross. I felt sick for a day after my encounter with the gross meatball.  On the plus side the service was excellent.

CsjpQRd3XGbbGURjYcrfKA.text: Excellent old-school Italian, with a great wait staff and the best meatballs i have ever tasted. The bruschetta was amazing.  Is a bit pricey, but worth the experience! I would recommend making a reservation.

photos.caption: Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Taglioline with peas and prosciutto in a creamy parm sauce...
Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spaghetti
Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Homemade bread

eUq6tb7yhSHrU112iUd3yg.text: As usual the atmosphere and meal were exceptional.  The waiter was great and the service wonderful.  Highly recommend.  You can't go wrong.

cwVxa31-Pxpy8xPEYns77Q.text: If I could give this place zero stars, I would. What a lousy excuse for a supposedly famed Italian eatery. The flavorless mussel soup was laughably minus mussels, and the entrees were so burned that our bill was significantly reduced. Can anyone tell me how chicken parmigiano is served with pasta, but the veal is not? What does it cost to add a little pasta - 25 cents?  And an Italian restaurant without minestrone soup, or any other soup, other than the aforementioned mussel soup without mussels?  Not to mention there was no old school Italian ambience - evidenced by them playing Rod Stewart in his heyday - oh puhleeze, don't get me started. Compliments to the manager for expediently addressing the issues. My partner a world-traveled foodie, and me, being European, can honestly say we have had a better experience at Olive Garden. This is a lousy representation of an Italian restaurant. But, this is Vegas. Fake is the name of the game.

photos.caption: Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

g370LcekU3ZOEZx62wooNg.text: Don't waste your time here. Pasta is overcooked, risotto is overcooked, the seafood is from the frozen section in the local supermarket! A complete disappointment. Nothing Italian about this place!

HVYJNcOos-Yhz9hnfI2oSg.text: Our company had numerous dinners in Las Vegas and one of the groups went to Rao's. There were 65 of us. We had a private room set up in the back. My fiance is a CIA chef and owns restaurants in the VA-DC-MD states. Coordinating large groups while still taking care of other customers is truly a delicate balancing  act and one that requires a lot of coordination, skill and talent from the servers to the chefs.    We had a predetermined menu with incredible menu items. All the food was served family style with one of the courses already plated.   As a vegetarian who does eat fish, Our table was asked in advance about dietary needs so they could bring out an additional item for me. I was so impressed with the service and the quality of food. Our tables never lacked for anything and we had wonderful wines and beers served throughout the dinner -9 bottles of The Prisoner, 8 bottles of Robert Mondavi Winery Merlot and 8 bottles of Ruffino Pinot Grigio.   The food came out hot and everything was delicious! Truly a fantastic experience-  the entire restaurant was packed when we got there for our 8 o'clock reservation.   By the time dessert came, I knew I was too full to eat anything. As soon as the dessert sampler was set down though... I ate a mini cheesecake that was perfectly chilled and an incredible chocolate dessert.  Five stars to the staff and the kitchen!

-ibPSD5_2yYqDlo9jqvMAg.text: Welll.... this place is ordinary and expensive for what you get... I guess the rent has to be paid!   Nothing to write home about!   Our waiter Gerardo was very good and attentive so an A for service.  The portions are huge but I think they should concentrate more on the quality than the quantity!   The baked clams were tiny! Flavor was ok! Would I come back here???.....    hmmmmmm.... NO!  Many other places in Vegas with much better food for the money!   Sorry RAO!

wLzZdJ7J6rwiAOuNrWFcmA.text: This was a rough start to our first night in Las Vegas trip. I'm a big Rao's fan as far as their cookbooks.  I think I have almost all of them.  I even have a signed one from Frank Senior.  Not signed for me but someone else named Alex. Got it on Amazon : )  We got a nice booth as requested.  Bread delivered to table but not the cool bread basket I see on even recent Yelp pics.  Just some unheated sliced bread.  Okay.  Our waiter was good.  He really tried to make our evening nice.  I asked him about the free New Yorker Martini if you check in on Yelp.  He didn't know anything about it.  Then I checked in and no offer came up.  I kinda felt a little stupid. Thanks for taking away the promotion.  Okay.  We ordered a half order of their world famous not to be believed fucking fantastic meatballs.  It was fine.  Maybe a little mushy.  We both agreed I make better meatballs on any given Sunday night.  Not bad, just not worth all the glorious hype.  I've been looking forward to their Veal Parmesan for weeks now.  Staring at the posted Yelp pictures like some kinda food pervert.  It looked good on arrival but soon found out it was overcooked, not much flavor, and not much marinara sauce.  I asked for a child's portion of Spaghetti with marinara.  That was dry and I got dinged $13.00 for it.    I ate a little less than half and sent it back.  Just not good and no way worth $53.00.  The waiter took it off the bill. My wife ordered the Frutti di Mare seafood pasta.  The seafood was cooked perfectly but the sauce was so hot she did not enjoy her food and just ate the seafood.  For the record she likes spicy food.  This was crazy hot.  Our waiter trying to salvage the evening brought over some Tiramisu at no charge.  It was good.  Rao's is a one and done for us.

photos.caption: Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiramisu was comp&#39;ed for the poor entrees. This was appreciated and the only saving grace of the night.
Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Frutti di Mare.  Wife said the seafood was cooked perfectly.  The sauce was off the Scoville scale and she likes spicy food.  Not good.
Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I ordered a half order of Spaghetti with marinara to go with my Veal Parm.  Dry pasta, and not much sauce.  Only $13.00! Ouch.

8jAS5n3zM_8c4ay2BzcgRw.text: I always stop in for happy hour when in Vegas. They have happy hour prices at the bar and appetizers too.  Check out the hours and days as Im not sure if it's always the same. I love the food especially their meatballs! They will pack them up to go In case you wanna "fly" some home. It's a must for me

photos.caption: Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meatballs with cheese- can they get any better??
Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious meatballs
Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sitting at the bar

TuORKGwERXKE3EOHGPiw0g.text: This restaurant is located inside beautiful Caesar's Palace. They have delicious Italian food, a great atmosphere and the staff were great! Their fried green tomato caprese is delicious!Suggestions: Make a reservation   Ambience: Very dim but intimate.  Dress Code: Dressy casual or business casual, smart causal.

photos.caption: Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried green tomato app

O6cSleuBSM7qgtIJF39Zqw.text: The server brought soft ciabatta and crispy Italian flat bread with roasted red pepper, ricotta and herb butter with shallots .   They served us a hearty Pink Lentil Bean Soup that was absolutely delicious and a Cesar Salad that was big enough to split between two people--and they split it for you.  I ordered the Sundried Tomato Chicken Penne tossed in a roasted garlic light cream sauce. It wasn't too heavy, but they served a lot of it--which if you have access to a fridge you certainly would want to take this with you.  Large pieces of Maine lobster meat, clams, and snow crab claws topped the lovely Frutti Di Mare my friend had. The meat fell out of the shells with ease and melted in the mouth. A hint of spice was in the background--not spicy to those that like it HOT; it was just right. My friend raved about how fresh and delicious it was.  Johnny Double Scoops was our server. Great personality; very attentive; excellent service.  I definitely would come here again.

Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pink Lentil Bean Soup
Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sundried Tomato Chicken Penne

8WorsN1QdlDPf_UF5g3m8g.text: While staying at Caesar's Palace, I went to dinner here one night with my mother. We didn't plan on having Italian, but we are sure glad we did! It felt like an actual authentic Italian place located in the heart of the strip. Everything on their menu sounded great. I got the crab carbonara and it was so rich and creamy. I loved it. And it was topped with a crab claw. My mother got chicken parmigiana and it was a hearty helping! We also split two meatballs and they were the size of my fist. Great food. Can't go wrong. It is Vegas, so it is pricey but it's worth it.

7ZGmDpvgm6Qie6KfEu9fmw.text: Great service but some off the food was a little on the salty side. The chicken marsala was dry and tough but my osso bosco was good but a tad salty. Baked clams was nothing special but the steamed clams were good. My kids loved the meatballs. Waiter was on point and friendly so I'll give them 4 stars from 3.
