Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Not good

YK3hM2glXLSONeQZ-rUYYw.text: Odds are that I'll never be able to eat at the original Rao's in NYC since it's small and fairly exclusive,  but the Rao's in Las Vegas in Caesers was pretty amazing.  The place was sprawling,  and packed on the Sunday night that we went, glad I made reservations.  Great atmosphere as well, very dark and away from the noise of the casino.  Highly recommend the lasagna, it was actually pretty pretty perfect for what my definition of what old school American style Italian red sauce cooking should taste like.  We shared the creme brulee for desert,  and it was also quite tasty.  There is fantastic food all over Vegas, and most of it overpriced,  but this was worth it.

0GbDdjVvNjmkCrqZ4a6Djw.text: We waited about 30 minutes for a party of 8 on a Monday night. We ordered sauteed clams for appetizers and I ordered the crab carbonara. Clams were over cooked but the white sauce was delicious. We also ordered a side of meatballs. It was very juicy and tender. The crab carbonara was delicious, but I didn't taste enough crab. I think a little more crab will make this dish a little more special than what it was.

photos.caption: Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab carbonara
Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Side of meatballs

0txffDD1YwxGzrofSYRajA.text: I have been going to Raos for over 10 years, and have always enjoyed excellent service, but the service last night was terrible.  Our server Howard, was inattentive, slow, and disorganized.  Items were delivered out of order, People in our party of 10 were ignored, and the bill was inaccurate.  A meal that should've taken an hour and a half, took over two hours.  We will be back, but we will ask for a different server.

m7O6DcxEqioxcgQD09j5Vw.text: Ok so this is my second time coming here, first time was about 10 years ago. It was good back then but I really don't remember what I ordered. So tonight my husband and I came and omg let me tell you the meal was amazing! We first ordered the meatballs and they are hands down the best meatballs I've ever had. I ordered the penne vodka and the first bite was so delicious and each bite I took was more and more amazing as the one before (I am drooling just thinking about it!)I wish I didn't fill up on the meatballs and bread so I could have eaten every last bite of my plate (I took the leftovers back to the room) and yes it was even delicious heated up lol.  My husband ordered the chicken parmigiana which was also delicious he got the New Yorker to drink and he said it was good, I don't drink so i ordered the pink lemonade. I would highly recommended coming here when you visit Vegas

LaRK809sV0C9e-l14hpcZg.text: I've eaten at Raos a few times over the years. As always, I left full and happy. Our waiter was beyond nice and professional. He made suggestions for us both on wine and meal. Meatball appetizer is the best. Huge meatballs and tasty sauce. The penne vodka was a perfect portion for two.  Expect to spend a little dough at Raos as it isn't cheap, but it's worth the splurge.   Their sauce is sold in grocery stores on the east coast and I highly recommend that as well. Since buying it, I haven't gotten any other sauce.

photos.caption: Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread for days

NFjJru45ICgiktqFW3jHzA.text: This place is very hit or miss. The restaurant is located in Caesar's Palace but is set up as a restaurant with an "outside" dining area. The meatballs are great, order them with a side of ricotta cheese. Crab carbonara was my favorite. Great service and the cheese cake was the best I've ever had. The server was attention and made sure we were able to get out in time for our show.

l1Q2Sc_-_5mH_0a7Cwzk1A.text: Came here because Bacchanal had a long wait and Rao's was able to seat us within 15 minutes.   We were seated on the patio area and they give you complimentary bread and some crackers as an appetizer which is nice.   After the bread though is where everything went downhill.   Our food took an hour which is crazy for pasta and it wasn't even busy. They also got our orders wrong and when we told them that they gave us the wrong pasta, they were able to get out a new order in less than 1 minute...  How is that possible that we waited an hour for our food to initially come out but they were able to get us a fresh order of pasta within a minute?   Worst part was, our waiter didn't apologize and then proceeded to say that he fixed it when in actuality, he just gave us what we ordered.   Food was also meh. Pasta sauce tasted bottled and they also only have penne, spaghetti, linguine and angel hair.  Pasta isn't fresh and neither is the sauce :(

wqqnvTfUWNPuA4cEUHDlwg.text: Our experience at Rao's was a really great one! Our server, Rebecca has been at that location since the opening and you could tell because she REALLY knows her stuff. I wish we could have gone with more people because I wanted to try a lot more food! We have been cooking from the Rao's Cookbooks for years and have been trying to get into the NYC location for just as long but unsuccessfully.   I'm giving them a STRONG four stars because the service and location were exceptional but there were some small missteps along the way. I think we really wanted it to live up to the hype hype hype and it fell the smallest bit short. The strong points were, service, wine selection, location and even the price point. Rebecca really knew her stuff and she was extremely friendly.  We started the meal with a split caesar's salad... in caesar's palace I died. The flavor was so delicious but maybe a little over dressed but as far as a caesar salad goes, it was bomb. We also had a delicious barolo. We decided to order a half portion of the ravioli purses, the veal chop with the cherry peppers and my mom lovessss spahetti and meatballs lol so that's what she got. I really wanted to try the sauce from Uncle Vincent's Lemon Chicken so they brought me a little side dish of it and I LIVED FOR IT. If you love lemon, you gotta order it.   The ravioli purses were our favorite, they have a sage butter sauce that is so yummmmm. The spaghetti and meatballs was sadly a little bit cold but the meatball was bomb, velvety smooth and delicious. The spaghetti was a little lack luster but TBH I wouldn't have ordered it with someone else. The veal chop was perfectly cooked but I wanted the style to be more saucy? I can't explain but it wasn't what I expected...   We got the cheesecake for dessert, it was a waste of calories. Kyma in New York has the best cheesecake I've ever had and nothing has even touched it since.   Overall would recommend and return just may order differently! Thank you Rebecca for the awesome service!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. bread basket, free of charge
Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. caesar salad

Vp9xCAb943xHfGVEGZUh8w.text: Overall it wasn't bad but I didn't think it was anything special. Meatball is the only dish I thought it was excellent. Rest of dishes were just ok.   It just didn't meet my expectation. I feel like I could've gone to another restaurant for better food because Vegas is just full of so many good restaurants.

photos.caption: Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baked clams
Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood pasta
Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meatball

nWdhBCaMziB9CG0RP2ZGfA.text: 4 stars Because I'm still dreaming of their lemon chicken and lasagne. I guess it's a hit or miss and that night was a hit. Yay me. The service was impeccable. Because I live in Hawaii I buy their marinara sauce and made an unbelievable spicy sausage and tomato bisque soup that a friend said If you bottled this I would drink it from the bottle. Without further ado here is the recipe:  Hot Italian sausage browned on the stove  Couple minced garlic  Some chopped onions (optional) 1 bottle rao's marinara sauce Fill raos bottle with water and add to soup 1 can tomato paste  1 T Lea and perrons worsterchire sauce  1 qt heavy whipping cream Roughly 3 T sugar depending on tomato paste taste after 2 T add more to your liking 1 pinch of Hawaiian salt optional  Enjoy greatness dance

xbPkgBXEytzZIIzLg6la8Q.text: Had it been another server than the crabby old lady we had, perhaps we would've stayed longer. We couldn't even enjoy our food. It was very apparent she was pushing to make her tip money for the night. She was relentless on pushing the wine menu and about $25 per glass I can see why.   It's Vegas, tons of other options to choose from so why not?!

yV2Hol_AKmdq1AI6IaepZA.text: Overpriced for the quality of food.  My fiancee and I don't drink alcohol and got attitude from the server because we ordered nonalcoholic drinks. So dissatisfied.  :^(

LIapbCMGTHkDfbY7tbQz8Q.text: Best meatballs ever. The pear and cheese ravioli in the butter sage sauce was also amazing

DV3ZYzqgOdPQyifKTYySIA.text: Had dinner with the family this past weekend.. everyone enjoyed there meal so much that we went back for happy hour the next day! I suggest trying breunello di montalcino, this wine went perfectly with dinner!

GQOcSrrS4u1gpgZHkAQTLw.text: Everything was amazing. The best meatballs I have ever had. Also ordered the shrimp fra diavolo, the diavolo sauce was outstanding and even my friends with me at dinner stole multiple tastes of the sauce. Definitely a must if you ate looking for Italian in Vegas.

IXOP7mw8maJOtfsNldxdrw.text: I am giving Rao's 4 stars because the service was amazing (thanks John) and I was able to order something not on the menu and have it executed beautifully.  Is the food inspired?  Not really.  The portions are generous and flavorful.  The caprese salad with buratta was fresh and served with a nice balsamic vinaigrette and basil.  I was sorry we shared!  The fried green tomato caprese was good too, though the fresh was better.  My nephew ordered glorified Mac and cheese (Quattro formaggi)... OMG - best Mac and cheese ever, so rich you will have leftovers, but not greasy. I wanted frutti de mare and it wasn't on the menu.  But I noticed the ingredients for it on other items.  So I asked the waiter and he and the chef easily accommodated it.  The calamari was fork tender, the shrimp plump and the clams in the shell were all open.  Go for yummy Northern Italian and portions that will yield leftovers.  Relax with great service and hopefully, great conversation.

S2zKA8S9iS-ptKJi6ltWvQ.text: Avoid the eggplant parm.  Was so over cooked it was like a crispy pancake- had to send it back for another dish...just a bowl of spaghetti- nothing special. Someone else had the clams linguini and said it was good.

photos.caption: Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

aVfAaTUSwvEkyZZisYRDMw.text: We enjoyed our dinner but for what we paid I don't know if it was worth it. On top of that the service was mediocre at best. When I'm paying 15 dollars a glass for wine that really costs 15 dollars a bottle, you could at least be an amazing server, our server wasn't amazing. We ordered the mussels.....to which they were out of mussel's.....we got the clams.....not that great....I don't love clams though. I then had the eggplant Parmesan and my husband had a chicken dish with onions and peppers. Our entree's were good but I don't know if it was worth the price though.

8SIeHj2mvjF3x_2E4JvpOQ.text: Went to restaurant because I saw a show where Gordon Ramsey recommended it.... Wr were extremely disappointed. Over-priced for the quality of food provided. There is better tasting food at the street vendors. We had lamb chops and lemon chicken. Both were gravely disappointed to say the least. Will never return. :(

Hxk_engp2v6aIO-An1LGLQ.text: Can't say enough about this jewel!!!  How lucky was I to have participated in the grand opening. Was introduced to the owners, chefs, and the main gatekeeper... The man that allows you to make reservations!!!  We became best friends (due to the fact I was an Executive Casino Host at Caesars) and never did I have a problem getting a table.  The food is perfect, the entrees are amazing, their customer service is outstanding.

dFbkMyC8Pyxk20Nyc6ssLg.text: I love visiting Rao's when I'm in Vegas! It's kind of got a movie like ambience which is neat, the staff are awesome, and the meatballs are to die for!! Great all around historically on my visits. Make sure you get reservations in advance though because it does fill it pretty quickly.

6PCnplHPgfTinFWWV5E92Q.text: Rao's in New York City is notorious.  It is not clear how good their food actually is since no one is able to get a reservation at the restaurant.  Seriously, the wait is measured in terms of years, and at the end of the day, they primarily serve pasta like most any other Italian restaurant in the city.  In Las Vegas, it is a different story.  One can freely walk into the restaurant with the hope of actually getting a table.  Short of that, a seat at the bar is almost always guaranteed.  I believe the menu is the same, and the owner was at the restaurant on my visit, so I felt like I was able to have roughly the same experience as I would in New York if I had somehow managed a reservation.  I ordered the gnocchi bolognese and had a glass of Montepulciano.  The dinner began with a bread course served with a plate of olive oil and vinegar.  I was happy with this beginning with the tasty bread and the good quality olive oil.  The gnocchi were beautifully presented simply dressed in a deep dish.  I had an impressive amount of pasta before me, and the gnocchi were not heavy at all.  I thought the texture was great.  The sauce was very flavorful and balanced.  Simple and good, exactly what I wanted.  The wine paired well.  More generally, I was pleased to have a nice selection of Italian wines available by the glass.    The restaurant itself was fairly busy and very dynamic.  The interior is dark and nearly every square inch of the walls was decorated with photos of the celebrities who have visited.  I know that can be kind of cheesy, for example at the Carnegie Deli, but here I was getting more of a Minetta Tavern kind of feel.  I think this location of Rao's is a wonderful place to have a glass of wine and a plate of pasta.  It definitely gets my vote over places like B and B Ristorante which charges far more for less.  Recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GAPqam0tz4yOVCP_GfDLEg.text: Since LA doesn't have a Little Italy this is the closest we could get to it in Las Vegas!  Wow is all I have to say from the fresh calamari, to the hefty meatballs that if you could imagine an Italian grandma could be making in the kitchen in the back.  The sauces were rich and flavorful with not a lot of butter.   If you are craving authentic Italian then this is your place...Fugedaboutit!

huKaEiAz5Ws3bRvEQKC2Dg.text: Wow is covered! Not only was the food over the top but the service was world class. PLEASE see Nick and give him control of your meal. It will be unforgettable.  Thanks Nick and team Rao's!!

h9m3zGC3evNBaCsgyyYmag.text: Birthday Vegas Trip: 4/3 - 4/9, 2013 Man, I really wanted to like this place.  Given the hype and exclusivity of the NY location, I thought it a real treat to get a table at the Rao's in Caesar's.  It was the last night of our trip and we wanted to really celebrate.  The menu called to me, and I was psyched.  We sat "outside" in the tables meant to mimic NYC; a nice enough spot, and even the noise from the casino wasn't too distracting.  We were welcomed with bread and olive oil, all very delicious, and we ordered a bottle of Montepulciano. I started with the Roasted Beet Salad which, truth be told, was one of the reasons I really wanted to come.  It was tasty, but was loaded with way too much arugula and not enough of everything else.  There's not much worse than an uneven salad.  I knew the salad would fill me, so for my entree I ordered the Baked Clams.  Again, I so wanted them to be good and they just were not.  Way too much filling, which had little flavor.  My fiance's Spaghetti Alla Bolognese was truly delicious, however.  The sauce was rich and had layers of meaty flavor.  We both enjoyed that!  Again, we skipped dessert because there wasn't much on the menu that was a 'must-order'.  The service was pleasantly acceptable, nothing of note, until it was time for the check.  Our server brought us the check and it was not ours, not realizing until she ran the credit card.  The charge stayed on our card for a few days, which was a definite inconvenience.  Unfortunately, (and it pains me to say this!) several times during the meal, I found myself wishing that we'd gone across the way to the Bacchanal Buffet.

xez-fut3pOKVx9yEbu6Gvg.text: My little taste of a famous New York Italian ristorante in Sin City! I'be become a regular. Thanks Robert and Mike for excellent service!

59YsXvehMhdU1d5TZA7Lbg.text: We had reservations and were seated promptly.  Service was excellent and the ambiance in the section in which we were seated was reminiscent of their NY location.  We split a Caesar Salad.  My wife ordered Oso Bucco and I ordered the Veal Piccata.  The portions were generous. HOWEVER, the food was at best average and definitely NOT worth the price.  There are much better alternatives for Italian food in Las Vegas.  I therefore cannot recommend Rao's Vegas Location

yTzHjbwxCA1H9L87BDIqeQ.text: Rao's has been one of the top dining experiences we've had in Vegas. The service was absolutely outstanding. Our server was exactly what you would expect to find in a New York Italian restaurant - like the Italian grandfather I never had. He was very knowledgeable about the menu, incredibly friendly (and a little grandfatherly), and anticipated needs before we could even ask.  The food was quite delicious. Definitely get the meatballs. Even if you don't usually care for meatballs (like me), get the meatballs. Probably some of the best meatballs you will ever have.  My standard Italian dish, which for me can make or break a restaurant, is penne vodka. And the penne vodka here was above and beyond. Penne vodka has been a favorite dish of mine since I lived in NYC - and Rao's, in my opinion, is the best place in Vegas for it.  Sadly, I never had the chance to eat at the original Rao's in NYC. It can be rather exclusive and quite difficult to get a table at. Vegas Rao's provides you the opportunity to experience the great food and service the original Rao's is known for, but without having to be a celebrity.

10W7nbbI8esUFwGyqipVXA.text: Raos is hands down one of my favorite spots in Vegas, I have no problem walking thru a casino to go either. The management and staff are amazing and the food is always spot on! From the minute I walk in I feel at home. Can't get any better!

scNjymQKRVzeRRuWNOVFTQ.text: Not to happy with this place, the Italian Saugages were the worst!  the Veal was really Good. thats where it ends. way over priced for the quality of food being served! much better places.

HobucNt9t9LXmDUgubUIJw.text: I guess Caesar's bankruptcy has hit everyone here hard. I've been several times but having gone on Friday, I noticed the quality of food and service have dramatically decreased. The bread was good but had to ask for butter and vinegar twice. The waitress made a mistake not once but twice, trying to deliver wine to our table that we didn't order. The lasagna was ok but the sauce was bland at best.

q8iV5N7r8mJUVM--xa8IWw.text: If you are going to Rao's you should expect a excellent and filling meal. The decor is definitely old style Italian and matches the food. Healthy sized portions to say the least. We started with the Beet Salad, Stuffed Clams and Red Peppers. All three are recommended. For main course we had the Veal Parmigiana and Meatballs. By far the best bone in veal parm I have ever had and the meatballs complemented it perfectly. At this point we were so fully but we could not pass up dessert.  We had the Tiramisu and the Canolis. All I can say to both is wow. The perfect way to finish off an old style Italian meal. The servers were on point and very attentive. The check in process was very pleasant even though it was very busy. Great filling meal!

TS_Hc2-_gyiG0MOf-ZyMXw.text: While on vacation in the beautiful Las Vegas we decided to eat at Raos. It was super close to our hotel and had really great reviews. While entering the decor is nice and sets a good mood. I started with a strawberry spiritz which was okay. Pretty basic drink it had strawberries, vodka, lemon sour and sparking soda. My boyfriend and I split the caprese salad and it was so good. The tomatoes were very fresh and cheese was so rich and creamy. For our main course I got the stuffed ricotta shells. They were cooked to a perfect al dente. The tomato ricotta sauce had just the right amount of acidity and creamy texture. For dessert I ordered the tiramisu. It was near perfection. The coffee flavor was prevalent but not over powering. The mascarpone cream was so silky smooth. The whole bite was just perfect. All the flavors meddled together harmoniously.   With all that being said and the food being absolutely perfect the reason for the two stars was unfortunately due to the service. The service here was sub par at best. I know being young and being a waitress myself I understand the stigma with young people and how they do not tip a lot. With that being said I try to be mindful and try to tip well to break the stigma. Unfortunately this stereotype may have gotten to our waitress Angela. She was nice and sure she means well but she never checked in on us. She never checked if I liked my drink, she did not ask about our caprese or even our main course. The drink and appetizer I understand but not checking in on ones main course is something I find unacceptable. She would have gotten a nice tip if she had only checked on us. She managed to check on her other three tables right next to us multiple times but failed to even see how we were doing. Very disappointed how she could let our young appearance get to her. If we are dining at Raos and ordering drinks then we obviously have money. Too bad the service really lacked because the food was top notch.

1Aums7U68ENyYcOwqSa_sw.text: Absolutely amazing. I was visiting Las Vegas for my friend's 30th birthday and this was one stop that I recommended for dinner. I had the Taglioline with Peas & Ham that had Prosciutto Cotto, Sweet Peas, and Diced Shallots in a Light Cream Sauce and it was delicious! The assortment of bread that you get when you sit down is great! Fantastic texture and flavor!  You must order the meatballs! They were wonderful! The staff was great and offered a complimentary dessert for the birthday boy! We picked the ricotta cheese cake and it was fantastic as well!

tj9Gft0Sk2OS_3TUGLI7aA.text: Gross. Got food poisoning from Meatball and kale ceasar salad.  Will never eat again.

DuVu8aIuOW3rwa8AcT7QoQ.text: Favorite Italian in vegas by far. Traditional scare the best. Eggplant parm... delicious. Ceaser salad A++++. Never had a bad meal here, and service always fantastic

qditFvH_JcZEjsy_M8rT-A.text: They have great service, and nice atmosphere. But Man... What happened to the food?  It seems just really all pre-cooked, but I ordered the hardest thing on the menu to get right.. Eggplant Parm. . . so sad.. had to send it back, because My eggplant was not cooked. Ordered the linguini with clams in Red Sauce and it was just.. thick and clams were old.  Like there pasta, and meat sauces, just stay away from everything else I suppose?  mmmm. . . Next time, i'll wait in the long Buffet Line!

UmK0vKMMsy0ubpMS251www.text: In Vegas, it can be difficult to find a place to eat.  I'm drawn every which way, towards the fancy pants prix fixe menus, the over hyped celebrity restaurants, or the over the top buffets. I think I've found my favorite new way to dine.  Casual, comfort Italian food at Rao's.  The two of us shared the Chicken Scarparielo and the Garlic and Olive Oil Linguine, which was the perfect amount of food for two people.  The chicken was simple but so delicious. The dark meat chicken was seared then quickly sauteed with pickled pappadew peppers, onions, and bell peppers. The sharp vinegary bite of the peppers was so vibrant and added such a brightness.  Matched with the sweet peppers and onions, I was in love with the chicken.  The plainest pasta available was probably a tad oiler than I would have preferred, but it was meant as a pasta course not a base for my chicken.  It served it's purpose wonderfully though giving us a carb with which to enjoy our meal.   My only regret?  Not having room for their famed meatballs!

m3fzXOhtTGUvQz-PSX9m0A.text: Dining at Rao's was a pleasure. The service was extremely friendly and the restaurant clean and inviting.  We had the calamari for an appetizer. It was light and fresh and served with a great dipping sauce. The pasta was excellent, and the meat and seafood were well cooked.  The entire time we were eating, we couldn't stop gushing over how nice our waiter was, and how much we loved everything.  We can't wait to come back!

fwb-aBlEGDqTIouyzqPU6A.text: Rao's was again fabulous!! The meatballs are a must. For an appetizer we had the mixed seafood salad which was very good and I had the eggplant parmigiana for entire which was amazing!! Always a great eat in Vegas!!

-TtOz4eR8VWSkBGbVB3TTg.text: The house salad was crisp, plentiful, and full of variety. The atmosphere was elegant but noisy. I had asked to be moved to a separate room...and was re-seated without hesitation. The meat balls were delicious....my fork went threw it like butter...ask for oregano for the meat balls....you can't go wrong with a little hint of fresh oregano. The lemon chicken is a bit expensive but well worth it. It's organic and the bones aren't black (which would hint of being frozen). Split everything with someone else and you'll have a nice filling meal for around $70. Thank you guys I'll be back.

5eld1E5EYQkP1xxQJde5yA.text: I stopped by this italian restaurant in Caesar's Palace for a bite to eat after getting in.  There is some history about the original restaurant in NY and how a branch came to be located in Vegas.  I sat at the bar for dinner.  The service was fast and efficient.  The bartender was very prompt with drink refills and service.  I did not suffer any lack of attention for eating at the bar compared to a table.  The food was delivered fast.  It was hot and freshly made from what I could tell; I assume they have the components ready to go given the crowds that can occur.  I went with they rmeatballs as a side and their Rigatoni Filleto di Pomodoro.   The meatballs were large, juicy, and hearty with a rich tomato sauce; a great meatball.  The rigatoni was cooked al dente and well prepared for such quick service. The fillet di pomodoro was rich and complex.  The tomato flavor was bright and rich; pancetta smokey.  Onions sweet with just enough bite to them to round out the dish.  The service was fast, staff friendly, and food great.  I did get sick later that night and can't for sure say it was the food, the recent flight, or just happen stance.  But on another trip I would eat at Raos again.

LgNV-mLHE29BW4zqt4zlAg.text: Enjoyed a pleasant family dinner at Rao's one evening.  We had a nice experience and fairly decent food.  Two of the dishes were quite tasty - pasta with clams and the pasta with peas and prosciutto.  Probably the best part of the whole experience was watching the server transfer the pasta from the serving dish to the plate... table-side.  Fun!  Things to mention where improvement should be considered:  1.  Serving chicken on the bone.  The Chicken Scarpiello was tasty but hacking the meat off of bones was a bit too "home-style" for me.  At home that would be fine but not in a restaurant at those prices.  Small pieces of bone had to be carefully dealt with.  I really worried about getting one lodged in my throat since several somehow made it off of the plate and didn't get noticed until it was chewed.  (I hate spitting out food -- even discretely into a napkin -- while dining in public.  2.  The sausage -- yuck: dry, mealy, some "carmelized" beyond the carmel stage, and generally tasteless.  A real disappointment.  AVOID!  3.  Dessert prices.  Twelve bucks for a piece of cheesecake or cannoli.  They were tasty but not worth the price.  Next time we'll walk across the hall and have a $7 Payard pastry!  Now that we've experienced part of the menu I think we are in a better position to make better choices next time.

WErVhGOd5YdqlF4f7AD2WQ.text: We ordered four pasta dishes to share family style.  The portions were large enough to share among five adults.  Wonderful food highly recommend the lasagna !!

yDw0RjW6_uNZBPnsoJZUlA.text: Rao's is our favorite restaurant to dine at everytime we visit vegas.  Service is always courteous and prompt and the ambiance is nice and intimate. If you stop in you MUST try the Colorado lambchops w/ rosemary roasted potatoes and greenbeans!! The lambchops are so tender they melt in your mouth. We also enjoy the variety of fresh baked breads and the butter assortment. We can't wait to go back again.

Db8IZpJq92Zm2hdmnAVomQ.text: This is one of our "must hit" restaurants while in Vegas. We have easily been here over a dozen times, and have no intention of stopping. On our recent visit I was disappointed to learn they no longer carry my favorite Riesling, Monchoff. My husband always gets the veal chop and I always indulge in the ravioli purses, both are fantastic. I will add I feel service has slipped the past few times we have eaten here and hope they can get it back on track, that is what the missing star is for.

BZbbI7VloDndIxm1SVRm7g.text: I heard great things about this and had high expectations being from nyc area I am used to great Italian food. The food was just okay. I've had better and I've had worse. I don't think that the price tag is worth it for the food. The pasta is nothing to brag about.

HEE-Z58NGexj438ig093yg.text: Rao's took incredible care of us last night. Both the food and service was fantastic.   I will most certainly be back.

qqG-Rt31_3Gm3ryLTyhKLw.text: No need to go to New York for Rao's, the Vegas location is as great and same quality of food. This amazing southern Italian cuisine is a must try when visiting Vegas. I alway order the Uncle Vincenti'a lemon chicken, I have to have my traditional Italian food which is the Spaghetti Alla Bolognese, Veal Chop with hot and sweet cherry pepper has a unique flavor, traditional Rao's Meatballs from the antipasti menu and the pappardelle Shrimps & Lobster Fra Diavolo. Make sure to finish up with the dessert platter so you can try 3 desserts.

b2Z1Nl1xb4We6LvPoQWm2Q.text: A little bit of a weird start as we weren't seated until 15 minutes after our reservation time (and our whole party arrived on time).   The hostess wasn't busy doing anything else and we could visually see our table was ready so not sure what the hold up was.     After that, everything was solid.    Had the Osso Buco at the recommendation of our waiter and it was delicious.   I will second most of the other comments on here:  GET THE MEATBALLS!!

VWIoc3x2abD2Dm6SOkBdgg.text: My partner and I ate at Rao's, along with three others a few nights ago.  I am a native New Yorker but have never eaten at the Rao's here.  Clearly, there is a big difference between the two, and it's not at all a good thing.   The table placed an order for baked clams, fried mozzarella, meatballs, and bruschetta as appetizers, and my partner and I split a Veal Parmagiana and a Penne a la Vodka as main courses.  What had me instantly worried was the speed with which the appetizers arrived.  Food was there in a matter of a few minutes. Baked clams take a while to bake, and when properly prepared arrive at the table piping hot.  Sure enough, the clams were barely warm, and intensely fishy.  We returned that dish to the kitchen immediately; the baked clams were inedible, and had clearly been made hours in advance and reheated, or something.  The remaining appetizers were unremarkable or just bad.  When the Veal Parm and the Penne a la Vodka arrived, I was holding out hope that the situation would improve.  It didn't.  The veal was nicely presented, but the tomato sauce was the most mundane, boring sauce ever, and the penne was completely unremarkable, even if it was the best dish of the evening.  They were just plain bad, and not worth the price.  Finally, the other couple who joined us ordered profiteroles for dessert.   They were the highlight of the meal, but not enough to save this sinking ship from capsizing.  There are plenty of good Italian restaurants in Las Vegas (especially off the strip).  I would recommend you try those first.  The food at Rao's is mediocre  at best, and not worth the prices charged.  Avoid.

aYmcl1UtVCstjZq2Z1XYpA.text: Rao's at Caesars Palace has a Ravioli Purses I think everyone should try. Beggar Ravioli purses are filled with Bartlett pear  and Ricotta Cheese tossed in brown butter fresh sage and dried cranberries light dish full of flavor. The other dish we tried on this visit was great as well. The Chicken Scarpariello sauteed bone in chicken, Italian sausage, hot and sweet cherry peppers, yellow and red bell peppers. fresh oregano white wine sauce. This dish was cooked prefect chicken was not over cooked.  Our server Angelia was very professional and personable she knew her menu and had suggestions. I had made the reservation with note there was a birthday at the table they sent out a birthday dessert which was there carrot cake. Very moist with cream cheese icing very well done Thank you.

photos.caption: Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Scarpariello
Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ravioli purses

3P7W3m8Lq73BwU8I3GDKAg.text: Amazing !!! Always great no NONESENSE Italian food !!! Must try Seafood Salad, Veal Parmasean, Meat Balls and pastas !!! Great Atmosphere

photos.caption: Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood Salad
Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Macallan 12

MWXTruE0T8eGWTq1NJJTxg.text: I had high expectations not only because of their reputation in NY, and I also only buy their pasta sauces when at home. Service was a little less attentive than I expected for the money we are dropping. But they were friendly. (I stress the money because I am a foodie that is happy to shell out for worthy fare) Corkage fee for our wine we brought was an outrageous $35, but still cheaper than a few glasses of wine there. (A glass of Kim Crawford is the same price as a bottle in the store)  I got the lasagne. Good, nothing special. Huge portion, but for over $30 for an average piece of lasagne, it better be big! Flat iron steak needed salt and really...this is an Italian restaurant...why is it a la carte? This isn't a steakhouse. For the money they have the nerve to charge, it just left a lot to be desired. It was not bad, don't get me wrong. But I'd never pay that much money again for that meal. You are paying for the name, not the food and that's pretty clear. My family's recipes are way better. I guess I need to sell my Italian food! Haha!

zYzKU-xoAPMyYrVys5DNgA.text: The meatballs were great and so was the salmon and risotto special.  My friends ordered the fillet 2 of them were $96!! NOT WORTH THE MONEY.  No flavor, dry, and not at all how a steak should be cooked.  The prices were over the top $444.86.

m_D8CXnl1_vzE8hD6txqyg.text: Ok- so it was an ok experience. Here is what I liked- sitting with my friends on the patio drinking Chianti and people watching. The atmosphere was great. I thought the food was overpriced for the quality. I didn't like my chicken entree and it was dry. Luckily we ordered the meatballs for an appetizer - they are huge and tasty and we split a Vodka pasta dish - this was the highlight. If I go back to Rao- I would order the meatballs, pasta and a glass of Chianti.

photos.caption: Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The largest meatballs ever! So tasty- the best thing to order at Rao&#39;s.

eV05fPWe5VU6rCj5Qv0C9w.text: In Vegas for a few nights seeking a great meal, Totally disappointed. The menu offerings I found were very limited BUT most importantly the taste of the spaghetti  bolognese was far below expectation.

doq3Q6-E1eE55sUrRdWI1A.text: The best Italian food I've had thus far. My taste buds are giving each other high fives! We enjoyed Grayos Seafood Salad to start, and for our multiple entrees: Chicken Scciatta, Osso Bucco,  and spaghetti with bolognese sauce. Portions fit the price for the best Italian food I've ever had the pleasure of tasting.

V8UISzw3BNjRJjzV_sueoQ.text: Fabulous and attentive service.  Food was good.  Standouts were in the appetizers- roasted red peppers were so sweet and the caprese was made with heirloom tomatoes and fresh mozzarella that was almost buttery. Pastas were solid. Meats were only OK; veggies were crisp but nakedly bland.

TEom-t5mR-vSnuzUxYzYYw.text: Raos is hands down my favorite Italian spot in Vegas. The food is always amazing and the overall old-school Italian vibe is what keeps bringing me back. Definitely a memorable experience when in Las Vegas!

sufiJSjr0yw-AuSD0mI9wg.text: I have been to this Rao's location twice, once back in 2010 on my honeymoon, and then again recently when my husband and I vacationed in Las Vegas.  This meal was one of the highlights of our trip to Las Vegas.  Our love for Rao's begin probably about 5-7 years ago when our local supermarket used to sell the Rao's roasted red peppers which they have since discontinued carrying.  We loved those peppers so much that every Christmas I would suck up the high shipping cost order them from the Rao's website for my husband as a gift.  When we planned out honeymoon to Vegas in 2010 we knew we would have to visit Rao's and our visit then as well as our recent visit did not disappoint.  On our recent visit, we started our meal off with the antipasto della casa telling the waiter not to be afraid to go heavy on the roasted red peppers- he did not disappoint us!  The antipasto della casa was a great way to start off the meal.  The combination of cheeses, meat, greens, and roasted red peppers set the stage for our night.  Next up we decided to order three meals and share so that we could try a few different things.  We ordered the penne vodka, pollo scarpariello, and the ravioli (can't remember the name of this one).  The Pollo Scarpariello is one of my favorite dishes of all time!  This dish combines chicken, hot & sweet sausages, and peppers in a yummy sauce. I have never had another dish that I have enjoyed as much as this one!  It was just as good as I remember it from our 2010 visit to Rao's.  The penne vodka was very good and the ravioli was very flavorful.  Our waiter was very attentive through-out the meal. He never rushed us and made sure we had what we needed.  I love Roa's so much- highly recommend the Pollo Scarpariello and their roasted red peppers!!  I will come to Roa's whenever in Vegas!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Penne vodka
Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ravioli
Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cyllhzj8xiq9h4iUb7VBgg.text: Our friends wanted to try Rao's.  Waitress was nice and brought everything correctly, but......we were discussing business and we were interrupted mid-sentence no less than 20 times.  The sommelier reached across the table at least 4 times while we were having a discussion.  The waitress would just walk up while we were talking an rudely interrupt and just start talking.  The water girl at least tried to wait for a pause before reaching across the table.    The food was bland and shrimp fishy.  The parm bread and coffee was good!  We will not go back.

-UMc5p2iAh-S0huALIdpiA.text: Food was fine but not worth the price.  We went to Bouchon the night after going to Rao's and had a far superior experience at Bouchon - from service to food quality - for a lower price.  As an example, side dishes at Rao's (mashed potatoes, spinach) are a whopping $16 each and a more normal $8 at Bouchon.  I did enjoy the lemon chicken at Rao's  Their fritto misto was huge, but oily.

6ftDbqZkuUHizzkTrCrCOg.text: OK and just OK. Besides the meatballs, which were all kinds of awesome there really is nothing special about Rao's.  The presentation of the food is very good... but the taste, the actual food is just ok, its not good, its not bad.. its just not much better than you can get at your local cheap Italian joint.. in fact, if you are just going for the food skip this historic spot and head to your local Oliver Garden.  The service was better than in most of the restaurants we visited, they were attentive and friendly. The food just didnt do it for me.

dtXjZ-J0oZzkOqMRrwLl1g.text: Group of 7 people visited and loved this place  Food 5 out 5 very good across the board Service 5 out of 5 ( waiter was assume) A little pricey but worth it.  $800 for 7 people including drinks and tip  Must go if at Caesars palace

dD3SiLCG7xOU9NaZI400nA.text: I had a fabulous dinning experience. Everything was perfect from the greeting all the way to desert. I started with a glass of red wine and shared the fried mozzarella, meat balls, and mixed fried sea food. Everything was prepared perfectly. For the main course I had the night special of salmon served on green beans. Again it was delicious. I ended the evening with an espresso and Tiramisu.  If you are in the strip, and wanting a fine dining experience, come to Rao's.

LvdAkhLYlCPTcStxUFiwFw.text: One of the best Italian food restaurants that I've come across. Our server was very knowledgeable and recommended a few dishes for us to try. We had the Ravioli Purses (amazingly delicious), the lemon chicken (you have to love lemon), meatballs (OMG) and for desert we shared the tiramisu and cheesecake. Tiramisu had great taste and texture, wasn't too fond of the chocolate chips on top but overall it was excellent.   Alcohol drink prices are comparable to other places on the strip yet if you're only looking for food, you must give this Italian restaurant a shot. You won't be disappointed.

dukTzeIt45agPNI_W7ijEw.text: I love it! Great service, good menu, good food, good wine, great decor! You are in Las Vegas, but feels like in Italy.

WlradfTjQQScRIZDurew3A.text: Good service, average food, gross bread program, super high prices. Worth skipping; there are better dining experiences in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Penne, ravioli purses, eggplant Parmesan, meatballs

ChrdrARc_LlmZE-ifDxgwQ.text: This place is fine. The service was fine, the taste is fine. If Vegas restaurants, in particular Rao's, want to charge astronomical prices for their food, they need to start stepping it up. For example, The eggplant parmigiana tasted fine although was $31 and came with five pieces. No pasta, no other side. The waiter was nice although brought nothing to the experience. Your better off going off the strip, getting more and paying less.

KVbENx0MILAyah7T0s5ZBQ.text: I came to Rao's after seeing them on the Food Network a couple of years ago, and have been wanting to try their lemon chicken dish ever since. We ordered:  -Uncle Vincent's Famous Lemon Chicken (Quartered Charcoal Broiled Chicken Served in Uncle Vincent's Lemon Sauce $26): YUCK!! The chicken was mostly tender, but the sauce was so tart it almost made the dish inedible. I had a few bites but forced the bf to eat the rest. -Some pasta dish stuffed with cheese: This tasted much better, but the portion was on the smaller side.  Based on the prices and size of the dishes, I won't be back. If you do decide to come, do not order the lemon chicken!! And made reservations in advance, just in case.

aCeZM1SEfv1Z-zkGnijPvQ.text: I absolutely have no idea why are they so famous. Their meatballs are blah...my mother makes them better. The rib eye my husband ordered was cold, not room temp but ice cold, no au jus either, (seriously) so thin and filled with fat that by the time we could see the steak it might have been the size of your palm. The sommelier was not happy (AND showed it) how rude of us that we did not order wine!.. we were having cocktails! He quickly turned around showing us his disdain with a sour look. The little lamp on the famous 'jar', was totally torn to pieces, the waiter was clueless. The table was way too tight for a party of 4, I felt I was at a taco bell, the tables that are inside the booths have no space at all, and the restaurant was not full.  They could have given us a better seating area. The person that showed us to our table was not happy that we requested another spot, so then she placed us in a worse location. This was 12/26/16 I felt bad because my sister paid for this outrageously expensive dinner (reminded me of buca di beppo) which I was invited once, saw the food, tasted something filled with red sauce and left.  Nothing was notable, not a thing, not the heavy handed sauce on my pasta, nor my nephew's seafood salad that was the size of a tapas dish.  I was wondering about the food in this place...how come I had better food in a smaller unknown restaurants in Rome/Venice/Capri/and Florence? And also here in the US!  What a shame.

4m6td7hu_BlqdCpYQRINCA.text: Famous meatballs are famous for a reason, they are as delicious as they are big.  My wife's shrimp pasta was out of this world. Outstanding service! The waitor was friendly and discussed Vegas attractions for a good 10 minutes with us.

6ebghi5Nq9Nl0mwV2fa4eg.text: Really have enjoyed over the years, but. Food was okay. Service scripted and just not cutting edge anymore. Still convenient with great drinks.

LQNnuNGzvgkgJTuUjwfqLw.text: For what this place is, where it is and what it wants to be, I give it a 3.5 star. When in Vegas this past week, we had a pamphlet showing the goings-ons for the week and what you must do while in Vegas. Rao's was on that list and I had not been there yet so - OK! We made a reso, no problem and were seated right on time. Nice place (Caesar's Palace and easy to find at the casino exit into the Shops area), the restaurant itself was actually better than the service (think Capone style). I would not call our server unprofessional per se but he had an indescribable edge to him that made us a bit uneasy especially when he would grab a chair and sit with us for a bit? The food was very good. we shared a meatball (to die for, so moist and the marinara sauce divine), and my spouse had the rigatoni with pancetta, onion, tomatoes. The pasta was well cooked and he gave it a 4 out of 5. My linguini with clams was a 5. For me, it is hard for anyone to give me perfect pasta as I am picky and I despise overcooked pasta especially when at a restaurant, you pay a premium for such a cheap dish (for the house). The clams were great, only found 1 broken shell. The garlic wine sauce was fantastic, not too heavy and just enough of it. Well seasoned. Drinks were good but pricey. I expected the bill to be a bit heftier overall, but we were pleasantly surprised. Would I come back here? Vegas is a foodie Mecca and there are just too many other places to go and try so, no.. But I would not dissuade anyone else from coming here for the love of Italian food!

pT0ucNQuU1TKZ9_6bddCXQ.text: As recommended, the meatballs and lemon chicken were incredible.  The spaghetti was fantastic as well.  The ambiance was warm and welcoming with the perfect balance of class and comfort.  The reason that this review isn't getting 5 stars is because the waiter was really bad.  To wait for 10 minutes to be asked if we wanted another glass of red wine even though a refill was clearly needed at the time that our meal arrived is unacceptable - at least it a unacceptable anywhere that the price of a glass of wine is the same as the price of the wine bottle at the store.    Also, there was no butter or vinegar served with the bread at the start of the meal, only olive oil.  While I've had some "unique" bread,  to serve cold bread without butter cheapens the meal.  Even after asking for it twice, our butter arrived with the busser right before he cleared our starters....the food however was fantastic.   We'll be back for the food...and to hope for a different server.

ZzCfyAOzlVNHtWSgJOSCWg.text: Great food stop when wandering the Vegas strip.  Since it's pretty much impossible to get a reservation at the Rao's in Manhattan, as soon as I saw this one in Vegas, we had to stop in!  We went during lunch and there's no need for reservations, there's some tables "outside" aka overlooking the busy hallway giving it an almost sidewalk like feel or you can sit at the bar (which has some nice sunken corners for 3).  Wait staff is somewhat slow but food was really good.  Dont get me wrong, staff was really nice but ya...service was sllooowwwww.  We noticed a few people frustrated with not getting their food in time and having to leave or waiting more than 5 mns to pay their check.  Mind you it was NOT busy...Bar area was only half full.  Most were conference people so no idea if they made it out on time, we were in no rush so we enjoyed ourselves right up to their "break" time before dinner.  *Affettati Misti: thinly sliced parma prosciuto, soppressata, cubed provolone cheese, gaeta olives, pickled cornichons, sweet marinated garlic and mache greens.  Delicious and sure to severely increase your salt intake... *Le Polpotte di Rao's: traditional Rao's meatballs served in tomato sauce.  2 HUGE succulent and flavorful meatballs in some of the best tomato sauce.  Hands down, some of the best sauce. Really. *Bianca (Foccacia): really great flatbread to go with both dishes.  One to cut the salt and one to mop up the sauce.  Bread was crisp outside and fluffy inside.  Great olive oil, rosemary and sea salt sprinkled on.  We'll definitely return next time we're in Vegas since it takes 3-4 months to get a table in nyc ...

photos.caption: Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. affettati misti
Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. bianca (focaccia)
Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. le polpotte di rao&#39;s *huge delicious meatballs*

16lP9KHmplDTf31WB1-3HA.text: The restraunt is bigger than it looks.  We asked for a booth and it was no problem.   We ordered the antipasto for two and it was delicious.   I really liked the salami.  I ordered meatballs and spaghetti marinara and it was delicious.   Wife ordered angel hair pasta with seafood and it was tasty with huge shrimp!   Tiramisu for dessert was wonderful with a nice fonseca.  Thank you Raos for a great dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy birthday

WpaNMtLW-O2aoPF0-wsaGg.text: Worst service ever! Enough said... In Vegas there are much better placed to eat, so you should not have to deal with this abysmal service! Go some where else.

BUPSWuCPDZwz6Hzti1j_pQ.text: The customer service was exceptional. The food... Eh. I had the career salad and it was small and okay. My husband had the shrimp scampi and it wasn't very flavorful. Our friends had the lasagna which was good and then the muscles were bland (sauce wise). An expensive meal for what what it was and we won't go back.

kn6SiOWapf-uVzxaslN6TA.text: Very disappointed. Highly rated but not the authentic Italian food I was hoping for. Very bland

ah10C24byuiXPdhGdw2ZhQ.text: I'm hard-pressed between Italian or Thai as my favourite cuisines, but Rao's makes it easy to pick, that's for sure. We made reservations for a 6:30 dinner, but due to our schedule, we showed up early and they were more than happy to seat us around 5:45.  The menu options made it difficult to choose, but I finally decided on the Ravioli Purses while he chose the Rigatoni Filetto di Pomodoro. We debated ordering appetizers, but given how much we'd been eating on our vacation, we bypassed it and enjoyed the amazing freshly baked bread that came out.  I was absolutely shocked by how fast the food came out! I was expecting 15 minutes at least, but I swear, it was only five minutes before a server came out with our dishes. With a glass of wine each, we dove into our food. There's not too many ways I can describe what we had as ~*delicious*~. Amazing and subtle flavours, this was nothing like I've had before. We both cleared our plates and despite not having an appetizer, were quite full and happy by the end.  The service itself is amazing. One of the chefs came out to go over the specials and make recommendations, as well as review the wine list with us. He came out several times to check up on us, and the servers were also extremely attentive and courteous.   While a bit on the pricy side, I'd say that Rao's is worth it. Between the quality of the food, the speedy service, and the amazing attention to detail, we were more than happy with the bill, which wasn't that pricy when I think about it. I've had good quality Italian before and this was quite reasonable by the end of the meal. I would be more than happy to go back at some point in the future!

gfFUnmDaz7lf7o6a8cMLzw.text: So Sad. Poor Rao's is really going downhill.   We dined here in 2010 and had a marvelous time. It is pricey, but for a special occasion... the pasta is excellent.   Cut to New Year's Eve 2012. I made an 8 pm reservation 6 months in advance. I called to confirm the reservation 3 days prior to the date. At no time did anyone mention to me that this restaurant does a mandatory prix fixe (price fixed) menu on New Year's. (Important Note: I don't eat meat) So our cute little party of 4 arrives at the restaurant, excited for a stellar meal, and we are informed by a polite hostess of the prix fixe menu. This menu is $140 per person. It does not include wine or drinks. The main course has no vegetarian options and there are no substitutions.   We were pissed and disappointed. We are not cheap, but none of us wanted a four course heavy meal that evening.    Moved our reservation to the next night with no problem (I really just wanted a nice bowl of pasta, Jesus). We show up the next day and are quickly whisked to a TINY booth.   Long story short:  We order from a friendly waiter and receive several appetizers and dishes. The flavors are lovely, my fiance was particularly impressed with the bolognese sauce. Unfortunately for me, my first bite of Linguine and Clams with red sauce was FULL of sand and grit. OWW! My tooth!  I should have sent the dish back but figured I just had bad luck and soldiered on stupidly. Again the flavors were great, but when a guest is paying $30 for a plate of pasta, the kitchen better make damn sure there isn't SAND in the clam shells!   As we left, I mentioned my issue to a manager, just to let him know so that he could alert the kitchen. He could not have cared less. He gave me a half-assed, "I'm Sorry," and walked off. Ass.   We will not be back.

gUV3tjCq5qRLxRxortBNXw.text: Had dinner here with my husband. The place had been so hyped up to us that I had pretty high expectations. We had the meatballs, which were the largest meatballs I've ever seen. They were good but they didn't blow me away. The lemon chicken however was AMAZING! The sauce was so good I started dipping the bread in it. I would go back again but only order the lemon chicken, not the meatballs.

lIbBNeBn-pGl3z2Uklosuw.text: At the price point that Rao's commands, the food should be much better.  We both had pork chops. One was dark and juicy, the other was white and bone dry. The bread was just ok, but the olive oil was bitter. The roasted beet salad was very good.

98v5BbS3EX58MQkQ7H14uQ.text: Coming from a large Italian family, I am very particular about Italian food. I have heard about Rao's for years because of its New York City location and reputation, so I was eager to dine there on this last trip to Vegas. Loved it and will make sure to eat there every time I go to Las Vegas.  Atmosphere: Excellent...very warm, quite setting. This was a huge relief after a full day of crowds, loud music and noise the Las Vegas strip offers. We got there about 30 minutes before our reservation to have a drink at the bar. My husband loves old school cocktails and had an Old Fashioned. He raved about it. The walls were adorned with photos and memorabilia of Rao's legendary past and prestigious clientele. It was fun to take a few moments to look at their history. TIP: The bar is a great place to dine there if you can't get a table.  Wait Staff: Professional, courteous and prompt. The hostess greeted us with a nice smile and offered to sit us at our table even though the rest of our party had not yet arrived. The waiter knew the menu well and made some good recommendations. The sommelier was knowledgeable and helpful. Some of the wines were incredibly expensive and others were very reasonably priced. We purchased a very nice Chianti (one we have purchased at Costco for $40 a bottle) and it was $99 at Rao's, which is a lower than average mark up. In a nutshell, the service could not have been better. TIP: Ask questions...the waiters know the menu well and can help guide you.  Food: There were 4 of us and we did our best to try the menu. The bread basket was excellent....some kind of white bread with olives and a Parmesan covered cracker of some kind. It came with a red pepper butter, which was very good but we preferred regular butter which they gladly brought us. We had the meatballs as an appetizer. They were excellent....very mildly seasoned and covered in the kind of marinara sauce I grew up eating. Our friends had the Steak Pizzaiola...the steak was perfectly cooked and the peppers were not too spicy. We had the Chicken Scarpariello...something I have never heard of before. It was chicken and sausage in a wine sauce....very rich and savory but also very tasty. We love pasta and asked for a side dish of rigatoni with the Bolognese sauce. Our other friend had the fusilli special with seafood and some kind of red pepper/cream sauce. Also very rich and savory but very good. We were too full for dessert. TIP: The portions are very large. If you are a party of 4, order three entrees and ask them to serve it family style, which they will gladly do for you. That way everyone gets to try a new dish.  Pricing: Expensive...the dinner, with the tip, was close to $400 ($100 per person). That is because we had a $100 bottle of wine. But don't expect to get out of there for less than $75 per person. TIP: Plan on spending a lot of money. There is NO cheap dining on the Las Vegas strip.  For a low priced meal, you will have to go downtown.  Summary: We enjoyed our experience there so much we cancelled our reservation for the next night and wet back to Rao's and ate at the bar. This time we had the salad (house salad...excellent and very tangy) and more meatballs. We also had coffee and dessert (the Cheesecake...very good) and coffee.  We loved it and will be return customers every time we travel to Vegas. It felt like I was dining at home.  TIP: Make a reservation and ask for a table back by the glass wall facing the pool. Get there early and experience the bar too.  The only downside, as noted earlier, is the pricing. It is expensive dining but ALL  dining is expensive on the Las Vegas strip. It was worth it to us to find a place that was actually quiet (a rare thing in Las Vegas) and felt warm and welcoming.  Buon Appetito!!

rQ4iQC8hroDl-qoBrFh4Pg.text: I have heard nothing but rave reviews for this place but I just wasn't impressed  in the least. We ordered the spaghetti bolognese, meat balls, lemon chicken and caprese salad. Caprese salad was small but the buffalo mozzarella was tasty..nothing special though. The meat balls were phenomenal and thy was the saving grace of this place. For $17 I thought we would get more than 2 meatballs but I went here expecting it to be expensive. The lemon chicken was the absolute worst I have ever had. I don't mind when bones are in the chicken but when you leave the rib bones in then butcher the cchicken, you are left with tiny pieces of bone in everything. It was terrible taste and extremely hard to eat with all the bone pieces in it. $28 for half a chicken with loads of bone...no thanks. $30 for a normal size portion of spaghetti bolognese. All in all, cute ambiance and good service but certainly would not be coming back or recommending to anyone.

photos.caption: Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The lemon chicken, dry and full of bones.

jiP1kSfmlgmUspIe__Ii7w.text: I went to Vegas with a very old friend of mine that I grew up with in NY.   She is less than adventurous when it comes to food so Italian seemed like a safe bet for dinner for the two of us.  For some reason, I find it difficult to find baked clams in LA and they were a favorite of mine growing up in NY so my friend and I decided to split an order.  They came out piping hot, the breading was plentiful and perfectly seasoned and the ratio of breading to clam was spot on.  A squirt of lemon and I was in heaven.  We didn't want to stuff ourselves before going out for the night and I wanted something simple so I ordered the spaghetti marinara (something I would normally NEVER order out), a side of meatballs to split with my friend and I had a glass of wine to wash it all down.  The pasta was cooked perfectly, the sauce was well balanced, sweet and just a little tangy and the meatballs were everything that everyone makes them out to be.  They are just dense enough not to crumble when you cut into it with your fork and tender enough that they still practically melt in your mouth.  Truly divine.    The portions were HUGE.  I had half of my pasta and half of a meatball left over at the end of the meal.  It's a good thing though because for what they charge, I might have been LIVID if I wasn't MORE than stuffed.  Our waiter convinced us to take our food back to our hotel (even though we didnt have a microwave) and I'll admit, after a long drunk night out, it tasted just as good cold as it did when it was hot and at least I felt like I got my moneys worth and didn't have to eat at McDonalds at 3am.  At least not on that night.

zrv1k2-AjUzoQWK4fiz00A.text: Horrible food in overrated atmosphere.  Best for those who want to eat in a place that would be great if it were the New York location, but it's not.  This is a tourist trap.  Caesar salad was limp with croutons that appeared to come from a package.   The Veal Chop Parmigiana was large and covered with lots of cheese.  Unfortunately the bottom was ice cold (as in probably frozen).  The cheese was hard and cold.  Mentioned to my waiter who said the plate was probably cold.  Interesting - cold plates for hot food (I doubt it).  He Re-heated it.  The meat came back tough and rubbery.  The good thing about this meal was I ate little and didn't gain any weight.  The bad was an excessive bill for food that was not edible.   There are many great restaurants in Vegas.  This is not one.

MNab92tygIi9FC3Tc38sUQ.text: Having wanted to go to the original in NYC we were happy to dine at the Vegas location. But it was such a disappointment. The antipasto was delicious but my husbands veal milanesa was so tough he couldn't finish it. I had the bolognaise and it was inedible. They threw in so much oregano that was all u could taste. Couldn't eat it. Waitress didn't even flinch when I told her. The meatballs were delicious though. Greatly disappointed. Very sad.

hc28Qt4bU4EFBLqVTrBHUA.text: Outstanding dining experience. Really great good and amazing ambiance. You truly forget you're inside a casino. The bar is great and the wine selection is impressive. Highly recommend!

T5d1B9-QIceZ1ZZVeiaK6w.text: While swimming at Caesar's, I noticed the familiar "Rao's" font on an awning, which I had come to know through random chance at the grocery store one day while shopping for tomato sauce. I was instantly smitten-- seriously, it's one of the best store-bought tomato sauces I have ever had.   So when I saw the Rao's restaurant, I had an instant hankering to give it a try. Against my fiscally conservative judgement and suspicion I was dealing with an overpriced tourist trap, I decided I'd be having my dinner there.   I shared a baked clams oreganata appetizer with my handsome mohawked friend, who looked sorely out of place (we had not planned on fancy dining at the start of our swim adventure). They were succulent and delicious, and we used those tiny forks to get into the microscopic crevice of each clam shell, terrified a small morsel wouldn't make passage to our mouths.   I had a ravioli, with a garlic cream sauce. There were only a few of them on the plate, but they were delicate and well-stuffed with unidentifiable deliciousness.  The service was attentive, the atmosphere was fancy, the food was really great, and they didn't turn us mohawked, pierced, and flip-flop-wearing chlorine-stinking fools away. A really satisfying Vegas dinner!

swBAX1PsLkAQEIjoomox2g.text: Hands down the best Linguine and clams i have ever eaten! This place live up to all the fame and hype I have heard about it. I tried a side of meatball which literally brought tears to my eyes. The sauce on the meatball was the tasted identical to my mom's who we recently lost. I  will be eating at Rao's every time I visit Vegas.

QTSQ-SfWFTltVxhVTq6peg.text: Came here last night with my boyfriend and I have to say if I were basing my rating on the service alone it would be 5 stars.   We started with the calamari, baked clams, and meatballs. The meatballs were absolutely amazing! They were soft, moist, tender and very flavorful. The calamari was a little too greasy for me but again the sauce was seasoned perfectly. The baked clams were mostly breading and didn't have that crispness on top that you look for.   We then split the Caesar salad which was very good and had nice sheets on thin fresh Parmesan cheese.   For entrees I had the Ossobuco which I was disappointed with. It was a little tough and the risotto was bland. My boyfriend had the chicken Parmesan which he enjoyed.   For dessert the peanut butter tart was delicious!   All in all not a bad meal, but nothing compared to the original back in Harlem.

photos.caption: Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The meatballs are a must! Baked clams were a little disappointing.
Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Try the peanut butter for dessert!!

Ey5CxDGb3bTfOPxvYqKORw.text: If you haven't been to Rao's, you need to eat here. They have excellent Italian food and I think the majority agrees because this place is always packed!   Inside looks like an old school Italian restaurant. White linens, lots of wood furniture, the color red everywhere. The place is pretty big too!  We started out with a complimentary bread basket. Filled with several baked treats and served with three types of butter. So good, we asked for a second basket.   For the main event, we all ordered something and split it. Their food can be shared family style but it's also the right size for one person if you go that route.   We had the Caesar salad, veal Parmesan, shrimp scampi and a penne vodka. Everything was delicious!! I would have to pick the shrimp scampi as the group favorite, but I would order everything  else again.   Service is excellent. Our server was very engaging, knowledgable and helpful. If you order a pasta to be enjoyed family style, they will split it up for you table side. Nice touch!!   I highly recommend Rao's for your next Las Vegas Italian food fix!  Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp scampi! Must try!
Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veal parm!

5EY_Gm5r3h0eVEp98g24fw.text: Great restaurant inside a phenomenal hotel. Moses was a great server and recommended some fantastic dishes. I had the ravioli nurses (a little sweet, for me) and my lady had the beef lasagna which was magnificent. It was her birthday and Moses treated her to a free desert. Top dining experience.

mIp03BA3v-LpJ3WI0f9uig.text: The prices were high, service mediocre and noise level unbearable. We could not enjoy our dinner or talk to the person sitting next to us because it was so noisy.   If you want a nice expensive dinner, go somewhere else.

80IEu49EXyrzjcJhyI1IpA.text: Everything was delicious.  We tried all Rao's classics: meatballs, caprese salad, crab pasta carbonara, osso buco, veal parmesan (best ever with bone in veal chop), lemon chicken (loved it so much...came home and made in next night).  One of our group was a little disappointed the eggplant parmigiana wasnt breaded, but still tasted good and felt was a little healthier.  Great cocktails and atmosphere too.  We'll be back!

_U3MQ4Hr3-n1ePF3ux6kkg.text: Good service. But mostly great food! I wasn't a huge fan of the whole new york maffia atmosphere, but I guess that's what the original one back in harlem is supposed to look like. Loved the giant tasty meatballs and the seafood pasta dish with spicy diavolo sauce!! Huge wine selection as well!

photos.caption: Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XlPpM3esIdfe-k_Xww-4kQ.text: Came in the other night to get dinner before Absinthe. John is the man! Killer service and it doesn't hurt that the food is awesome. Get the meatballs like everyone says, but save room for dessert- the cannolis are no joke.

_d_sx2L-fia3WYEaNdeO7w.text: There were 10 of us in our party to celebrate a 69th birthday.  We were seated in a semi-private room, very nice.  Our waited "Nick" seemed pre-occupied.  Overall service was just OK.  Food was decent, well prepared and very tasty.  The presentation was average, certainly could have been better for a restaurant of this caliber.  If you are looking for good Italian food with a nice atmosphere I would check them out.  Decent wine list as well..

U0ZR_a_MFKOwG1pMo3BKZw.text: I am from NYC grew up eatin Italian food and am now in my 50's. Review: Food was mehhhh Service was mehhhhh Price was very high YOU CAN DO ALOT BETTER IN LV THAN THIS FOR A GOOD ITALIAN DINNER.  I'm bummed....wanted it to be great.

iceDh6I7OboXxNI4DUDMgg.text: Very good service and everything we ordered tasted very good, but easily replicated in any quality Italian restaurant. The decor is warm, but the space is tight, and definitely has that "stage-y" vibe of inauthenticity. (Like that Family Guy episode where Peter opens and decorates an Applebees-type restaurant by throwing a bunch of sh*t on the walls.) You're better off spending the money on a unique dining experience in LV, and making a reservation for Rao's in NYC.

fuUm-wOTQXDJUZ4-mZbtyQ.text: If you get Ricky as your server you'll get an incredible and authentic New York experience.  We've eaten here at least 5x and it's great every time. We've tried most of the menu and nothing has disappointed yet.

kA0eWKm2oAORlxUenUTi1g.text: If you like cold food then go to Rao. Unbelievable , ordered lamb chops, 3 small cold chop but full plate of cold potato and green bean. Never will go again.

ejqh0BwTaNFhTqBfzKYVPw.text: We have dined at Raos inside Ceasar's Palace in Las Vegas for several years. Unfortunately, after our last visit on Dec. 11, 2018 we will no longer be back. After being told we could not sit inside the resteraunt because we did not have a reservation, we were seated outside next to a pole in the casino area, which was uncomfortable, as I have Rheumatoid arthritis and my husband is disabled and recently underwent a total knee replacement. I was served something that was not ordered, as I was never actually asked what sides I wanted. I did not complain, but the waiter insisted upon making a scene and several times leaned over me, as if speaking to a child and asking if I would like something else. Several times I told him it was fine, I had no complaint. He then proceeded to loudly exclaim that I would get my meal for free, which embarrassed me and again, I asked him not to do that. They did it anyway...so I proceeded to go inside and ask for a manager so I can pay for my meal. MJ approached me rather aggressively stating that she is a manager and she sarcastically said she took it off because SHE wanted to and she did so, so I would not complain about service. After a rather rude exchange with her I paid my bill and was literally thrown my change. The billfold was shoved into my hand and flipped upward toward my face, spilling my change on the floor. MJ continued chuckling with the other 2 girls standing by the register and watched, grinning, while I struggled to bend down and pick my change up off the floor, while other diners were staring. She caused a complete scene, embarrassed herself, and left me feeling as if I were not welcome to dine there. I had planned to stay at Ceasar's another night, as I still had a paid room reservation, but this encounter left me so flustered that I actually just checked out and drove home that night.

Hyw7_01bFcZzn2QMQzVDiQ.text: This was date night for us in Vegas so we splurged and ate here.    The whole experience to me was awkward.  the service was odd and friendly and pretentious all at once - unsettling. The setting was supposed to be intimate but it ended up being cavernous. Seating was not intimate.  the food was good - not as advertised (just like mama used to make in little Italy!) but also not chain food.  Pasta seemed fresh. The prices were Vegas sized for what you get.  They did play 80's top 40 music which was fun.  i would not eat here again.

xIYfQGvNMttULew-_hRB3Q.text: My family and I were craving pasta so we decided to try Rao's. We were all very hungry. I had ordered a tomato soup which came out first. After an hour of waiting for our pastas to come out, we had to ask them what the hell is going on just to find out that they were waiting for me to finish the soup so then they could bring the pasta. How stupid does that sound??? Or why couldn't they tell us before hand that they wouldn't bring out the pasta until the soup was gone. Like who the hell would've even thought!?! Anyway we ended up paying so much money, waiting over an hour to eat and the food wasn't even good. None of us finished our plates. Too creamy, too heavy. There are better places in Vegas. This should be a last option.

MqY9v1HDi5SdXqlAj6cnxw.text: For a Saturday night, we only had to wait 30 min.  After wandering Caesars for a few hours, we chose dinner here as we both love Italian. This place is a must-eat!! We shared a Caesar salad, I enjoyed the Tagliatelle and my boyfriend had the Spaghetti Bolognese with homemade meatballs.  The pasta was clearly homemade and the cocktails were phenomenal! We'll be back!

AxuvlU_bQe0_PgpT_oGpjg.text: My first visit to Rao's was about seven years ago and I have never felt the need to rush back and try it again. I remember the food being good but for not amazing for the price point.   Last Saturday, I finally got the chance to return and again, I enjoyed my meal quite a bit, but there was nothing that blew me away.    Dining with a group of five, we had the opportunity to share a large selection of different items, including one restaurant week prefix. The highlights from our meal were the meatballs, which were extremely moist and flavorful, duck cannelloni, the lemon chicken, which is another of their signature dishes, ravioli purses, which wasn't a favorite around the table, but I really enjoyed the sweet and savory elements and the veal parmigiana.   The desserts were classic and delicious as well. The peanut butter and chocolate torte stole my heart but the tiramisu was also very good.   The meal was delicious but nothing that was so extraordinary that I see myself going out of my way to return for.
