MuckZH8IjBm7wMe8PQfRRQ.text: I come here all the time. I live in Las Vegas and this is my go to Italian restaurant.   They have a great happy hour at the bar and have a great view of the pool and a cute room with tons of old pictures. The ambiance is amazing and the service is top notch.

Ydmo7wM88kCNvuX-JiR5vw.text: /TL;DR So much hype here. I don't want to detract from what might be a really awesome place. The meal I had doesn't qualify, though.  /ATMOSPHERE Typical, large, dark restaurant stuck inside of a casino. If you've been to Vegas, you know what I'm talking about.  /FOOD I went with CHICKEN SCARPARIELLO based on the ranting of some Food Network celeb who claimed it was the best meal of her life. Not to me. Way too tart. It wasn't bad, but I should have gone with the lemon chicken! :)  /SERVICE Great service, as you should expect at this price point. You even get someone who specifically runs around pouring wine.  HOW TO READ MY REVIEWS: 1 Star - Does not approach edible. Enter at your own risk. 2 Stars - If I'm in the area, I'd pick something else. 3 Stars - I would stop by if I happen to be in the area. 4 Stars - I would pick this place out of other places nearby. 5 Stars - I would go out of my way to dine here.

r_Zbzq9S1DWzTCY-JH7U8w.text: This place is Amazing! The food is so flavorful and delicious that my mouth is watering just remembering my last visit.  I've been here several times with friends and family and I've never been disappointed. I could go for their bread alone with the variety of butters to test on the different fresh baked breads. One of my favorite items is the mozzarella carrozza!  I'm also a huge fan of the lamb dish that is so tender it melts in your mouth. The beef lasagna  is another repeat order dish for me.  The staff is great and very professional. I definitely recommend this place especially if you want to empress someone special!

CojJFd7BtJt_WsfkbavBbA.text: Raos was great we went there for our anniversary and it was great! The pasta was delicious!!! And the heirloom tomato and burratta cheese caprese was fantastic!!!!

Y-kGIRl7w4YShuWOaXKDnw.text: Italian Food was just ok. Wine was expensive, I recognize several offers that I buy myself and at the restaurant they where prices at least four to five  times more than what I buy them for at my local wine store. We had cocktails with tequila in them and they were $16 apiece they were pretty good. The food was good but not anything special. Same things and taste you can get at a Italian franchise. After our first drink, the waiter told Is he had not put in outlet Order yet he was waiting so we could relax awhile and enjoy our first drink, that is ok however I feel he should have asked US if we wanted him to wait to put our order on and not decided that on his own although we probably Would have chosen to have him do that, we have have been asked. Next time we may be in a hurry. Prices are a little high for what you get. Restaurant is kept kinda on the dark Side for ambiance .. I liked it although some may not, you may need a flashlight to see the menu.

x2JOZvqcA2eDI-2MAyFwqA.text: Yuck- I hate saying this because I wanted to love it. I have been buying the marinara sauce at the grocery and when my husband wanted Italian food we were excited to try it here. We ordered the fritto misto to start- very salty and little flavor. I had the crab carbonara which I ate one bite of and pushed away. It lacked any flavor and the consistency was similar to glue. My husband had the chicken parmigiana which for $44 should be amazing. When his food came I asked him where the chicken was since all I saw on his plate was pasta. He said it was okay but wow Vegas is expensive but for that price for chicken it should have been large enough that you could see it on your plate. We split one meatball as well- it was fair. We each had a drink and no dessert and our bill was around $200.00 which would be happy to pay if we liked it. We both said we have had better meals at chain restaurants. My final complaint and then I will get off my soap box- seating. It is a large restaurant and there were plenty of seats open. We were seated in a room with all kids. We had an 8pm dinner reservation and it was for 2 people. I have kids and take them out for dinner too but when I'm not with my kids I would prefer to not sit and entertain other kids. We should have been seated in a room away from the families which a good hostess will do. Okay that's it- I'm done. Now on to another day in Las Vegas!

saLVGINCL4kEG979PqQALw.text: Ok what can i say about Rao's...WOW!!!!! this place is amazing!!! we ordered the gnocchi with meat sauce, lasagna, fusili with sasauge and cabbage, meatballs, and grilled veggies. First the gnocchi, im a gnocchi lover and ive tried gnocchi pretty much everywhere and these were up there with the best..the sauce is just spot on. The lasagna is to die for..the layers and goodness and the sauce and cheese..wow. the fusili with sausage was awesome also..full of flavor and just yummy in my mouth. All these great food for a great price..we got all the above entrees plus a salad, soup and an ice tea all for under $180..plus the portion size is well above normal. We left the restaurant with full stomachs unable to eat dessert which is unheard of for us..anyways im definitely coming back for sure.   The only thing i was gripe about is the info shows casual attire..well casual to me is just that casual..i went with jeans and nice shirt and shoes and my hat..they asked me to take off my hat at the dinner table which i dont mind doing ..but dont say its casual attire then. i say it should have a classy title than casual

vQ0dcdTfFW8ptCTjkggi8w.text: So disappointed as this was a bachelorette dinner for my best friend and wish we would have looked at the reviews before we made the reservation. The night started by our server not being friendly at all. Once we all ordered our food the two people that ordered drinks waited quite a bit to get them. We placed our food order and the food took a little long which we did not care nor payed attention cause we get it, it Vegas we're in the casino area kitchen must be busy. Finally after almost 35 mins everyones food came out except for two girls meal. We figured it would be coming after since our server can't carry everything at once, we all started eating since we were on a time schedule and the girls waited for their meal and our server never realized they didn't have a plate until one of the girls asked how long would be on their food, and at this point his reaction itself told us that he had forgotten to put the order in, and look I get it, I myself am a bartender and him forgetting it would have been fine except there was never an explanation as to why the food took over 45 mins to come, never an apology or anything. The server never offered dessert or another round of drinks to the people that were drinking. And I get it he must have been bothered at the fact that a couple girls split dinner which means check average stays down, but not offering dessert or another drink to at least try to bring the check up or just to do it because that what your job is as a server is very frustrating. When it came time for the check things got even more frustrating because before we all arrived we specifically asked that we split checks as a big group and were told we could only split it 4 equal ways to which we all agreed to, except when he brought the bill he acted like he didn't know we were supposed to split the bill and caught an attitude when we mentioned so. The food was definitely better than the service which is why I'm giving it a 2 star. Again I am a bartender myself which is the only reason I tipped 20% but wish I could take it back and given that we were on a time schedule I had no chance to bring this issue up to a manager.

YGe3vSIEjm8NJVoMa3layw.text: So disappointing! Love their sauce at home and use all the time! Firstly my server was very nice and attentive so not a reflection on her but -- upon being seated I ordered a glass of wine, then subsequently ordered the Caesar salad and meatballs which I requested be served together. That was at 6:45. Before I even received water or my wine which I'd hoped to enjoy prior to my meal, I was presented with my 'food order' at 6:47 - literally! Hello -- this is not McDonald's drive-thru people - I hadn't even had a chance to pour some olive oil onto a plate to try the bread that arrived the second I was seated! Then only when I asked to have some time, the too early food was removed. When i eventually said I was ready to eat - not even 15 mins later, the salad arrived so incredibly overdressed it wasn't possible to eat it. The meatballs were the only decent part of the meal but overall a highly disappointing experience. Won't be coming back!

TFtZb96zAKiMUXlqFMjJRw.text: Very disappointing. I should have believed the bad reviews. The lemon chicken should have been called burnt chicken parts. The antipasto was okay but nothing to ever get again. We have been here previously and had great meals but this will stop any future visits.

md69hc-wS-ICaRxk20AMMg.text: Went without reservations and had a drink at the bar, decided to eat. Had the bone in veal parm and penne vodka, amazing. Service was great. Will be back for the parm!

photos.caption: Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone in veal parm

OpZ9dvLrZw_Bxe_ZXNujkQ.text: Horrible service.  Don't come here.  Much better places for Italian in Vegas.  The restaurant was half dead at 9:15 pm and the hostess said the restaurant was "fully committed".  She refused to even let us get a seat in their bar for dinner...and we were nicely dressed, friendly hotel guests!   What kind of Italian restaurant closes their bar for dinner?!  Shut this place down and put a better restaurant in its place...or at least find a more friendly, accommodating hostess if Caesar's decides to let this tired, poor excuse for an Italian restaurant live on.  Update:  I'd like the thank this snooty Rao's hostess for refusing us service as we are now around the corner having an amazing dinner at Nobu (and in the bar!).  A much better dinner at Nobu, I'm sure, than had we stayed at tired Old Raos!

R3BSsd_AcoT8uUn5KuYAcw.text: I took 25 clients to Rao's for dinner and the service, the food, and the atmosphere were all fantastic! My server was Howie and he was extremely friendly, accommodating, and went above and beyond to make sure myself and my clients had a wonderful dining experience. I thoroughly enjoyed his service and his hospitality was second to none and all my clients agreed. The food and dessert was absolutely delicious. My clients and I enjoyed everything we ate. The atmosphere was so warm and welcoming and the decor was great. My clients and I had a wonderful experience at Rao's and Howie, the food, and the atmosphere all come highly recommended to family and friends!

nXsMmzdRjYmayVRlMvMz-Q.text: My absolute favorite place to eat in Las Vegas!  I always make sure to stop in for a meal or two regardless of where I am staying on the strip.  The meatballs, caprese, and Penne Vodka are my absolute favs.  The Veal Parm is good, although massive.  Seafood salad has all kinds of seafood in it. They also have an extensive wine list with an onsite Sommelier.    This place also works for date night, business meetings, or just a dinner or drink solo.  The staff is top notch and friendly.  The kitchen is also partially open so you can see your meal being prepared if you are sitting at the bar.  Rao's doesn't feel like you are in Vegas but when you go to Vegas make sure you stop in for dinner ( I don't think they do lunch service anymore).

tn461_q2VIZp7TVcTM0Rlw.text: Probably some of the best Italian food I've ever had. The prices are a little high, but when you're on vacation who cares? The setting is lovely, perfect for a romantic evening out. We had to try their meatballs because we heard such great things...and they're definitely worth getting. We also had the chicken parmesan, which was equally awesome. Our only regret was not leaving enough room for dessert.

WBVXhW9672z-daVG2pyxuA.text: I have had the undeniable pleasure of dining at Rao's in Hollywood every month since it opened three years ago. I have had all my celebrations there from being named teacher of the year at my school to California Teacher of the Year. I celebrated my 60th birthday there in July and it could not have been better. A birthday I will never forget.  So, when I found out I would be going to Las Vegas I knew I had to go to Rao's. So Patrick, the manager in Hollywood snagged me a reservation for my two friends and me for last Saturday night. Knowing it was Vegas, knowing it was much larger than Hollywood, I had doubts, but knowing it was Rao's I knew it was going to be good. I had no idea!!!  Rao's you are truly the best and here is why.  We came in and i gave my name for the reservation and they responded, "Oh! We know about you!  Patrick told us! We have been waiting, rIght this way!"  So off to our table we go! I had requested a table that would be in a quiet place and so we were seated in one of the small side dining rooms.  Compared to Hollywood this place is gargantuan! We were seated and our server greeted us with a huge smile! As i was introducing the menu to my friends, we noticed that there was a large party of men that were very noisy. Knowing I did not want this to ruin the evening I asked to be moved and in fact... I went in search for a table in another dining room on my own. Because I am a regular in Hollywood I felt like here a regular so off I went. And who did i find... FRANKIE, the owner from NYC!!!! He called me by name gave me a hug and asked what i was doing here and then he introduced me to all his friends he was dining with.  I told him we would like to move and so he moved us to the booth right next to his table.  SO off we go! So now for the meal...  The food!!!!! INCREDIBLE! Just like I knew it would be! Cocktails amazing...just like Hollywood. The meatballs, to die for...just like Hollywood!  The stuffed clams, mouthwatering... just like Hollywood. Salad, fresh and tasty...just like Hollywood! Pastas, hot and flavorful...just like Hollywood!  And then came the desserts all four of them they chose for us!  Just wonderful...just like Hollywood! My friends were not impressed...they were blown away. They love old school Italian and of course Rao's delivered.    The staff is quintessential Rao's...friendly (very!)  incredible service and just like Hollywood, they were like family!  Frankie, checked in on us several times making sure everything was perfect!  Frankie...it was better than perfect.   Over the past three yearsI have told so many people about Rao's and when I do I feel like I am talking about my family.  When you have dined in a restaurant every month for three years, celebrated some of the most important events in your life and it is all with incredible people, great service and beautiful food you can't help but feel like family.   Frankie, thank you for incredible generosity and making my visit to Vegas everything I wanted it to be and more. Patrick, thanks for sharing your Vegas family with me but most of all my thanks goes to the phenomenal staff and chefs at Rao's in Vegas.  You made me feel like I was home.   If you want a great meal and desire to be treated like family...go to Rao's... whether it is Vegas or Hollywood or if you are lucky enough (I am still hoping!) New York City!  This is an American dining institution...one you must experience.  With Great Affection,  Michael Hayden, 2014 California Teacher of the Year

e92pVcVNnBxGqo5pnLCYUA.text: Rao's is always amazing! I am Italian and am picky when it comes to eating others sauce and meatballs. Not here, the meatballs are to die for! Arrive is always great as well! Every time we eat at Rao's we never have a bad meal!

photos.caption: Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qFX_039JqOFo1kqwDC_-Mg.text: Food came out way too quick for the price that cost. That probably explains why it tasted like last nights warmed up leftovers.

X8AbLyie7y18gYXnie6j8A.text: Thoroughly mediocre. $185 tab.   Went there with a large group from NY. We had heard good things about Rao's in NY so we went to the vegas locatin. Just terrible. I have no problem paying for food but when the tab is equivalent to a tasting menu at some of the best places in NY and LA and the food is pretty much sbarro level...that's just wrong. It seems as if  these guys have been living on name alone or they were having a REALLY off night.  Also, we told them we were in a rush and they didn't really change their already inattentive service. I guess they get enough business regardless where they can not care about their service and their food.  Oh and we made a reservation for 13 but only 11 of us showed up. They charged us for 13 anyway because "that's our policy."  Will never ever ever go back again and highly recommend spending your money at the other 50 spots in vegas with better food or..going to in n out.   p.s. My roomate makes better meatballs at home. OVERRATED.

jJljl61bWIMtE9l2waQ1cQ.text: My first visit to Rao's was phenomenal.  My husband and I went with another couple to celebrate our anniversaries and had great food and great service. From the hostess who took my reservation to the bus staff that cleared our table everyone was helpful and friendly.   The food and wine we selected was superb.  We started with the Frito Misto and bread.  For our main courses my husband and I both had the Gnocchi (Vodka sauce for him and Arrabiata for me), the other couple had the shells and ricotta and the breaded bone in veal with sauteed peppers and of course we had to get the meatballs.  I will definitely eat at Rao's again!

7rvKXI2CpgFI1uH6dNTYeA.text: I had read all the reviews about Roa's in New York City and was very excited to try one in our hometown of Las Vegas.  I was a little surprised at the decor.  We were seated in a huge auditorium like dining area.  The music was surprisingly poor. Bully bully was blaring over the speakers which made it feel more like a shady neighborhood bar.  The food tasted like it came straight out of a jar of Ragu.  The service was at best adequate with the waiter seeming like he had something better to do like play Internet on the computer.  The only thing that made it seem like we were in Las Vegas was the huge price tag at the end of the meal.  Thank goodness there are a lot of tourists to keep this place open. It would not make it in Las Vegas if it was dependent on the local residents.

3Qkptk2BEAq8xcFrajZ_MQ.text: This was the first stop on our food trip to Vegas - a slow introduction to gastromic excess that we figured would not go wrong.  And, sure enough, we were very pleased with what we got!  Our waiter was fabulous and we started with the fritto misto - other than the tentacle calamari, we ate it all and it was not overly greasy.  The specials that night sounded great, so I got the scallops over lemony risotto and husband had the prosciutto-wrapped cod over parmesan risotto.  Top this off with a strawberry shortcake that made me change my mind about it being served over a biscuit (We were a sponge cake/angel food cake family) and I was one happy lady.  All this, with a few drinks each was also the cheapest dinner we had on this trip at about $150.

gfE1Z17IGo9gpUXi6OWBZw.text: This place reminded me of back home...the east coast! The service was great and the drinks were good...the food that i had was excellent but since i cant have gluten it didnt leave me with many choices...but its my friends #1 spot in the whole country so i had to try ....not my number one tho....

e1JjwHCcX9eib-hBaTk3MA.text: We went to Raos on Christmas Day evening because we had tickets to Absinthe, outside of Caesars Palace and this place was close by.  During our entire dining experience I was thinking how we'd made a mistake by not going to the new and improved Bacchanal buffet for the same price.  Service was so-so with the waiter paying us minimal attention when we decided not to order drinks (we were offered no wine menu).    Upside was the Fritto Misto appetizer bigger than most main courses with the gigantic shrimp and calamari fried perfectly.  We ordered the lamb chops, spaghetti bolognese, lemon chicken and the eggplant Parmesan.  The eggplant was hands down awful, small poker chip sized slices breaded and deep fried to a tasteless and dry consistency.  The small amount of tomato sauce couldn't help these things.  The spaghetti was only slightly better.  Thank god the portions were small.  The best dish was the lamb chops, perfectly cooked.  The chicken was only OK.  $200 for four adults with no drinks, Olive Garden could have done better.

hswNLOUrmwW91Zi3GFhW2A.text: Rao's was perfect.  From the food, to the service.  I started out with the standard bread, served with 3 types of butter.  It was good.  But then things got better.  I decided to order a primi of the spaghetti bolognese.  Wow is all I can say.  Some of the best bolognese I've ever had, second to Scalinatella in NYC.  I sat for 15-20 minutes after finishing the bolognese, trying to digest so I could order the Uncle Vincents Lemon Chicken.  I couldnt make room, so I gave up and ordered dessert.  The strawberry shortcake.  The whipped cream was the best Ive ever had.  The mandarin compote or whatever the orange sauce was just a grand slam.  The waiter was fantastic, he made sure I was taken care of.  Hats off to you guys, please open a Rao's in Denver, we need good italian!

PJ5lnNT6AOfvp1X78ZaYag.text: We came here on Friday at 5:30 and sat in the NY room. We had a very attentive waiter named Nick who was helpful and very friendly. We had the meatballs and bigger source ravioli to start and ONG amazing! My husband had veal chops and I had the pasta in Vodka sauce. Everything was so good we had no room for desert but we will be back next time we are in town!

VQrb8wOh0k00UXgiIm226w.text: Rao's is, perhaps these days, more famous for their line of authentic Italian pasta sauces that were spawned from their kitchen.  And while their line of products is truly 5 star, I'm happy to say their restaurant (located in Caesar's Palace, across from the buffet) is also a culinary delight.  An offshoot of their main NYC-based location, the Rao's in Vegas is not a disappointment.  While a tad bit pricey, I think you'll find this place is worth your dollar, as the pizza is fantastic, as are the delicious salads, and of course the meatball is something that must be tried at least once in your life.  For those of you on the west coast, a drive to Vegas sure beats a flight to NY, so save yourself the trip and try the Vegas Rao's, if you'd like a little taste of that authentic NYC Italian fare.    Pro-tip:  Order the meatball with a marinara-based pasta dish.  Combine the two for a giant meal that will feed a couple people for a reasonable price!

C5QvlofC0zxGKYiBN2OwUA.text: My husband made me go there after having an average dinner there two years ago.  After a fabulous dinner last night at Bradley Ogden, Raos was the most horrible meal I've had in a long time. The veal Parmesan was so tough and salty I could barely eat it. Needless to say, my husband doesn't get to pick restaurants any more. He's going to have to make it up to me tomorrow for our last dinner in Vegas this trip.

aH1muHok2bcUtdZH1cE3xg.text: Basically this is the ONLY place to get italian in Vegas!  Atmosphere is great modeled after the real Rao's in Harlem.  House cabernet was perfect. Pasta was cooked how it should be nice and Aldente. The meatballs were great!! the Sauce was good not like Rao's in NY though but I am sure that has to do with the water and stuff.  Large portions make the price worth it.  Like I said do not waste your time with other italian places in Vegas just come here.

tRQyjkce2ZTE7Vtyw-x5Uw.text: It was a very pleasant meal. Service was excellent! Will definitely come back. :)

1BGZtSN-Dxj8mqm5p90e-g.text: This isnt a mom & pop place but the management and staff sure tricks you into thinking it is you just have to squint a little.  Italian food is my favorite even though my BF rarely finds it worth the money.  This place serves Broccoli Rabe which in itself makes it nearly a 6 star.  Great balance of modern meets rustic classic dishes.  Pretty patio area not stuffy or pompous.  Cant remember for sure but Krista was the name in my head that took exceptional care of us.

16z-msWjnBS55m8dzfIs_A.text: Ate here for lunch: very limited menu, service was horrible and the sodas were watered down. I ordered antipasti for my meal and the rosemary/sea salt focaccia bread: both were very good! I heard Rao's was better for dinner, and would be willing to try again.

EtfG3moBMX_IDroAazIF_Q.text: My husband told me it's impossible to get into the Rao's in NY, so I was excited to try the one in Las Vegas. I was not disappointed! My husband ordered their famous lemon chicken and it was absolutely delicious and full of flavor! I ordered the spicy shrimp and added linguine and it too was fabulous! The pasta was perfectly al dente and the shrimp perfectly plump and juicy! The baked clams we had as appetizer couldn't be more perfect. We really enjoyed every bite of every course and I would highly recommend!

VMCbLcNqvaT4uh0VVQptHA.text: returned to Rao's this weekend for lunch - been wanting one of their pizza's for a very long time ( not sure why they only serve at lunch time )   roomie and i started with the polpette - gotta have da meatballs !!  is it just me or  are the lunch time meatballs smaller than the dinner ones ?  Still tasted good.  We had the Margherita pizza and the sausage and ricotta - big surprise - a little pricey for what you get - prices for the pizza are around $14- $17 each   I loved the crust !  the sausage - mixed feeling - ok taste but for a "personal pizza" i say go thinner slices and more of them  - just a personal preference - a lil oregano on the pizza  - i think either add some roasted garlic or  maybe some sauted onions - just felt something was missing.  Service a little on the slow side - but overall, it's worth another visit - since i'm staying at Caesar's about 10 days this month - i suspect i'll make another visit to  Rao's

photos.caption: Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. margherita pizza
Photo of Rao's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. sausage ricotta pizza

VbLe2hmdrxmr0NFaG_oD_Q.text: Went there twice in 3 days, thought i'd give it a second chance... wasn't impressed. nothing special about the pastas, have had way better at mediocre places in NYC. Perhaps the NYC location is the one everyone raves about, because the Las Vegas one is just normal...at best.

ICsVVkIoJXesHlx4KApMZQ.text: This was way overpriced for the food quantity and quality. Buy a jar of their sauce at the grocery store and use box spaghetti as our waiter was honest about and you will have a better meal. This dinner was the worst food the entire week. Please listen to the other Yelp reviewers and go somewhere else with your hard earned money. The waiter was attentive, and best aspect of the dinner.

ap_MHWNCNUp_HE7O8KT5Mg.text: GO FOR THE MEATBALLS!!!!  Rao's is a decent, expensive Italian restaurant. I wouldn't go for the pasta.... I had the salmon pasta on the menu, but was disappointing. My buddy ordered the spaghetti and a side of their meatballs. The order was two meatballs.... but they were almost the size of a baseball, and it was one of the most moist, delicious meatballs I've tasted.  I can't recommend anything else on the menu, mostly because I haven't tried most of them..... but be sure to get the meatballs!

TVd4fctHOk8g8S5IKOVzQA.text: The Eggplant Parmigiana was bland and average. I have had it a lot better in a lot of places.   The Apple Mojito was good.   The three butters they give you with the bread were delicious, especially the smoked onion.   The Tiramisu was excellent. Better than expected. Light, sweet with just the right amount of expresso. If you go to Rao's you really need to get it.

uUwTc8GLeLQZZBRpUDnWIA.text: About 40-50 dollar plates, small portions, extremely salty. I tried everyone's dish and it was all very salty, I'm guessing/hoping it was the chefs fault that night. I doubt they make every meal that loaded with salt. The service it self was okay though.

HpkRdh7U6oWQpzLi0DjCgA.text: Really good underrated Italian on the strip. Being local, whenever we want a good reliable Italian spot that spoils us, (but at a cost - it's the strip so can't complain), we come here. the caprese salad app is delicious - do wish it was bigger. Signature calamari is good, (kids love it), and their pasta dishes are spot on. The noodles are cooked perfectly on every dish that we have ordered.  The mixed drinks are great, as well.  The kids enjoyed how when their spaghetti and meatballs came, the servers put it together right in front of them.  Yes, there are plenty of Italian restaurants all over, but give this one a shot. I hope you guys like it as much as we do.

b7UGwppWnZAecN9RQQHlOw.text: Good wine selection, tiramisu for birthday celebrations great service, try the meatballs ( but even the side portion is too much for one person) and the purse ravioli with brown butter and ricotta are amazing!

3Ukf4hUZytnBGj02COTccA.text: We love coming to Rao's every time we are in Vegas. The food is always amazing and the service to notch. Our server gave us great recommendations and we loved everything. If you enjoy Italian you must dine at Rao's while in Vegas. The best on the strip

yoTk9Ucs7QR7N5t4XzPFmg.text: Holy crap, $44 for chicken parmesan! Four meals, a salad and one glass of wine at $270 not too sure about that. Food was ok, but nothing great. The special was the chicken parmesan, guess I should have asked the price when the waiter said the specials. Won't be back at the price unless flavor go better

4E7-JufvsDy3It9XJy_3kA.text: What can I say about this icon?  The food is incredible!  The service is impeccable!  The ambiance is memorable!  Make sure to have the meatballs, lemon chicken,  eggplant parm, creme brulee, tiramisu, and profiteroles!  We are already wanting to go back!!!

lGlpybrWrbxj0ErzDCEcSQ.text: The place looks to have its best time behind it.  The menu folders almost fall apart when you handle them.  The food was rather overpriced.  Having 10 or so (did not count) purse raviolis for $30 is ridiculous.  The raviolis had no lobster or foie gras or truffles or anything like that.

g4T4fY2HsI9ObbykGWYl5A.text: I was part of a group of 6 who dined here for the first time on Jan. 29.  I live in southern CA and would consider driving to Rao's just to get a takeout order of the meatballs--yes, they are that good.  Our entire evening was perfect.  The entrees were off-the-charts delicious.  Try Rao's and see for yourself.

dMp106oOSFQ_sLxxzyjgUg.text: A taste of the old country; yep, New York City circa 1890.  The ultimate expression of what many have come to know as Italian or rather I-talian (emphasis on the I and meaning no disrespect) food in the US.  It's origins in Naples, but long since corrupted for American taste and bounty.  The Italian spirit and passion for sharing good food lives on.  Rao's is a fun place to mangia!  Example one, ginormous meatballs the size of your fist.  Flavorful, Perfectly cooked, tender, balls bathed in a hearty red sauce.  A great blend of fatty beef, pork, and lean veal the right amount of breadcrumb filler.  Example two, spaghetti alla Bolognese, a pile of noodles hidden under a thick meaty, flavor charged sauce.  Classic starters.  Baked clams, rich with butter and crisp breadcrumbs, dried herbs and a kiss of lemon; the fritto misto (calamari, shrimp, cod, and zucchini) a slightly crisp, slightly oily, aggressively seasoned; the sauteed mussels, sweet and tender sauteed in butter then quickly steamed in white wine and garlic.  No complaints.  Classic mains.  Outstanding veal chop served smothered with Rao's classic sauce of mildly spicy, sweet cherry peppers.  Subtle flavor of tender veal along side the clean, pepper flavor and zesty tomato sauce.  It heightens the sweetness of the veal.  Win!  Veal not your thing?   The same sauce tops a tender grilled shell steak (Steak Pizzaiola) and a thick, juicy, double cut pork chop.  The Ossobuco, delicious.  Well braised, tender without being stringy.  A good portion of bone marrow a nice touch.  Finally "Uncle Vincent's Lemon Chicken; charbroiled marinated in a lemon olive oil mixture and finished in the same.  Tart, sweet, bitter, classic.  Portions are large.    Very good wine list focusing on Italy.  Typical high Vegas resort pricing.  Service is very friendly and efficient.  Exactly what you would expect from an I-talian restaurant from NYC.  Well done.

r1PQd1qeU1c5fFiRkovLnA.text: Sorry, this place really wasn't worth it.  Was there with 5 other co workers.  The service was only adequate. I had the salmon special which was small, overcooked and dry. Another coworker had the eggplant Parm which was inedible. He described it as "gummy & awful".  The rest of the group all had veal chops which were very large and looked nice, but were tough as a shoe. It's Vegas, so I'm not knocking it on price, even though it is ridiculously expensive. The food just was not very good.

4jbKnXSyKgv4Ctoe8CEyqQ.text: Had a big and expensive Italian meal at Carbone and left feeling like it was worth every penny. Had a big and expensive Italian meal at Rao's and left feeling like I'd been duped. The service was good, but the food was average at best. Even the lauded dishes tasted no better than what you'd get at a mid-rate Italian restaurant in any town. I love Rao's pasta sauce that's sold in grocery stores and I like the story of their original NYC location, but this Rao's in Vegas is a mediocre restaurant resting on its laurels. You'll get a much better meal at Carmine's.

DKECWg4pGrLatn7g3H3LjQ.text: Came here last month for dinner. I love the history of this place and have been waiting to try it. The food was great the atmosphere was cool. My review is for our server Angelia. She was helpful, funny, fast and accommodating everything she recommended was perfect. I come back just for her.

feSzpFEifhRBliHNyYkn_A.text: I've eaten here twice and absolutely love the food, the staff, and the environment. Matt was our waiter, and took great care of my girlfriend, and I. We also had the pleasure of meeting the owner, Frank, who was very friendly, down-to-earth, and always smiling. I'm looking forward to our next trip to Vegas. Thanks for everything.

GoexJC6TYwQuvJqqjppYnA.text: I thought the meal was pretty underwhelming.  I came with a group of 6 and was hoping for some old school Italian in the benchmark Caesar's property, and I was left with an expensive Italian dish that was simply well-prepared dishes with no umph.  Not much went into each dish and made it memorable.  We tried a bunch of options including the veal parmesan, chicken parmesan, seafood pasta, ravioli pouches, simple angel hair, and some meatballs.  Raviolis were interesting, filled with fruit, but seemed more of an appetizer.  Their notorious meatballs were great and very big, but again an appetizer which isn't supposed to be the highlight of the meal in my opinion.  The rest of the pasta dishes were fine but not spectacular which I would expect when paying $40+ per dish.  Wine menu and service were great but I still felt unimpressed as I walked out after the meal.  I was full and ate quality Italian, but at a place like that I expected to be transported to New York and I didn't feel that way after paying the bill.

UiSGUN1baWNFDUCtXO_lQQ.text: Sooo glad i ate here and not at the buffet next door. Got the antipasto platter($35) and since there was only 2 of us they kindly cut the portions in half($19), also had the shrimp and lobster diavolo and the ravioli purses. The diavolo was okay, but the purses were SO good. They are  definitely the dessert version of a ravioli.

1_j4WD6YYFxaISWHKwCWYg.text: Average, at best. Service was good, but as a NYer, clams & linguine was all garlic and nothing else. Hubby had pasta Marinara with Meatballs. Meatball was tasty and tender, but marinara was flavorless.

ePWXt2wXnA7cxCJTTTpauw.text: Robert the bartender was awesome!  So was the smoked onion butter. Meatballs too were delicious

BNt7W8M1Q278plx3D-N9Hw.text: I got the spinach ravioli which was very tasty! My husband got the meatball and pasta dish. We both found the food to be fresh tasting and seemingly authentic to an Italian joint in New York ... However, there wasn't a hostess to seat us or the other lovely couple hanging around.. So I had to go into the kitchen to get some help which was awkward as Rao's is supposed to be a somewhat fine dining experience.  Wait staff were good. My order wasn't right but they quickly resolved the matter. So I was content. I would go again. But with that being said, I have to add there are other Italian restaurants in Vegas that I would rather go to.

ZG7FUcw9RR-rBzHts0sN4g.text: Hands down best meal we had in Vegas.   Those meatballs kill me!   Matt was the best.   Classic NYC feel.  If you cannot get into the New York Raos (and you can't) come here

GBraotRkWXjM4VKOkzT2XQ.text: Had an excellent meal here! The caprese salad might just be the best I've ever had including in Italy! The mozzarella was so fresh and creamy. My boyfriend and I shared the rigatoni and the chicken scarpariello which was so tender and tasty. The wine specialist also recommended an excellent wine - I wish I could remember what it was... Will go to RAO's again!

gM4otvEoSMI-evBotvVx2w.text: No complaints whatsoever. Our waiter was extremely nice, he is the main reason I'm giving 5 stars. The restaurant itself is great, very nice setting with dim lighting. Our food was brought out pretty quickly and it all tasted great. Everybody loved their plates! Prices are a little high, but it's the average of what you'll find at any restaurant on the strip. Would definitely go back!

g2l1DFm8SAtWXujAlS5Mtw.text: The service was excellent as was the ambiance.  The food was ok. Not my best meal in Vegas.. we started with mozzarella en carrozza. Meh... nothing Special.  I had penne vodka....meh... have had much better.  My partner had linguine with clam sauce.  She said it was good.  I was hoping for a more flavorful meal.  Just your average spot.

0Qq-mEJ9xtseQ83mOtOgdQ.text: Sister Of NY Famos Rao's Restaurant . The smbince is good and the Food is adecuare but Not spectacular. To my mind Not good value for Your money. The apetizers were good but Not imaginative and the pasta were ordinary and mine was undercooked Service was excellent but slow and the music did not enhance the atmosfere!

Z3zjIeDwTy9elWgMARQMEA.text: Got there a little early, before anyone else showed up. We were greeted by unfriendly staff, almost went elsewhere honestly. I am so glad we didn't let the rude hosts ruin our amazing meal because, oh my god it was yummy!! The meatballs are to die for, and I would recommend you try the Ravioli Purses, they were absolute perfection!  Our Waiter was really on top of things too, very friendly, very helpful, and attentive. Can't wait to go back!

bcNNLPLUgkxk5-tZMskhLA.text: Only had 2 things here 3 seperate times. The prices here are pretty outrageous for Italian food which is easily some of the cheapest food ever to make. That aside  Seafood salad is incredible!, Next Lemon Chicken VERY GOOD the sauce is like pure lemon vinegar and really addicting and makes up for the chicken being slightly dry. I can make way better chicken on mesquite wood in my backyard. But their lemon "sauce" is great. Seafood salad you can order HALF ORDER even if the waiter or waitress tries to JAM you for the full portion. I have done it 3x and both the 2nd and 3rd time they tried to tell me "i have worked her XXXX years and we have never made half of one" AGAIN BS! ALSO half of one is great portion!  Definitely great 2 items. The rest of the menu is a major reamer so I will not even mess with it.

MpSW3Dgtnn92sWSBfgOkZg.text: I'd love to say that this was a great, authentic Italian pasta dinner, however, it was far from it. I've been lucky to have wonderful homemade pasta at restaurants near my home in the San Francisco Bay Area my entire life; and I'm fairly well versed on the cost of doing business in an upmarket arena, and I was shocked at both the quality of the pasta dishes my family ordered, and the price on them.  Our family ordered: Taglialini w/peas and ham, Ravioli, plain Taglialini w/butter (split between my 7yr old and 4yr old), and the special of the day (Parpadelle w/shrimp). The Taglialini w/butter was a whopping $26 for 3/4c. of boiled noodles tossed with butter, the Taglialini w/peas and ham $30 for an appetizer serving (1/2c. noodles with an equal amount of frozen peas and common ham), same price for my husband's ravioli (roughly 6-7 ravioli in red sauce), and the kicker was $39 for a bowl of under-seasoned Parpadelle w/5 medium shrimp (my 10yr old daughter's main course).  What should have been pasta with beautiful texture, signs of being hand-cut, and stuffed pasta that resembled something more than a frozen product, was just at best "Olive Garden" American food being passed off as authentic Italian. With such a let down on our last night in Las Vegas, I was incredibly grateful that we had an incredible service and meal experience at Gordon Ramsay's Steak the evening before.

jw3H6Zmu2DJA2opEZkOX0Q.text: I'm originally from NYC, and getting real deal Sicilian American food anywhere in the West is nearly impossible.  Thank goodness for Rao's.  As I am no rock star, I have not been fortunate enough to get into the original, but Rao's in Las Vegas is itself amazing.  Large, loud, lots of ambiance, and the staff is top notch.  Go there to eat a slow, lengthy, relaxing meal, talk, drink wine, and share a lot of courses and dishes, for goodness sake.  We skipped salads this time, but Baked clams are a must and are served exactly the way I remember them growing up in Brooklyn - plump, delicious, in a wonderful broth just made for dipping bread - if you haven't already finished the huge bread assortment with Rao's EVOO and balsamic. Remember, you need to pace yourself!  All of the pastas are awesome and just right for two people as a second course.  We had the spaghetti bolognese, very old school, and there was so much meat in the gravy, oh my, and you know by the depth of flavor that this cooked all day long to get it so sumptuous.  Still with plenty of room for our entrees, we passed on our usual choices - the monster veal parmesan chop that spills over the large plate on which it is served, my favorite shrimp fra diavolo, and even Rao's signature meat balls.  I wish we could have had them all!  Instead, we shared the crispy eggplant parmesan and the melt in your mouth veal short ribs, served with incredible polenta, and split a side order of spinach.  All to die for.    Stuffed, we still found room to share a cannoli, and sipped on expressos and sambucas to finish a PERFECT meal.  It's pricey, but hey, what what great things aren't.  Rao's is a must stop every time we come to Vegas.  No, I take that back.  We come to Vegas just to go to Rao's.  Maybe some day we will know someone who can get us into the original up in Harlem.

UdAhKJ-8ImFaQVrYaaoeVQ.text: We come here about 2-4 times a year and it's always great! We love the meatballs and I'm pretty consistent to get the shells with ricotta. We love their food and are always happy to grab a dinner here at Raos!

ImP3eZWEM2lmxC4GzoSvIw.text: Don't let this place fool you.  They boast of being a gluten free restaurant so we were looking forward to trying it.   When my wife asked for a gluten free menu, our waiter said they don't have one.  He said he could point out the items that were gluten free.  He said this soup and the salad without crutons, but none of the pastas.   Really, I could have figured that out ... salad without crutons was glueten free - duh.  We asked why they advertise they have glueten free options.  He said he had to go ask the chef.  We didn't even both to wait for an answer and left.   The employees were not that friendly either.  Proceed at your own risk, but I wont be dining here.

2cgXjJ3afc-EfGwdnsdqfw.text: It is very difficult not to give a 2 star but bumped it up to 3 stars mainly because the meatball are off the hook. Probably the best ever. The beet salad is excellent too. The cesar salad way too much salt. The osso bucco plain nasty. Linguine lacking. The New Service was terrible. So in conclusion based on the final bill we will not be going back.

a4_usoizWE_dryoHTZVQDw.text: This place is way overhyped. Had the lasagna, thinking the only other Location of this iconic NY Italian restaurant would excelling the classic. Wrong.  The noodles were mushy with no bite at all, the sauce was extremely salty. Good abundance of meat, though.  Wine selection is underwhelming in the $50-75 per bottle range--don't expect anything in bottles for less than that. The roasted beet/goat cheese salad was good, but plan to share. There are better restaurants in which to spend your money in Vegas (and at Caesar's) and I won't go back.

uu5vYhhNUWGFCTYJdSlHUQ.text: I ate here with my family when my relative was getting married!  We had a reserved dining room because it was a very special occasion and there were about ten people in our party.  Everyone had a great time!! The good was delicious and the service was excellent!  I love Rao's pasta sauces, now I can say that I love their restaurant'

ZOWvWbpNTeQhc5Cii6vTtA.text: Rao's is ok. The pasta was a bit overlooked. The sauce acceptable as is the meatball. The tiramisu is good.

IKksXPPxQpNcFu5nbxeoeA.text: In this place, words are deceiving.  "Sir, pasta is served family style so plenty to go around for you three."  One little plate of spaghetti to feed a munchkin is all that we received.     "Sir, the meatballs are as big as softballs." I showed him my hand and said "As big as a softball huh" he then replied "Well maybe a baseball."  This guy doesn't even know the size of his balls.  It was not the worst and not the best.    Across the way Beijing Noodle was awesome!!!!  Sincerely,  Softball Hands

XiQrkbh9l5U528psZOOJIA.text: "I'll eat anything if you are nice to me"...."and my favorite restaurant's are the one that are nicest to me"... So this place has a great culture and outstanding food!!! I am lucky enough to have been a number of times to Rao's New York, and what people don't realize is that what makes it great is not just the food, but the warmth with which you are treated from Frank Sr. and his crew. You feel like you are family in his home. And he is quite a singer, and treats his customers to that as well.  Well, I am not sure if Frank Jr. can sing, but he emits the same warmth as his dad. What a class act! And the staff was great. "Buffalo Mike" served me at the bar, and couldn't have been better. And the food was just as good as in NY.  They were filming for the food network while I was there, part of  "10 Best places to eat before you die". Watch it!  So what are you waiting for? You will feel right at home.

kUM2bSQX6doRfeYEVsuhKw.text: I cook with raos spaghetti sauce and will continue to but there food was forgettable. The service was slow and we waited 20 minutes between our appetizers and main course. The restaurant was busy but a las vegas restaurant should know how to clean a table and not leave 20 minutes between apps main course and desert. With all the good restaurants in vegas you can easily find a better meal than raos

g9ni0jpb-8kd_v2utdMiFQ.text: Great food!  The lemon chicken wasn't amazing but it was very good.  The meatballs and pasta were outstanding!  Recommended for anyone who wants to try the food but can't get reservations for the original in NYC.   They were also very accommodating and allowed us to order a half order of the pasta even though it was not on the menu.  The size of the portions are very large so you definitely want to come hungry.  Prepare to take home leftovers as well.

QJ264Zkt4toa6IUNPEKIuw.text: For the price, this was not a great dining experience. The wait staff was not particularly friendly, helpful, attentive, or memorable. I was very disappointed. I expected much more of a family type atmosphere, and I've felt more valued and welcome at Olive Garden. Recommendations were brief, with no explanation or passion into the suggestions. The waiter took the orders in a clockwise manner around the table, and did not take the ladies first, which I find inappropriate for a nice meal.   For as in a hurry as he was to take the orders, there was a lot of snappiness in the service. I have no problem with a nice slow paced meal, but this was not that. We waited an extraordinary amount of time to receive our check, too. If I remember correctly, we got stuck with a 20% auto-tip too. I don't mind auto-tip for parties over 6, but let's not assume 20%, okay?  The food was good, but not great. My veal was not particularly tender, which seems like would be the signature of veal. I paid the same amount for a lamb dish at Circo days later and they weren't even in the same league.  I had high hopes after seeing and hearing so much about Rao's, but I left very disappointed and I wouldn't recommend Rao's to you. I didn't expect it to be as good as the famous New York original (I've never been there), but a reasonable facsimile would have been nice.

cJkH9LLlQOi1Hadq3wcBoQ.text: We were super excited to dine @ Rao's Las Vegas as its impossible to get a reservation in the original New York location.  The decor had old world charm with wonderful atmosphere. We purchased a show package and chose Rao's with a pre fix menu. However, we were somewhat disappointed. My entree of Veal Piccata was delicious yet the baked clams were fishy. My husband ordered their famous Lemon Chicken and it was over whelming with lemon flavor.  He also ordered mozzarella en Corozza and overly fried.
